(NICAP, “[Six Lights Just Miss House](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650308mtairy_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014612377&usg=AOvVaw1wxTw8dKgYvaAqjvXaLj5_)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014612590&usg=AOvVaw3paQoAYn9PsHaWrlSJE16Z)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014612764&usg=AOvVaw24X6WZdr1FT70o2U8I4Yvh) p. 304)

March 15 — Around 1:00 a.m. James W. Flynn is deep in the Everglades in his swamp buggy, somewhere east of Immokalee, Florida, with his four hunting dogs. He sees a hovering object like an upside-down cone about 200 feet above some cypress trees slightly over a mile away. It moves back and forth from its original position.

Through binoculars it looks 25 feet high and 50 feet in diameter, with square windows emitting a yellowish glow. Around its base an orange-red glow extends downwards and illuminates the ground some 75 feet around the rim. Some 40 minutes into the sighting, Flynn decides to approach it in his buggy. A high-pitched ringing sound bothers one of his dogs. He stops 600 feet away and walks, waving his arms, toward the UFO, which is hovering 4 feet off the ground. A blast of wind from the object nearly knocks him off his feet. He continues, and at 75 feet from the UFO he waves his arms again. The object beams a light like a “welder’s torch” that hits his forehead. He blacks out twice. When he wakes up he is temporarily blinded. In the morning he finds a symmetrical circle of burned ground. The tops of trees are burned. Flynn makes his way to the home of Henry Osceola (or Henry Billy) later in the day and arrives at his own home in East Fort Myers on March 17 and spends 5 days in the hospital with damage to his right eye, bruises, burns, deep muscle tissue damage, and loss of hearing. His eye damage is permanent. The landing marks and burned trees are verified by the Lee County sheriff’s office. (NICAP, “[Everglades / James Flynn Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650315everglades_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014613206&usg=AOvVaw2wqejYnFGQfYEJuAts-VsD)”; Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014613486&usg=AOvVaw0bCEdOYczWQyj0NKBqFo_w), NICAP, 1969, pp. 12–16; Lorenzen, UFOs: The Whole Story, Signet, 1969, pp. 192–195; Clark III 438–440; Patrick Gross, “[UFO in the Everglades, USA 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/everglades65.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014613821&usg=AOvVaw1EDlw_BQ_tIfkOX8CooIrM)”)

March 17 — 10:00 p.m. Walter Jacobs, steward on the freighter Iron Duke, sees a bright orange object with a dent on top and a knot on the bottom off Newcastle, New South Wales. He takes a photograph but it is not published. (“[UAO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252003%252000%2520-%2520March-April.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014614279&usg=AOvVaw15x3PvqVrAno-sqpaSoplk) [Photographed Clearly in Australia,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252003%252000%2520-%2520March-April.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014614593&usg=AOvVaw3d6WIlzW-flhdba4kulPF9)” APRO Bulletin, March/April 1965, p. 1)

March 18 (or 21) — 7:06 p.m. Capt. Yoshiharu Inaba is flying a TOA Airlines Convair 240 from Osaka to Hiroshima, Japan, at an altitude of 6,500 feet. Just after the aircraft passes Himeji, Hyogo, an elliptical luminous object appears and follows the plane. Inaba makes a 60° turn to avoid a collision, but the object makes a similar maneuver then follows along the plane’s left wing for about 56 miles. Emitting a greenish light, the object affects the automatic direction finder and the radio. As copilot Tetsu Majima radios the Matsuyama control tower, he hears frantic calls from Joji Negishi, the pilot of a Tokyo Airlines Piper Apache, who says he is being chased by a luminous object over Matsuyama. The object shoots away and disappears. (NICAP, “[Object Paces Japanese](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650321osaka_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014615006&usg=AOvVaw2kahZxcIif1ayWDmlea6GS) [Airliner](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650321osaka_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014615273&usg=AOvVaw2FjsULSFjRhp3gIjrNdfv-)”; “[UFO Encounters over Japan,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/025%2520MAR-APR%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014615587&usg=AOvVaw2rOdvfX_GhuHESeKiEO-uo)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 1 (March/April 1965): 6; Timothy Green Beckley, “Saucers Chase Japanese Airliner,” Fate 18, no. 8 (August 1965): 32–35; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014615999&usg=AOvVaw2oH6CcPaqo_exQrK-Y-9Xo), pp. 150–153; Good Need, [p. 253](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/252/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014616244&usg=AOvVaw0aEt5GoxiTqm7Ll0YB__e_); Patrick Gross, “[Aircraft–UFO Encounters, Japan, March 18, 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/ja5131.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014616479&usg=AOvVaw0OSPv4Q46sUypGeCmsO6gY)”)

* * *

April 20 — John Carstairs Arnell, scientific advisor to the Canadian Chief of Air Staff, prepares a four-page “Suggested Statement by the Minister of National Defence,” [Paul Hellyer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Hellyer&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014616833&usg=AOvVaw2MkWYqK78FKac4Z3dHoNoa). It reiterates the US opinion that UFOs do not constitute a national security threat because most sightings involve natural phenomena seen by unreliable witnesses. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 16–23)

April 24 — 5:30 p.m. [Ernest Arthur Bryant](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://hatch.kookscience.com/wiki/Ernest_Arthur_Bryant&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014617207&usg=AOvVaw0HRmPa4qGw-NoSV4NbXDNM) is walking toward Scoriton Down near Scoriton (or Scorriton), Devon, England, when he sees a saucer-like object approach him. It stops nearby and a door opens. Three beings appear and beckon to him. He approaches the saucer. Two of the three beings appear to be nonhuman, but the third seems to be a youth in his teens. The youth speaks with an accent that Bryant thinks might be Russian and calls himself Yamski. He says that he is from Venus, and then remarks that he wished “Des” was there, as he would understand what is happening. At the close of their conversation, he says that in a month he will return and bring proof of “Mantell.” Ufologists who eventually hear the story immediately associate Yamski with [George Adamski](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014617522&usg=AOvVaw1nSzZOjOUa0lCwn7hwkBCD)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Adamski&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014617703&usg=AOvVaw3gpnVsmbwUIL1iIchNyv5S) the controversial contactee who died on April 23. Adamski was of Polish background and had a noticeable accent. If this were Adamski, he has lost any signs of aging. Adamski’s friend [Desmond Leslie](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Desmond_Leslie&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014617942&usg=AOvVaw0zJ0PJ-cpdvtOISFuoHndj) was a coauthor of his first book. Captain [Thomas F. Mantell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14958603/thomas-francis-mantell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014618207&usg=AOvVaw3wtFtGA4d46mjwvw7Ptvyv)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14958603/thomas-francis-mantell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014618422&usg=AOvVaw2vUkuDaQCZaENmbVJC2eak) piloting an F-51, had been killed in 1948 when he began chasing what he thought was a UFO. According to Bryant, the saucer returns June 7 and leaves some items, including several pieces of metal, allegedly from an F-51. He reports the story to the British UFO Research Association, which launches an investigation. The various items Bryant turns over to the two investigators (a turbine fitting, metal parts, a broken bulb and fitting, a phial containing silver sand, and a piece of paper on which the words “Adelphos Adelpho” are written) prove to be mundane and irrelevant to the F-51, according to aeronautical engineer [Leonard](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.isfdb.org/cgi-bin/ea.cgi?99973&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014618684&usg=AOvVaw1Ud5lPAToeuTh2zMoT4Y7_)

[G. Cramp](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.isfdb.org/cgi-bin/ea.cgi?99973&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014619008&usg=AOvVaw14tK5nrSN9vS3VVpurlan4)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.isfdb.org/cgi-bin/ea.cgi?99973&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014619193&usg=AOvVaw0Yk5wK_KQYnFv6-dHgc98N) In spite of problems with the story, one of the investigators, Eileen Buckle, rushes into print with a book, The Scoriton Mystery. Shortly afterward, Bryant unexpectedly takes ill and dies from a brain tumor on June 24, 1967. The other investigator, Norman Oliver, visits his widow. She says that she is familiar with the story in the book, as her husband had presented it to her first as the script for a science fiction novel. It is only after the investigation is well along that she realizes her husband was trying to sell the story as a real event. She indicates that the supposed items related to Mantell were purchased at a naval surplus store. Alice Wells, head of the Adamski Foundation, dismisses the Scoriton story from the beginning, as does Desmond Leslie. Between their rejection and Oliver’s uncovering of the hoax, few remain to support Bryant except Buckle. (Clark III 1040–1044; Story, [pp. 324–326](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/324/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014619580&usg=AOvVaw0d0a62pRrD63SEGeSMbhTY); Eileen Buckle, The Scoriton Mystery, Spearman, 1967; Norman Oliver, Sequel to Scoriton, The Author, 1968; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-24-04-uk-scoriton.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014619959&usg=AOvVaw3Wy8rM3sNlxAVPhR8beP6C)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-24-04-uk-scoriton.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014620170&usg=AOvVaw1DH4EwdzSxkRq-9OlR5BT6) August 19, 2006)

May — [Hayden C. Hewes](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cryptozoonews.com/hewes-obit/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014620514&usg=AOvVaw29EJU1YSpNGz_U4OEtssga)’s Interplanetary Intelligence of Unidentified Flying Objects publishes the first issue of the Interplanetary Intelligence Report, which lasts through September/October 1966. ([Interplanetary Intelligence](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Interplanetary%2520Intelligence%2520Report%2520(Hewes)/Interplanetary%2520Intelligence%2520Report%2520-%2520vol%25201%2520no%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014620931&usg=AOvVaw1-XAq57bOhpxoJArUz5OuY) [Report](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Interplanetary%2520Intelligence%2520Report%2520(Hewes)/Interplanetary%2520Intelligence%2520Report%2520-%2520vol%25201%2520no%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014621280&usg=AOvVaw1eeUYuPPOON3A24-E0BjNp) 1, no. 1 (May 1965))

May 1 — Pilots [Robert L. Stephens](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_L._Stephens&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014621622&usg=AOvVaw3vJFfZ0LfOPn8yxl4I1efP) and fire control officer Daniel Andre reach a speed of 2,070 mph in a Lockheed YF- 12A at Edwards AFB, California. The YF-12A also reaches an altitude record of 80,257 feet. (Wikipedia, “[Robert](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_L._Stephens&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014621899&usg=AOvVaw1q7Z6hQSF5R9_frrDk1MMw) [L. Stephens](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_L._Stephens&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014622119&usg=AOvVaw3SrEJbTQykVL7Hn9yHMFo4)”)

May 6 — 9:10 a.m. The crew of a US Navy ship in the Philippine Sea notices an aircraft approaching. At 9:14 a.m., the SPS-6C air search radar detects four targets at ranges up to 22 miles for the next 6 minutes at extremely high speed (3,500 mph), making various maneuvers. As seen through binoculars, they appear as three lighted objects, one of 1st stellar magnitude the others 2nd magnitude. The objects hover directly over the ship for 3 minutes.

There is no IFF response. One object to starboard appears larger on radar. The objects depart to the southeast at extremely high speed. (NICAP, “[Radar/Visual by U.S. Flag Ship in the Philippines](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650506philippines_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014622523&usg=AOvVaw2yb2lmnr98cN-6lISNovwp)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014622747&usg=AOvVaw0H3SpMfbsHHquFq5nahlzw), p. 305; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 93–94](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/92/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014623039&usg=AOvVaw06-rPKbgNdwM-mBy8MyOFF))

May 24 — 12:05 a.m. John Burgess, James Tilse, and Eric Judin are playing cards at the Epsom Retreat Hotel near Epsom, Queensland, when their attention is drawn to something on or near the ground. It appears to be a disc- shaped object with banks of lights underneath it to their southeast. Tilse estimates its diameter to be 30 feet, Judin as 20 feet, and Burgess as 6 feet. In the moonlight, its color seems to be charcoal. At times, it seems to approach them, then recede. Finally, it rapidly rises to about 300 feet, then it accelerates away to the northeast. Burgess and Judin heard a buzzing sound. Total duration is 40 minutes. Two days later, a circular depression is found nearby close to a telephone line. Tilse says that “tops of trees appear to be burned.” (“[The James Tilse Report,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CSep-Oct%252CV%252011%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014623413&usg=AOvVaw1CFFI0tpHcpG5z4w-Zdbo6)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1965): 13–14; Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014623765&usg=AOvVaw2vgmUKhwLY7VRwwnJxSEKa) [from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014624041&usg=AOvVaw0OvHqFOVFnL8m0OCIkrOVs)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014624276&usg=AOvVaw30eed1EMGciz8i5pCs44Fs) NICAP, 1969, p. 63; “[UAO Buzzes Hotel in Australia,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252001%252000%2520-%2520January-February.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014624608&usg=AOvVaw3T91YfdwJ21xZw8kJEqSqR)” APRO Bulletin, Jan./Feb. 1966, p. 3; Keith Basterfield, “[Cold Case Investigation: Eton Ridge, Queensland, 24 May 1965,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufos-scientificresearch.blogspot.com/2012/06/cold-case-investigation-eton-ridge.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014624969&usg=AOvVaw1rULWu9h7nkAN4MwyKW5iS)” Unidentified Aerial Phenomena— Scientific Research, June 13, 2012)

* * *

May 28 — 3:25 a.m. An Ansett-ANA DC-6b airliner piloted by Capt. John Barker is flying over Bougainville Reef off the coast of Queensland, Australia, when it is paced for 10–15 minutes by an oblate UFO with exhaust gases coming from it. The copilot and a stewardess also see the object. Barker takes photos of the UFO, but when he lands in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea, he is not allowed to have the film processed until he returns to Australia.

When he eventually arrives in Brisbane, he is flown directly to Canberra where both the film and the flight recorder are confiscated. The Directorate of Air Force Intelligence in Canberra later denies that any such incident took place. However, an official statement by Barker to the RAAF surfaces, in which he says: “I had always scoffed at these reports, but I saw it. We all saw it. It was under intelligent control, and it was certainly no known aircraft.” (Good Above, [pp. 168–170](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/168/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014625465&usg=AOvVaw3qSrJn4HQchlLzOKq23tNJ))

June — Systems analyst [Jacques Vallée](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Vall%25C3%25A9e&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014625855&usg=AOvVaw3N5-FWydLIOHAHrqSp1c_H) publishes Anatomy of a Phenomenon, which generates particular excitement for its sober, scientific treatment of the UFO phenomenon. Well reviewed, it plays a significant role in the renaissance of interest in UFOs as scientists express a willingness to examine the UFO problem. It is the first book by a working scientist to argue for the extraterrestrial hypothesis. (Jacques Vallée, [Anatomy of a](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/anatomyofphenome00vall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014626215&usg=AOvVaw3Ya7rUPIuiwGJtg8S2XZtP) [Phenomenon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/anatomyofphenome00vall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014626446&usg=AOvVaw1cdsTk5KOCfOBnhV75tBtU), Regnery, 1965; Clark III 1213)

June — 6:30 p.m. Mrs. J. Whitehead is in the garden at her cottage in Flasby, North Yorkshire, England, when a large disc-shaped object passes over, making a slight swishing noise. On the underside are three “windows” in a triangular formation. She feels a strange calming sensation as the UFO passes by. (Jenny Randles, “Fake Photographs, Real Sightings,” IUR 11, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1986): 11)

June 4 — During the [Gemini 4](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gemini_4&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014626981&usg=AOvVaw086GCboCfTp2VeWk1_wO1A) mission, astronaut [James McDivitt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_McDivitt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014627266&usg=AOvVaw2RBFgECkezDHqUzYUi22ZY) spots an object that he describes as a “white cylindrical shape with a white pole sticking out of one corner of it.” He takes two photos of it. His partner, [Ed White](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ed_White_(astronaut)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014627565&usg=AOvVaw0jF1XuGSkoAH7GUb236l3j), is asleep at the time. McDivitt maintains that it was some unknown but man-made piece of debris, while [James](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014627830&usg=AOvVaw1IwZESSWlI5Vej0LUSaQ03) [Oberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014628049&usg=AOvVaw0LqBlvD3WZqs9UW8lUwf-F)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014628224&usg=AOvVaw2jZ6DA1_mUfOQ8t9H_PHCK) flight controller at the Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas, argues that it is most likely the Titan II second stage of the craft. (“[‘Object’ Astronaut Sighted Still Unidentified,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/027%2520JUN-JUL%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014628498&usg=AOvVaw08n8SpDpJwIiepYZmJvU6i)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 3 (June/July 1965): 3; Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [pp. 212–213](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/212/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014628863&usg=AOvVaw2U2cAt6uDsvRTmwhR9jL9C); “[The Gemini IV Photograph,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CSep-Oct%252CV%252011%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014629117&usg=AOvVaw0iabnPkUQ46OD4b7sanFK7)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1965): 3; Condon, [pp. 205–207](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/204/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014629432&usg=AOvVaw2cxrndpZpNBNHeCx01CCAc); Good Above, [pp. 378–379](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/378/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014629711&usg=AOvVaw0MMpEhemIBupNoYPt59KWy); “[Gemini 4 Astronaut](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DBoQAadYEMwk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014629953&usg=AOvVaw1vNDnaW2zFbcplXB0Xi8_7) [James McDivitt UFO Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v%3DBoQAadYEMwk&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014630240&usg=AOvVaw2Rb7rMp7RuFXvBDpmUbES1)” SpaceTimeForum YouTube channel, June 9, 2013; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1965_06_04_SP_NICAP_McDivitt.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014630473&usg=AOvVaw2W7r0425MnYMZ753us2Z1D)\]; Lee Speigel, “[NASA UFO Files Revealed on Science Channel Special,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/nasa-ufo-science-channel-special_n_1380571&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014630761&usg=AOvVaw1oxwN2GlWyB4gGvMAL1c9c)” HuffPost, March 27, 2012; Patrick Gross, “[NASA Photographs of Unidentified Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/gemini465.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014631113&usg=AOvVaw3NCJfWWYQvuva9NY0x5uml)”)

June 7–8 — 7:50 p.m. Meteorological officer Jorge Stanich is performing a routine observation at the Argentinian Deception Station on Deception Island in the South Shetland Islands, Antarctica, when he notices a stationary, bright, yellow light at an altitude of 25° above the horizon. He estimates its distance at 1.2 miles. The object is visible for 5 seconds. Six and a half hours later, at 2:20 a.m., he again sees a stationary light in the northwest at an altitude of 40° above the horizon for 4 seconds. (Daniel A. Perisse, “[Deception Island UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/6507MufonSympap_87_Antartica.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014631497&usg=AOvVaw2Jwf9z148L-HWiq92yg1dT)” MUFON 1987 International UFO Symposium Proceedings, Mutual UFO Network, 1987, pp. 142–146)

June 18 or 20 — 4:20 p.m. The Commander of the Chilean Aguirre Cerda Research Station \[destroyed in 1967\] on Deception Island in the South Shetland Islands, Antarctica, [Mario Jahn Barrera](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Jahn_Barrera&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014631933&usg=AOvVaw1H2VCrSjowBW0HQzIuQUE5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mario_Jahn_Barrera&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014632138&usg=AOvVaw0VMpsXsCg3PyN8Acy3TBNN) together with Chilean Air Force pilot Lt. Benavidez, a meteorologist, and seven other witnesses, observe a UFO that maneuvers rapidly on an oscillating course for 25 minutes. (Good Above, [p. 309](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/308/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014632386&usg=AOvVaw3Xhe0GBs63w-VqW1s8gCGt); Daniel A. Perisse, “[Deception Island UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/6507MufonSympap_87_Antartica.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014632634&usg=AOvVaw08Kzjr7oQe9C0egUdVMG-p)” MUFON 1987 International UFO Symposium Proceedings, Mutual UFO Network, 1987, p. 146)

June 19 — 4:00 a.m. Two farm boys are stacking hay near Rocky, Oklahoma, when a bright white, circular, wingless craft appears and descends at a 45° angle to the height of nearby telephone wires. The apparent size of the full moon, it moves horizontally across the farmyard. It has numerous lights around the outside and appears to be rotating in a counterclockwise direction. Their dogs start barking at it. They believe it is going to crash, so they run back into the barn after 3 minutes. It is last seen over a small silo. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 104–106](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/104/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014633158&usg=AOvVaw0twURrJr6wK2UbnMVrUPNY))

June 25 — The Phoebus 1A nuclear rocket engine is tested at Area 25 of the Nevada Test Site as part of Project Rover. It runs at full power for 10.5 minutes. Unfortunately, the intense radiation environment causes one of the capacitance gauges to produce erroneous readings. When confronted by one gauge that says the hydrogen propellant tank is nearly empty, and another that says it is a quarter full, and unsure which is correct, the technicians in the control room choose to believe the one that says it is a quarter full. But the tank is indeed nearly empty, and the propellant runs dry. Without liquid hydrogen to cool it, the engine, operating at 2,000° C., quickly overheats and explodes. About a fifth of the fuel is ejected and most of the rest melts. The whole decontamination effort takes 400 people two months to complete, and costs $50,000. (Wikipedia, “[Project Rover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Rover%23Phoebus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014633556&usg=AOvVaw2Tag47GE1uHL5GySySI9lO)”)

June 25 — Frank Stavano and 24 other witnesses hear a loud, inexplicable explosion at his father Joseph’s farm near Carrollton, Ohio. Two days later, Joseph Stavano is cutting hay when he discovers a strange circular formation

* * *

from which the wheat is completely missing in the center for a diameter of 26 feet; at the edges the stubble is bent or broken outward at an angle of 20–30° from the horizontal. No other path leads into the circle but his own. Soil samples show no evidence of explosives or other foreign matter. (“[Photograph of Carrollton, Ohio, Ground Mark](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1980_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014634040&usg=AOvVaw3-PU9StmzFIq2CZcslmJ26) [Received at CUFOS,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1980_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014634307&usg=AOvVaw25sEdtqvlinsADnOwq-YG-)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 1, no. 6 (October 1980): 1–2)

July — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014634697&usg=AOvVaw2pjSBxTLSf5k_vxI_BLDSA) writes a letter to the Air Force calling for a systematic study of UFOs. He writes that “enough puzzling sightings have been reported by intelligent and often technically competent people to warrant closer attention than Project Blue Book can possibly encompass at the present time.” (J. Allen Hynek, “[Are Flying Saucers Real?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Saturday%2520Evening%2520Post/1966%252012%252017_Saturday%2520Evening%2520Post_Hynek.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014635137&usg=AOvVaw21wndJy6Av1c4YkBKDRsUG)” Saturday Evening Post, December 17, 1966, p. 20)

July — 11:30 p.m.–midnight. Talking on the phone in her second-floor bedroom in Lake Forest, Illinois, Pat Harvey sees a flash and hears a commotion or “rustle” outside. When she finishes the conversation, she looks out the window toward her neighbor’s lawn and sees a transparent bubble of light about 100 feet away. Inside the globe are several individuals who look like normal human beings, though slightly shorter (5 feet tall) and with skin that looks tanned. They are lying down in a somewhat haphazard arrangement. There are no visible instruments or seats. The object bobs up and down slightly, and the beings’ arms are moving in a way that reminds Harvey of “rowing motions.” (Clark III 277; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-07-usa-lakeforest.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014635669&usg=AOvVaw2vl7OBZWxmxHvg7BsPv7lY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-07-usa-lakeforest.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014635891&usg=AOvVaw21R7YLXPvZfiXGShknpJdz) June 21, 2008)

July 1 — 5:45 a.m. Maurice Masse is farming just north of Valensole, Alps-de-Haute-Provence, France, when he is startled by a whistling sound and sees an elliptical object resting on four legs some 200 feet away from him in his lavender field. Squatting on the ground near the object are two figures about the size of 8-year-old boys, apparently looking at a lavender plant. Masse approaches them to about 20 feet and the figures stand up. They are dressed in gray-green overalls and have smooth, pumpkin-like heads. Their eyes are large and slanted, their mouths have no lips and look like little holes. He hears some grunting sounds, and Masse hints that there is a telepathic communication. One of the figures points a pencil-like object at Masse and he is paralyzed. They enter the UFO through a door and the object shoots off at enormous speed with a whistling sound. It takes Masse another 20 minutes to regain control. Tracks left by the landing gear are found later by Masse and confirmed by gendarmes. (Wikipedia, “[Rencontre de Valensole](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rencontre_de_Valensole&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014636265&usg=AOvVaw0R6z6xXJPDrgNcc_UnDrqQ)”; NICAP, “[Humanoids near Elliptical Object with Legs on](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650701valensole_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014636497&usg=AOvVaw1RyfEyLQcWz4ngzZ7wzBJI) [Ground](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650701valensole_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014636708&usg=AOvVaw1Qwtqmig2Kdss2Jb0IWkhr)”; Clark 1205–1207; Good Above, [pp. 133–134](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/132/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014636939&usg=AOvVaw0kKpFmmHzPuRv3Krc4Zdlo); G.E.P.A. Investigation, “[The Significant Report from](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CNov-Dec%252CV%252011%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014637185&usg=AOvVaw38ikybEVLYipR49QVmZ3Cs) [France,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CNov-Dec%252CV%252011%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014637442&usg=AOvVaw1zP8-AySt8aDq_MfnN46BX)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1965): 5–6; Aimé Michel, “[The Valensole Affair,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CNov-Dec%252CV%252011%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014637750&usg=AOvVaw1fUVkLDl2VV8cKbQSmLy1d)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1965): 7–9; Luis Schönherr, “[Luis Schönherr’s Questionnaire,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014638176&usg=AOvVaw0A-RP7j3gSubHXkrm2BPl5)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 3 (May/June 1966): 21; G.E.P.A. Representative, “[A Tentative Reply to Luis Schönherr’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014638717&usg=AOvVaw0xt2iaTb5gvMfsBnFxwROA) [Questionnaire,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014639113&usg=AOvVaw0HUK71bxuucABsqHwm8PZA)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 3 (May/June 1966): 22–23; Aimé Michel, “[Valensole—Further](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014639594&usg=AOvVaw0A508Co5fxhPk6bVFmjrXQ) [Details,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014639975&usg=AOvVaw3uS5S-ANeiUi1auVQIk1ZH)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 3 (May/June 1966): 24–25; Aimé Michel and Charles Bowen, “[A Visit to](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201968%2520V%252014%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014640443&usg=AOvVaw3iriWOAi-4J7DKNmYOjRLN) [Valensole,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201968%2520V%252014%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014640800&usg=AOvVaw2cGoA-QCghC4Z0HAEmYC2j)” Flying Saucer Review 14, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1967): 6–12; Kim Hansen, “UFO Casebook,” UFOs 1947– 1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 66–69; Patrick Gross, “[Close Encounters of the 3rd Kind: Valensole, France,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/valensole1965.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014641342&usg=AOvVaw1IuAGicR75m5vvaSS8NSHK) [1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/valensole1965.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014641709&usg=AOvVaw3tbpBrcRIZG3tCxYL6PE6O)”)

July 2 — 7:15 p.m. Five garrison members of the British Antarctic Station B \[abandoned in 1969\] on Deception Island in the South Shetland Islands, Antarctica, have a UFO sighting while conducting routine meteorological observations. The witnesses see a light in the north quadrant, zigzagging, hovering, and accelerating at times, and maintaining altitudes between 20° and 45° above the horizon. The light is green and red, at times yellow, and is observed for perhaps 15–20 minutes. The edges of the light resemble those of a bright star. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014642368&usg=AOvVaw1zpuZTPSwRKlcdF3eFTuFH), pp. 153– 155; Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [p. 162](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/n201/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014642835&usg=AOvVaw0ZfbkU8yn8z-Te8bQxbf2D); Good Above, [p. 309](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/308/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014643202&usg=AOvVaw0d7jBcqgoV8oaCwSUMk7jN); Daniel A. Perisse, “[Deception Island UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/6507MufonSympap_87_Antartica.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014643603&usg=AOvVaw3IjEOasP6sUHjMI0wVbN9k)” MUFON 1987 International UFO Symposium Proceedings, Mutual UFO Network, 1987, p. 146; Richard H. Hall, “[UFO Sightings at Scientific Stations in Antarctica, July 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/650703rep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014644081&usg=AOvVaw09atxr4kFkb59N7BV6qaaX)”)

July 3 — 5:03 p.m. Two meteorologists at the Argentine Orcadas Base on Laurie Island in the South Orkney Islands, Antarctica, observe for 15 seconds a round, bluish-white object moving east to west on a parabolic path. Two variometers (magnetic field measuring instruments) register sudden and strong disturbances. ([Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014644693&usg=AOvVaw0WROI9C748dWiph77J5PY9), pp. 153– 155; Daniel A. Perisse, “[Deception Island UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/6507MufonSympap_87_Antartica.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014645109&usg=AOvVaw36FXoNVGS_b5MHUlZVgmZ-)” MUFON 1987 International UFO Symposium Proceedings, Mutual UFO Network, 1987, pp. 147, 153; Richard H. Hall, “[UFO Sightings at Scientific Stations in](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/650703rep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014645592&usg=AOvVaw1mXgpS9OK1YkRC_oqaOr3_) [Antarctica, July 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/650703rep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014645946&usg=AOvVaw208uzEjfUvHZGzwoYeFj3V)”)

July 3 — 7:20 p.m. The meteorologist and eight other witnesses at the Chilean Aguirre Cerda Station \[destroyed in 1967\] on Deception Island, Antarctica, watch for a total of 20 minutes a bright and apparently solid object zigzagging from the east quadrant to the south quadrant. It maintains an altitude above the horizon between 35 and 20 degrees. It is white and star-like with some orange hues. (Daniel A. Perisse, “[Deception Island UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/6507MufonSympap_87_Antartica.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014646489&usg=AOvVaw3IxqunSCEuCs6m67uOI3YG)” MUFON 1987 International UFO Symposium Proceedings, Mutual UFO Network, 1987, pp. 147, 153–154; Richard H. Hall, “[UFO Sightings at Scientific Stations in Antarctica, July 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/650703rep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014646936&usg=AOvVaw3jS-dsUKNEr1EyYwpibXrz)”; Good Above, [p. 309](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/308/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014647280&usg=AOvVaw2ABgp8GuDLBI2aBjRIlifc))

July 3 — 7:42 p.m. 17 people (including three visiting Chilean personnel) observe a lens-shaped disc that maneuvers erratically across the sky for about an hour at the Argentine Deception Station in the South Orkney Islands, Antarctica. The object changes colors (red, yellow, green, orange, blue, white) as it zigzags from a position about 30° above the horizon in the north-northwest. The object hovers, accelerates, reverses direction, and changes its luminosity. At times it goes behind some clouds, but it is also seen in front of some cirrus clouds. Finally, it disappears to the northwest, decreasing in size and gaining altitude. Cpl. Uladislao Duran Martinez takes 10 color photos through theodolite and field glasses. (“[Chile, Argentina Confirm UFO Films,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/028%2520AUG-SEPT%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014647935&usg=AOvVaw07yUi7pLFg2suG-r2uZHel)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 4 (Aug./Sept. 1965): 2; Dan Lloyd, “[Things Are Hotting Up in the Antarctic,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CSep-Oct%252CV%252011%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014648428&usg=AOvVaw1WU3L7-J4rMxSyuU5gjZtA)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1965): 4–5; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014648901&usg=AOvVaw0X1krUckrEqtp4g571kDx2), pp. 155–159; Daniel A. Perisse, “[Deception Island UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/6507MufonSympap_87_Antartica.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014649272&usg=AOvVaw3zhHwyo1Sm5TikxQQt_nW-)” MUFON 1987 International UFO Symposium Proceedings, Mutual UFO Network, 1987, pp. 147, 154; Richard H. Hall, “[UFO Sightings at Scientific Stations in Antarctica, July 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/antarctica/650703rep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014649692&usg=AOvVaw2iS3GbyL8AVVBci18LqpJ7)”; Good Above [pp. 309–310](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/308/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014650012&usg=AOvVaw1rfZC_CN2QgR5XeTlQSGo-); Condon, [pp. 99–100](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/98/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014650356&usg=AOvVaw0fRMy7fkAH0AGeYKu1d3gf))

July 6 — 6:52 p.m. Chief Mate Torgrim Lien of the Norwegian ship TT Jawesta watches a star-like UFO through binoculars in the North Atlantic Ocean about 900 miles southwest of the Azores. He, the captain, and other officers see an intense blue, fiery tongue of light approaching the ship at tremendous speed. As it gets closer, he sees it is a cigar-shaped UFO with a row of square windows. (“[‘Cigar’ Passes a Few Hundred Feet above](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014650926&usg=AOvVaw1JcV_6axRuWVGAFl25mvS9) [Norwegian Ship,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014651320&usg=AOvVaw2fPB9TMiU6CnNtCSfzXuzP)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1966): 32)

July 9 — 4:30 p.m. A white cylindrical object is seen flying over Santa Maria Island in the Azores islands, Portugal. All electric clocks at the Santa Maria Airport stop when the object passes overhead. Weather personnel and other witnesses all agree that the UFO is at an altitude of 24,000–30,000 feet. At no time does it make any sound.

According to witnesses, the clocks stop at the same time the UFO reaches the zenith directly over the airport. Attempts to identify it are unsuccessful. (NICAP, “[Clocks at Airport Stopped When UFO Passes Over](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650709azores_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014651836&usg=AOvVaw3fQNsdi2cKl0U43lf6VgsQ)”; “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252009%252000%2520-%2520September-October.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014652143&usg=AOvVaw2_Kwm4mlwfktL8Lk23Y8km) [Portuguese UAOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252009%252000%2520-%2520September-October.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014652549&usg=AOvVaw0SMOolNRbyfPaguwzJ0dOL)” APRO Bulletin, Sept./Oct. 1965, p. 7; “United Press International Reports on Two UFOs,” Fate 18, no. 11 (November 1965): 59–61; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014653132&usg=AOvVaw1GSacVzDXE3CBsQAoz0LTj), pp. 160–162)

July 9 — 10:00 p.m. Connie Wolferd and other residents of Bunker Hill, Lebanon County, Pennsylvania, watch a clam- shaped object, about 10 feet in diameter, with red lights around its rim hover above some nearby trees. Wolferd is sitting on the porch listening to the radio when it suddenly stops functioning. The living room lights flicker (although fluorescent lights in the kitchen and bathroom do not), and a neighbor’s loud TV suddenly stops. She hears something making a “bleep-bleep” sound, looks up, and sees the object. Neighbors find the leaves of nearby trees are singed. (“[Bunker Hill Girl Tells of Seeing Unidentified Flying Objects in July,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/30390239/the-daily-news/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014653585&usg=AOvVaw3Te8Yqo16feEhKFAV9nNyY)” Lebanon (Pa.) Daily News, August 10, 1965, p. 20; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014654087&usg=AOvVaw2seD0Gwi3FZTkO3-R2dAk3), pp. 177–178)

July 12 — 4:30 a.m. Laura de Freitas Machado Fernandes gets up to go to the well for some water at her home in Porto, Portugal, near the Porto Airport. She notices a luminous red object shaped like a cardinal’s hat coming from the west at high speed. It stops in mid-air and hovers above some nearby woods, rocking back and forth. She rushes back to warn her husband, Manuel Fernandes. They notice that their radio set has started making a loud noise. They estimate the object is about a quarter-mile away. Its top part is orange, and on its brim is a flickering red light. They watch it for 3 minutes before it takes off to the north at full speed. The radio goes back to normal. (“[The Portuguese UAOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252009%252000%2520-%2520September-October.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014654776&usg=AOvVaw09I-ZgkIgbPzgU5F6-Jd8t)” APRO Bulletin, Sept./Oct. 1965, pp. 3, 7; “United Press International Reports on Two UFOs,” Fate 18, no. 11 (November 1965): 59–61; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014655455&usg=AOvVaw3EGIUFqYluO0rmN7EgAY6o), pp. 162–167)

July 15 — 11:00 a.m. An object descends near the Canberra Deep Space Communication Complex in Tidbinbilla, Australian Capital Territory, interfering with its tracking of Mariner 4. It is also observed by control tower operators at Canberra Airport. (“[Canberra Incident,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CSep-Oct%252CV%252011%252CN%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014655961&usg=AOvVaw2Y5Snv-nIt4zbHEgXBaP3u)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1965): 18–19; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014656474&usg=AOvVaw2aa3wCRK_k-QbiU3NSl_KT)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014656821&usg=AOvVaw34Lk_PbE-hrcoICCAlw-yC) pp. 167–169; Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [p. 106](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/92/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014657258&usg=AOvVaw00yDpcyTO10YOxgzwFit7a); Randall C. Hecker, “Did UFO Sabotage Mariner IV?” Fate 20, no. 5 (May 1967): 32–37)

July 19 — 5:30 p.m. [Denis Crowe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/flying-saucer-mr-denis-crowe-of-vaucluse-shown-standing-at-news-photo/1078702858&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014658118&usg=AOvVaw36UVF7YALeE6JR7Dt_m8dT)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/flying-saucer-mr-denis-crowe-of-vaucluse-shown-standing-at-news-photo/1078702858&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014658528&usg=AOvVaw1PfwbZAwi8-iOcIGcxD4iz) an aircraft artist, is strolling along a beach at Vaucluse, New South Wales, when he encounters a glowing disc resting on legs. It is about 20 feet in diameter and 9 feet high. The top and bottom are silver gray and the rim in between is glowing greenish-blue. A hollow area at the very top seems to be a glass dome. There are no windows or antennae. Dogs in the neighborhood all bark at it. When Crowe is 50–60 feet from the object, it takes off with a sound like air forced from a balloon. He watches it for about 10 seconds until it disappears into the clouds. After the object takes off, the dogs are strangely silent. (NICAP, “[Glowing Disc on](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650719vaucluse_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014658923&usg=AOvVaw1doiCdA8TnCqCAprxV2u07) [Legs Freaks Dogs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650719vaucluse_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014659224&usg=AOvVaw1CFdRIymH0CGD0ywhwNYml)”; Bill Chalker, “Tully Saucer Nests of 1966, Part Two,” IUR 23, no. 1 (Spring 1998): 16–17; Good Above, [p. 531](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/530/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014659660&usg=AOvVaw16SohdzEaskJweqVbmWfWn))

July 26 — 9:35 p.m. Astronomers Robert Vitolniek, Ian Melderis, and Esmeralda Vitolniek at the Baldone Astrophysical Observatory in Latvia are observing noctilucent clouds when they see a star-like object drifting slowly westwards. Through binoculars the light seems to be sharply defined, and through a telescope it looks like an array of three greenish lights around a larger, central sphere. After 20 minutes, the three smaller lights move away from the central one, and they disappear into the distance at 10:00 p.m. (Felix Ziegel, “[Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id%3Duc1.31210023618901%26view%3D1up%26seq%3D103%26skin%3D2021&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014660189&usg=AOvVaw2wNNtxIcHdDWT2-12yMMnO)” Soviet

Life, no. 137 (February 1968): 27; Hobana and Weverbergh 286–287; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23astronomers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014660677&usg=AOvVaw1sKakEMXY1ZriJLIUHrfkP) [Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23astronomers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014660939&usg=AOvVaw3sQpSOsFX5S9Z-ONbsgxsb)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 60–61)

July 26 — Night. Adilon Batista de Azevedo, 14, leaves home with two friends to go to a movie theater on the outskirts of Carazinho, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. When they pass a vacant lot on Rua David Canaberra between the Rua 15 de Novembro and the Rua Alexandra de Motta, they see a light beam coming from a cloud illuminating an area about 33 feet in diameter and hear a buzzing noise. The other boys run, but Adilon remains and sees an oval- shaped object landing in the vacant lot and hovering about 3 feet off the ground. Another smaller object descends and hovers next to the first. Two beings about 5 feet tall emerge from the larger object and walk around it. They are wearing dark clothing and light helmets. After 5 minutes, 3 others emerge from the smaller object and converse with the others. The beings reenter the objects, which take off several minute apart. Adilon gets a headache that remains with him for 5 days. Possible helicopters? (“[Research in Brazil,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Brazil/SBEDV/SBEDV%2520-%2520No%2520045-47%2520-%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014661436&usg=AOvVaw3RYP__LfE1cLjGK6zlhuqW)” SBEDV Boletim, no. 45– 47 (July/Dec. 1965): 7–9; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-07-26-brazil-carazinho.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014661745&usg=AOvVaw22up5xgMhenb87fMSVGNKO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-07-26-brazil-carazinho.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014661952&usg=AOvVaw0O3AvzxY7y-yKgBwPfdijS) April 6, 2008; Brazil 73–74)

July 28 — 9:40 p.m. A USAF Reserve major and his wife observe a manta ray–shaped object fly almost directly overhead at Carswell AFB \[now Naval Air Station Fort Worth Joint Reserve Base\], Fort Worth, Texas, below 1,000 feet altitude. The object moves at a constant speed on the same course. The object is approximately 40 feet long and has two brilliant white lights pulsating off and on once every second. It is completely silent and flies directly through the Carswell control zone at low altitude. The sighting is verified by three other persons on duty. The report states: “This sighting was a positive observation, under ideal circumstances, of a definite object of an unconventional nature—possibly of foreign origin, which could be a threat to national security.” (NICAP, “[RAPCON Fails to Identify Low Flying Manta Ray](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650728carswell_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014662351&usg=AOvVaw2TvDiL8atDoVB3PN582JTW)”)

July 31 — 1:05 a.m. Wynnewood, Oklahoma, police officer Lewis Sikes, 29, reports a UFO to the northeast. A little later, simultaneous radar fixes are obtained at Tinker AFB in Oklahoma City and Carswell AFB \[now Naval Air Station Fort Worth Joint Reserve Base\], Fort Worth, Texas. Both Tinker and Carswell track the object to a point 15 miles southwest of Tinker when it disappears. A few minutes later, it is tracked to a point 29 miles south of Tinker when it is lost again. (NICAP, “[Gnd/Visual and AF Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650731wynnewood_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014662710&usg=AOvVaw0Q-uTe68ZK6YRdLbXKE-aK)”)

August 1 — 1:30–4:30 a.m. Various personnel from Francis E. Warren Air Force Base west of Cheyenne, Wyoming, report more than 70 UFOs near the base’s ICBM Minuteman I launch control facilities (LCFs) and launch facilities (LFs, missile silos). A Lieut. Anspaugh logs the reports and incoming telephone calls for three hours. The reports begin with a “large circular object emitting several colors but no sound” seen by civilians over Cheyenne itself at 1:30 a.m. This results in an alert at the base for all personnel to be on the watch for anything suspicious. Five objects are spotted over the Sioux Army Depot \[now closed\] in Sydney, Nebraska, at 1:45 a.m. Two UFOs are seen over the Echo LCF southeast of Pine Bluff at 1:48 a.m. Nine more objects are sighted at 2:50

a.m. The Echo LCF reports six UFOs stacked vertically. A Strategic Air Command team at the H-2 LF northeast of Gurley reports a white UFO directly overhead at 3:00 a.m. The Sioux Army Depot reports five objects going east at 3:35 a.m. Reports of white, round- or oval-shaped objects in various formations, continue solidly at the H- 2 LF for the next 40 minutes. At 4:05 a.m., the Warren base commander calls to say that the Quebec LCF southwest of Chugwater has nine UFOs in sight: four to the NW, three to the NE, and two over Cheyenne. Sightings continue to be reported the next two nights at missile sites assigned to Warren AFB, for a total of 148 objects seen by 143 combat defense force airmen, missile maintenance men, and NCOs. The sheer scope and blatant ostentation of the UFOs’ reported aerial displays over a sensitive atomic missile base is remarkable. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 209–211](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/208/mode/2up?q%3DSaucedo&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014663277&usg=AOvVaw0POnGLMdVA4Rln0zyUFISl); Robert L. Hastings, “[Remarkable Reports](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/pdfs/missiles.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014663505&usg=AOvVaw3u85khHUCeqPT92jzEFEgV) [from the Missile Field,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/pdfs/missiles.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014663706&usg=AOvVaw0VFKn_NrjmoVGm1r5djJL1)” IUR 32, no. 1 (August 2008): 8–14, 23–27; Robert L. Hastings, “[Yet Another Nuclear](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/index.php/articles/yet-another-nuclear-missile-launch-officer-talks-about-ufos-at-f-e-warren-afb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014664046&usg=AOvVaw3Or8LPjwiHxFgtP4RazoeA) [Missile Launch Officer Talks about UFOs at F. E. Warren AFB,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufohastings.com/index.php/articles/yet-another-nuclear-missile-launch-officer-talks-about-ufos-at-f-e-warren-afb&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014664348&usg=AOvVaw1IlyLZxNypW_rgbwaAochP)” UFOs & Nukes, February 5, 2012; Nukes 223– 238)

August 1 — 8:08 p.m. The Oklahoma Highway Patrol starts receiving 25–30 visual sightings of UFOs, many by police and highway patrol troopers from Purcell north to Norman to Chandler and back south through Meeker and Shawnee, Oklahoma. The sightings continue through dawn and vary from one to four objects that start and stop, often having a red color and varying to a white and blue luster. (NICAP, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/650730wynnewood_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014664704&usg=AOvVaw0m13uOzGJ_Y4Ac2uwp3xnf)\])

August 1 — 9:08 p.m. Four objects, bluish-white with a red haze, are seen from the control tower at Tinker AFB, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. T/Sgt [John R. Lang](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17272560/john-robert-lang&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014665060&usg=AOvVaw3vQQ0NnwmmW_G2EBPYt4Q8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17272560/john-robert-lang&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014665280&usg=AOvVaw0p4t3dzEPlGz5TeoY2EhkS) 34, is the watch supervisor. All the objects appear at approximately 22,000 feet altitude. One is moving south, and another is moving north at speeds of 150–200 mph. Two of the objects appear stationary. The 746th Aircraft Control and Warning Squadron reports radar contact with one object at 10,000 feet in the vicinity of Norman, Oklahoma, 20 miles south of Tinker AFB. The duration is 90 minutes. An Air Force weather observer, who wishes to remain anonymous, looks at a UFO through his

* * *

40x-telescope at Oklahoma City. It is tilted about 45° then straightens out. “It looked like Saturn with a flat top and flat bottom.” (NICAP, “[Four Lights Observed, Radar Contact on One](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650801tinker_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014665650&usg=AOvVaw22Y86NPhmTWjYAuW5yBaNW)”; “[UFOs Leave Local](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95149492/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014665870&usg=AOvVaw1d5ROjtrLlTYMuXPhEY3sc) [Radar Tracks,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95149510/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014666071&usg=AOvVaw0eyS-cs11xD1LaVnYoqFnb)” Wichita (Kan.) Beacon, August 2, 1965, pp. 1–2; “[Radar Didn’t Detect](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/17469788/1965-minnesota-ufo-sightings-part-of-a/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014666374&usg=AOvVaw0gBgf6RXUr9JfptgIzHMpv) [UFOs Spotted in Area,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/17470106/1965-minnesota-ufo-sightings-part-of-a/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014666617&usg=AOvVaw2O_XtIl6LKw3lDOuNU5p8Y)” Minneapolis Star, August 3, 1965, pp. 1, 4)

August 1 — Night. A TWA Boeing 707 airliner flying west of Topeka, Kansas, picks up 12–15 targets on Air Intercept Radar flying toward them at high speed on a 50-mile scope. They change to a 20-mile scope and observe the objects approaching in formation. The pilot, copilot, and engineer all witness this clearly. The aircraft passes the objects but cannot see them visually. Two films of the scopes are taken. (NICAP, “[707 Picks Up 12–15 Targets](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650801topekadir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014666980&usg=AOvVaw0bY9K0jdEfke_q4aEtvfEw)”)

August 1 — Night. Two rookie police officers in Caldwell, Kansas, speed toward the airport to investigate local sightings when they see an egg-shaped machine about 300 feet long hovering above the ground. They try to get closer, but it disappears behind a hedgerow and shuts its lights off. They return the next day, but find no traces. (“[Caldwell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95149436/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014667285&usg=AOvVaw2w7OnN2OkH2M0PwvYGwFSS) [Officers Are ‘Believers’ Now,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95149436/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014667500&usg=AOvVaw1YNprJDlobXkzPOtT9rQZw)” Wichita (Kan.) Beacon, August 2, 1965, p. 1; Jerome Clark, “[The Greatest Flap](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014667790&usg=AOvVaw21ZY1sQbf_B9MqZB1EVnmP) [Yet?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014668045&usg=AOvVaw0C1sqBDB-pIykCXbJxWrsp)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1966): 27–28)

August 2 or 3 —1:30 a.m. Mr. A. L. Smith, accompanied by his 14-year-old son Alan and three other witnesses, watch an unusual, multicolored UFO over Tulsa, Oklahoma. The UFO is slowly moving toward the witnesses. Still several hundred yards away, it pauses briefly and hovers. At that precise moment, Alan snaps a photograph with his inexpensive camera, using ASA 64 film. Alan decides not to try for a second shot. He takes his camera inside the house and runs back outside just in time to see the object rapidly flying away into the night sky. The photo is a probable fake of a color wheel for an aluminum Christmas tree. (NICAP, “[The Smith / Tulsa Photo Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650802tulsa_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014668443&usg=AOvVaw0o3m8YzNP9FyYAL_1tszP6)”; Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, p.147; Larry Robinson, “[The Tulsa Photo,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://midimagic.sgc-hosting.com/howituls.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014668728&usg=AOvVaw1EKsAOIDycSPgWX3ZLC36t)” MidiMagic, October 25, 2016; Patrick Gross, “[Project Blue Book](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/bluebookpics9966.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014668965&usg=AOvVaw192CJw5_tsNUNmcRfEXwUq) [Case 9966](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/bluebookpics9966.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014669182&usg=AOvVaw2O-jpNYyOflCD7qaw0czd5)”)

August 2 — Project Blue Book puts out an official USAF press release declaring the majority of the sightings on August 1 are “most likely” due to the planet Jupiter and the stars Rigel, Capella, Betelgeuse, and Aldebaran, “clearly visible in the eastern sky.” But astronomer Robert Risser of the Kirkpatrick Planetarium in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, counters that Jupiter and the four stars are “on the opposite side of the earth” at the time of the sightings. (“[Mystery Flying Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95113046/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014669489&usg=AOvVaw0FCaiIo4Ld2pvGNZ293BCv) [‘Seen’ in Eight States,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95113212/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014669774&usg=AOvVaw02ehm2KzQR0_JDBGkJmNXm)” Los Angeles Times, August 3, 1965, p. 1; Clark III 388)

August 2 — 2:30 a.m. Unidentified blips show up on the Weather Bureau radar screen at the Wichita Municipal Airport \[now Wichita Dwight D. Eisenhower National Airport\] in Kansas and continue intermittently until after 6:00 a.m. Most of the sightings are in the vicinity of Wellington, Kansas. The altitude ranges from 5,000–20,000 feet.

Wichita meteorologist John Shockley tracks several UFOs on the Weather Bureau radar flying at altitudes of 6,000–9,000 feet. His assistant [Ellis Pike](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28578248/ellis-dean-pike&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014670279&usg=AOvVaw0RnqqPwYso0OymMa8727p1) notes that they look just like airliner blips. They brighten and dim on the screen, moving at 45 mph. At least four citizens see colored glows in the southern sky during the early morning hours. One says: “They were red and exploded in a shower of sparks and at other times fluttered like a leaf in the clear sky.” (NICAP, “[Weather Radar Blips and Sky Glows](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650802wichita_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014670563&usg=AOvVaw1aSVzM9JD-E_QCetmuV_9v)”; Condon, [pp. 158–160](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/158/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014670808&usg=AOvVaw3qGwXSJBiHaYxi4-RIB-kq))

August 2 — 3:00 a.m. KXWI-TV news photographer Robert Campbell hears on his radio a conversation between Oklahoma and Texas highway patrolmen that a UFO has been tracked on radar and is streaking towards the Texas border. Campbell takes his 4-by-5 Speed Graphic camera and drives into Sherman, Texas, where he locates Chief of Police Peter McCollum. Together they search for the object and soon see it hanging stationary one mile east of Bells on US Highway 82. The object has a “Mercury capsule” shape at one end, possibly rounded at the other end. Several distinct bands circle the cylinder, with disc-shaped embossments on the surface. He takes four camera exposures, two minutes each at three-minute intervals. The negatives are carefully examined by USAF scientific advisers and astronomical experts. No acceptable explanation can be found for the object recorded on the negatives. (NICAP, “[The Sherman, Texas, Photo Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650802sherman_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014671149&usg=AOvVaw2AutmbLLJOkmYLE8Vsi10_)”; “[Sherman 1965,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellbooks.com/museum/?page_id%3D657&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014671367&usg=AOvVaw2-qc3lpVuXuZrirZgTS5nc)” Texas UFO Museum and Research Library, February 5, 2014; Patrick Gross, “[The Sherman Case, Texas, USA, 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/sherman65.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014671599&usg=AOvVaw2Zs4HKgQDLbwCuOh6VY3FC)”)

August 2 — The crew of the Russian steamship Raduga in the Red Sea watch a fiery sphere emerge from the water 2 miles away, causing an enormous pillar of water to rise and collapse. It hovers above the surface at an altitude of 490 feet. A motorboat with six Arab fishermen is in the area and also sees the object, which is apparently 200 feet in diameter. The object shoots straight up, and the boat is hit by a strong wave that overturns it. (Stonehill and Mantle, Russia’s USO Secrets, Flying Disk, 2020, pp. 59–60)

August 2 — As they patrol near Eagle Mountain Lake, two Tarrant County, Texas, deputy sheriffs see an object as bright as burning magnesium land. An extensive investigation by police finds no traces. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014672064&usg=AOvVaw0-aIZ9N02PHsh-Am3aO4Hc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014672254&usg=AOvVaw1qb_w2t05yTR63nSSnAfau) p. 306)

August 3 — 12:37 p.m. Los Angeles County Highway Accident Investigator [Rex Heflin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/reports/Goodbye_Rex_Heflin.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014672561&usg=AOvVaw0D_rFA9LNy5mEHio4Uxn3e) takes four clear Polaroid photos of a hat-shaped UFO on a lonely stretch of road near Santa Ana, California. The object is silent, and a beam of white light is rotating beneath it. He radios his supervisor, but the radio goes dead. One of Heflin’s coworkers offers to send the photos to Life magazine; he does, but Life declines to use them. Soon, someone from NORAD

* * *

shows up demanding the prints and Heflin turns them over. They are not seen again. The photos are most likely a prank hoax by Heflin using a hubcap, complicated by flawed photographic analyses and investigations.
