August 3 — Before 12:00 midnight. Three young men watch a triangular object with a light at each of its points move from north to south along the Jura Mountains from Biel/Bienne to Vignelz, Canton Bern, Switzerland. Suddenly it stops, changing color from yellow to dark red, makes a 180° turn, then takes off “like lightning” toward the east where it vanishes. (“[Bright Pointed Triangle Again,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014677252&usg=AOvVaw1tmhZ4iTcpQk2aW3fu36GP)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1966): iii)

August 4 — 1:30 a.m. [Don Tenopir](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/188147823/donald-tenopir&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014677610&usg=AOvVaw1F1V5F-rYhwaiWkWkokEsR), 44, is driving a truck on State Highway 15 about 25 miles south of Abilene (near Elmo, Kansas), when all his lights go out. They come back on intermittently. A UFO passes just above his truck with a wind-like sound and hovers about 100 feet in front of him. Tenopir stops his rig, and the object slowly rises and takes off to the southwest. It seems to be 14–15 feet in diameter, 2 feet thick with a 4-foot hump in the middle, and orange-colored. It is shooting off rays in spurts. He stops in Abilene to report his sighting to Abilene Reflector-Chronicle reporter [Ed Corwin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.hotspotsz.com/former-reporter-recounts-ufo-tale/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014677938&usg=AOvVaw1tNmN-5i7VLVmt0__gOiwb). (“[Beatrice Trucker Joins UFO Viewers,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95115452/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014678159&usg=AOvVaw1-3DAouvUtPT8joEgyZNjH)” Beatrice (Neb.) Daily Sun, August 5, 1965, p. 1; Jerome Clark, “[The Greatest Flap Yet?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014678454&usg=AOvVaw1_NEVxrpaHaM5Njs621SJs)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1966):

29–30; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014678838&usg=AOvVaw0yrxkLYNEe95fCmqXd-Qqn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014679072&usg=AOvVaw3sMu_xXJpKKQDJtNmaq5Yk) pp. 175–177)

August 4 — Night. Radar operators at Calumet Air Force Station \[now operated by Keweenaw County\] near Phoenix, Michigan, track 7–10 objects in V-formation traveling from southwest to north-northeast at about 9,000 mph over Lake Superior. The same night, radar targets at Duluth, Minnesota, are chased by USAF jets. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014679371&usg=AOvVaw3Moxu0yhihOw1BChA0UhiN), p. 306; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1965_08_04_US_MI_Duluth-AFB_NICAP_MultiWit-Radar.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014679614&usg=AOvVaw1PbKp_eLMFT-rLTMaAIY5b)\])

August 8 — 11:30 p.m. A luminous UFO is allegedly photographed in Beaver, Pennsylvania, by James Lucci, 17.

According to estimations by witnesses, the diameter of the UFO is around 42 feet. Lucci is photographing the full moon with his brother John, 23. According to them, a shining object appears from behind a hill. James manages to take two shots before the flying object leaves. His friends encourage him to send the photos to the Beaver County Times, where they are analyzed and declared authentic. However, both the Colorado project and UFO researchers determine the photo is a hoax created by holding a plate up next to the moon with a fist (probably John’s) and blurring it with motion. (Condon, [pp. 83–84](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/82/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014680138&usg=AOvVaw2lnVHQDMRE0ceaSHm1U8SS), [455–457](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/454/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014680411&usg=AOvVaw2MkuP-2eeNQk-43WXiw9oc); Mark Cashman, “The End of a Photographic Case,” IUR 23, no. 4 (Winter 1998): 21–23)

August 9 — 6:00 p.m. A professional astronomer and his wife, along with three others, are driving eastward on Long Island, New York, when then see a silvery disc heading slowly south. Its base has a ring of bluish-white lights that make the object appear to rotate. It has a white light on top. After accelerating, the object becomes a white, starlike object far to the east. It moves up and down for another 5 minutes, then rapidly moves south and disappears over the Atlantic Ocean. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 75–76](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/74/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014680848&usg=AOvVaw1_yJA_RJzAMTAHyrL9tT5O))

August 11? — 3:30 p.m. David Gibson is sitting in the front yard of his house in Waverly, Iowa, with his father and sister. They hear a high-pitched whine and see an object descending to the south. The silvery UFO is about 15–20 feet in diameter and looks like two saucers put together. It lands on a tree-lined hill out of view and the whining sound fades away. Gibson walks about a half-mile to take a look and briefly sees a “being,” about 3–3.5 feet tall, watching him from behind a tree at the top of the hill. It quickly vanishes and he hears a rush of air. He reaches the spot but sees no footprints. About 40 feet south of the tree he finds a burned area about 15–20 feet in diameter and three rectangular impressions in the shape of a triangle. (Jerome Clark, “[Iowa’s Bashful Humanoid,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201975%2520V%252021%2520N%25203-4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014681205&usg=AOvVaw2I10_aHrUsX8VU1efaa3I5)” Flying Saucer Review 21, no. 3/4 (November 1975): 52–53)

August 12 — 11:15 a.m. Maj. Jack D. Bond is sitting in a passenger seat of a T-29 aircraft on a heading of 300° and descending from 4,000 feet to 3,000 feet near Springfield, Ohio. He sees a UFO ascending and descending that is slightly higher than the T-29. It appears to be 5–7 miles away and moving in a general direction of 90°. The object’s speed is highly erratic during the 3 ascents and descents that the object makes. On its third descent the object appears to level off and accelerate at a speed of 690 mph or more. Project Blue Book evaluates this sighting as a solar mirage, even though the position and time of day rule that out. (NICAP, “[Object Has 3 Ascents and 2](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650812springfield_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014681611&usg=AOvVaw2kXGkZUHwhfyE0T6JmyzUq) [Descents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650812springfield_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014681834&usg=AOvVaw0pDW6-C4JeHYU3cesBK4T3)”; Clark III 388–389)

August 13 — 9:30 p.m.? Leonard Chalupiak has just put his car into his garage at Baden, Pennsylvania, when he sees a disc-shaped object about 300 feet in diameter flying in front of the moon toward the north at about 50 mph and

* * *

2,300 feet away. It is surrounded with orange lights that weaken as a blue light comes on, which is intense for about 3 seconds. Then all the lights disappear and a sort of “shock wave” that shakes the tree leaves commences. The witness goes into his house and calls the Air Force. About 20 minutes later his vision becomes hazy, his eyes grow painful, and he gradually loses vision in both eyes. He notices his entire body is sunburned. A medical examination indicates exposure to ultraviolet radiation. His vision returns gradually over several days. The Air Force labels it a hoax, perhaps confusing it with the Beaver, Pennsylvania, hoax photo of August 8. (NICAP, “[Object Crosses Moon / Medical Effects on Witness](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650813baden_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014682269&usg=AOvVaw3wTejYdnT54-HlAx6chHQ6)”; Vallée, Magonia, [p. 313](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/312/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014682538&usg=AOvVaw1UU4cyldcWs8ODi50foIYz))

August 16 — 10:45 p.m.–12:20 a.m. A woman leaves her house on the northwest edge of Sedalia, Missouri, to drive to a drug store. As she is returning home, she sees an unusual figure in the ditch to her right. It turns and waves at her, then stumbles as it climbs out of the ditch. Something (a large bird?) flies up in the air a few feet from the car. She steps on the gas and goes home, where her husband asks her where she has been because it is now 12:25 a.m. In 1977, she undergoes hypnotic regression with hypnotist Ron Owen and recalls an abduction experience where she undergoes some type of examination. (Clark III 278–279; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-08-16-usa-sedalia.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014682879&usg=AOvVaw3I7FVJ9iWNwQ1OcVBx6pbi)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-08-16-usa-sedalia.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014683084&usg=AOvVaw11nezo6v8Tm_weoFDB23oD) August 25, 2008)

August 18 — 9:50 p.m. Michael S. Henry and another college student are driving 3 miles south of Noblesville, Indiana, when a large red lighted object swoops down on their car. The radio and ignition go dead. The UFO looks like a top, with a large, gray cone and a flat or slightly domed top. (Herbert S. Taylor, “An Update on Vehicle Interference Reports, Part Two,” IUR 34, no. 1 (Sept. 2011): 15)

August 19 — 3:00 a.m. Thelma B. Schumaker and her mother, Mrs. W. H. Blackburn, are awakened by an explosion in their backyard in Mount Airy, North Carolina. The sound seems to rise and travel west. They see a bright golden cigar hovering in the north. The object moves to the right then to the left, then up and down, left again, then disappears behind some high oak trees. The next morning, the witnesses find a 6-inch-wide circle of depressed sod that is worn down to the soil. The circle is 12 feet in diameter. (Ted Phillips, [Physical Traces Associated with](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Physical_Traces.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014683524&usg=AOvVaw2yQfSfe8THrk7lxmxeSmNw) [UFO Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Physical_Traces.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014683734&usg=AOvVaw1q51VEzEEB9plJo_6ufvvF), CUFOS, 1975, p. 37)

August 19 — 8:20–9:00 p.m. Harold Butcher, 16, is milking the cows in his father’s barn in Cherry Creek, New York, and listening to radio station WKBW. Just outside, a 3-year old bull is tied by its nose to a metal pipe. Harold hears the bull make a noise “like I have never heard come from an animal before.” Looking out the window, he sees the animal is bending the pipe. Simultaneously, he sees a metallic-looking, football-shaped UFO about 50 feet long and approximately 20 feet thick hovering just above the trees an estimated 450 feet from the barn. Slowly, the object descends behind a maple tree, emitting a red vapor from around its edges and a “beep-beep” sound.

Meanwhile, the radio is emitting static, even though WKBW usually has a clear signal. Harold calls the house on an intercom, then runs outside. As he approaches the bull, the UFO rises and moves behind some clouds “as fast as a snap of my fingers” emitting red vapor toward the ground, then bounces back to the ship as it hovers about 10 feet in the air. The noise also increases to a level approximating a sonic boom as it goes up. As the UFO disappears, the clouds turn green. Inside, the boy’s mother, Mrs. William Butcher, notes that there is “definite interference” in her radio reception. Harold’s brother, Robert, also goes outside and the two boys see that the UFO has reappeared, this time hovering over a pine grove. It ascends again, emitting the red vapor and turning the clouds green. Others in the house include William Butcher Jr. and Kathleen Brougham, a friend. They do not see the object. It returns twice at 8:45 and 9:00 p.m., finally disappearing to the southwest. Trooper E. J. Haas and a fellow officer arrive on the scene shortly thereafter. As they all walk out to inspect the area of the initial sighting, they notice a pungent odor. Harold and the young daughter suffer from upset stomachs. Mrs. Butcher says the cows produce only one can of milk that evening, as opposed to their usual two and a half cans. Harold discovers a purple, oily-smelling liquid and gives a sample of it to the state police, who turn it over to Capt. James A. Dorsey and five others from Niagara Falls Air Force Base \[now Niagara Falls Air Reserve Station\], who come to investigate the report the following afternoon. When NICAP investigator Jeffrey Gow arrives on the scene, he notices the foot-tall grass in the area “seemed to be bent over in long curved sweeps.” Radar targets are picked up between 8:00–8:30 p.m. by an AN/FPS-6 Long Range Height Finder Radar of the 763rd Radar Squadron at Lockport Air Force Station \[now closed\] near Shawnee, New York. The target is sighted near the upper limit of the radar. (NICAP, “[Close Encounter Has Radar Evidence](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650819cherrycreek_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014684298&usg=AOvVaw2si6pysVovbxKtWMezzTNb)”; NICAP, “[Cherry Creek (Butcher) Trace Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650819cherrycreek2_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014684533&usg=AOvVaw20zAC_9sk6KonK0cBBvbWb)”; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/cases/1965_08_19_US_NY_Cherry-Creek_GALGANSKI_Butcher-CE-II.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014684788&usg=AOvVaw1WWxZUOG5M1RKs_I_uP3oT)\]; “[Landing Probed by NICAP, AF,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/028%2520AUG-SEPT%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014685033&usg=AOvVaw1HSokslV6IMiHMyXm2a9_Y)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1965): 7; “[The Cherry Creek Incident,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252011%252000%2520-%2520November-December.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014685386&usg=AOvVaw0qCyoLAq-Wl0ZZN7jI-Sho)” APRO Bulletin, Nov./Dec. 1965, p. 7; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014685712&usg=AOvVaw1m5NKYkT5-ImIN2tk-9Kno), pp. 178–184; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 170–172](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/170/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014685986&usg=AOvVaw3skTvmtpZ9NucXl7cqeuaC); Robert A. Galganski, “Incident at Cherry Creek,” IUR 21, no. 3 (Fall 1996): 3– 12, 27–29; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014686264&usg=AOvVaw2_yOgLwvmB7Xtp0t9CQPxv), p. 307; Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 118–124)

August 30 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014686613&usg=AOvVaw20zYc40jMyDLjD_485zktB) writes to Lt. Col. John Spaulding in the Office of the Secretary of the Air Force to suggest that the Pentagon work with the National Academy of Sciences to establish a panel of physical and social scientists to study the UFO phenomenon. (Center for UFO Studies, \[[Hynek correspondence](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1965-69_00_00_US_IL_Hynek-AF-letters.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014686894&usg=AOvVaw2sNDpojVcx3R4_It9vXcaD)\], p. 1; Swords 306)

* * *

September 3 — Around 1:00 a.m. Exeter, New Hampshire, Police Officer [Eugene F. Bertrand Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44131765/eugene-f_-bertrand&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014687295&usg=AOvVaw3hG3WZSs7KO8nRqKqNVrLJ) comes across a woman parked on State Highway 101. “She was real upset,” he says, “and told me that a red glowing object had chased her.” Around 2:00 a.m., while walking home to Exeter on Route 150 (Amesbury Road) near Kensington, New Hampshire, teenager [Norman J. Muscarello](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43739662/norman-j_-muscarello&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014687678&usg=AOvVaw2JxtwHAR7Ppl5LVWos46Re) is terrorized by a large object with four or five bright red lights that approaches from nearby woods and hovers over a field. Horses are spooked. Muscarello gets a ride to the Exeter police station, pale and shaken, and reports the incident at 2:24 a.m. Officer Bertrand drives him back to the field along Route 150 to investigate. When he is called to investigate Muscarello’s report, the earlier incident causes him to pay attention. At first Bertrand and Muscarello see nothing, but when Bertrand flashes a light around the field around 3:00 a.m., a huge dark object with red flashing lights rises up over the trees, moving back and forth, tilts, and comes toward them. They both see pulsating red lights that dim from left to right then right to left in a 5- 4-3-2-1 then 1-2-3-4-5 pattern. Each cycle takes about 2 seconds. The object hovers for several minutes, and everything is silent except for the dogs and horses. Then it darts, turns sharply, slows down, and begins to move away. Another patrolman, [David R. Hunt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135259184/david-r_-hunt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014688022&usg=AOvVaw38YzN4bDM9zjl1U0a1zWKu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135259184/david-r_-hunt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014688216&usg=AOvVaw2AUJZZIDcDOUrlETqn9GfL) pulls up and sees the pulsating lights and the UFO. Bertrand says the lights are always in a line and at a 60° angle; when the object moves, the lower lights are always forward of the others. In the daytime, the police station calls Pease AFB \[now Pease Air National Guard Base\] in Portsmouth to reconfirm the incident. By 1:00 p.m., 2–4 police officers arrive to interview the three witnesses at length.

Journalist [John G. Fuller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_G._Fuller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014688534&usg=AOvVaw3eNVN3rQ3XtWw2zetNMHOq) investigates the case during the next month. He finds a huge gap between media coverage and local perceptions. [Raymond Fowler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_E._Fowler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014688786&usg=AOvVaw1knup7aWg_8ofAhbTxy7pp) finds that the local advertising plane operated by Sky-Lite Aerial Advertising Agency of Boston was not running between August 21 and September 10. (Wikipedia, “[Exeter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exeter_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014689072&usg=AOvVaw1sZRqNIcxo1ZRMaIHCAPMd) [incident](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exeter_incident&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014689329&usg=AOvVaw0sCX8lIo9xchAMQDOksYYu)”; “[UFOs Panic Police, Motorists,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/028%2520AUG-SEPT%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014689573&usg=AOvVaw2QQGX14ZJ3jjvg0LtziU1x)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 4 (Aug./Sept. 1965): 1, 3–4; “[The Exeter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252011%252000%2520-%2520November-December.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014689958&usg=AOvVaw1Fe1_hu4n8kgoyqcvPZJM2)

[N.H. Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252011%252000%2520-%2520November-December.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014690333&usg=AOvVaw01TtXIWeYIBMwHDLmrhFkv)” APRO Bulletin, Nov./Dec. 1965, pp. 7–8; John G. Fuller, “[Outer-Space Ghost Story,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Look/1966%252002%252022_Look_John%2520G%2520Fuller_Outer%2520Space%2520Ghost%2520Story_Lagrange%2520scan.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014690721&usg=AOvVaw3mDJccjWKA46ZeFJAw1paz)” Look, February 22, 1966, pp. 36–42; Clark III 440–444; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 154–166](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/154/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014691050&usg=AOvVaw2X1e6mvcqJcyiI84upRksv); John G. Fuller, Incident at Exeter, Putnam’s Sons, 1966; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014691366&usg=AOvVaw0PaWVMhhqy79Zng6AaFnUl), pp. 197–199; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014691579&usg=AOvVaw3GNMfrIcH7-v9HvdJw1BPy), p. 307; Jean Fuller, “[The Exeter Incidents,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201967%2520V%252013%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014691810&usg=AOvVaw1Qh8Hd9whmfZvoPyRTeut4)” Flying Saucer Review 13, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1967): 25–27; “Tale of an ‘Exeter Terrestrial,’” IUR 8, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1983): 12– 14, excerpted from Exeter Area High School newspaper, Talon 5, no. 1 (1981); Kim Hansen, “UFO Casebook,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, pp. 69–72; Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, pp. 143–145; Schuessler, “[The Exeter, N.H. UFO Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Schuessler%252C%2520John%2520F%2520-%2520The%2520Exeter%252C%2520N.H.%2520UFO%2520case.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014692400&usg=AOvVaw13rfG0muO0yMdOsCydkJ5S) [September 3, 1965: Briefing Document,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Digitized_by_AFU/Schuessler%252C%2520John%2520F%2520-%2520The%2520Exeter%252C%2520N.H.%2520UFO%2520case.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014692695&usg=AOvVaw3jbhOV3X-Z90hCzNoz0ykt)” October 2002; Martin Shough, “[Exeunt Exeter? Should This 1965 New](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/EXETER%2520N.H.%2520Sep%25202-3%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014692954&usg=AOvVaw2r2Tw5xMVnGeWj6ITkCP0r) [Hampshire Classic Finally Shuffle Off the Stage?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.martinshough.com/aerialphenomena/EXETER%2520N.H.%2520Sep%25202-3%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014693202&usg=AOvVaw2EDizvi9wGnTdnXKLC9lm2)” April 2012; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1965_09_03_US_NH_Exeter_NICAP_MultiWit.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014693446&usg=AOvVaw3eKFX3R-rptRk9piOVQx3l)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[John G. Fuller tape-recorded interview transcripts, [part one](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1965_09_03_US_NH_Exeter_NICAP_MultiWit_TranscriptsR_PartI.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014693694&usg=AOvVaw1w3fJa3R__9x9TmgAnXd8I), [part two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1965_09_03_US_NH_Exeter_NICAP_MultiWit_TranscriptsR_PartII.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014693936&usg=AOvVaw0gwZoWKrdq-KjxpjXucY9C)\]; Patrick Gross, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/exeter65.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014694155&usg=AOvVaw2OkiBc5kf7KXyfcqCM9mf1) [Exeter Cases, 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/exeter65.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014694392&usg=AOvVaw3HzNgNl2ZwfILRe_lRzx8e)”)

September 3 — 11:00 p.m. Brazoria County Sheriff’s Deputies [Billy E. McCoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/clute-tx/billy-mccoy-6019911&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014694707&usg=AOvVaw15IVLQLIMpPkn83gzXyViW) and Robert Goode are patrolling Highway 36 between West Columbia and Damon, Texas. They see a dark-gray triangular object, 150–200 feet long and 40–50 feet thick at the middle, with a long, bright, pulsing, purple light on the right side and a long blue light on the left side. It approaches to within 150 feet from the highway and 100 feet in the air. Purple light illuminates the ground beneath the object and the interior of the police car, and the object casts a shadow in the moonlight. Goode feels heat on his left arm; an alligator bite on his left index finger is suddenly relieved of pain, later healing rapidly but unnaturally. They drive away in fear but return later that night to find the object still there. (NICAP, “[Dark Grey Disc Shadows Police Car](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/650903damon_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014695007&usg=AOvVaw0DI8tRQydIZ7KmUQz8HpXn)”; “[UAO Pursues Police,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252009%252000%2520-%2520September-October.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014695301&usg=AOvVaw3a3qiYoJMlIUElCkhdfhzg)” APRO Bulletin, Sept./Oct. 1965, pp. 1, 3; Clark III 355–357; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014695584&usg=AOvVaw1QhETQTxElEUVtrT-QeMa3)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014695758&usg=AOvVaw1eQsifsIIGYlrBntTaRO84) p. 308; Michael D. Swords, “[Damon, Texas Comments, by Request from Kandinsky,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thebiggeststudy.blogspot.com/2011/03/damontexas-comments-by-request-from.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014696010&usg=AOvVaw1LVgozzuBg4X41isWwrMmo)” The Big Study, March 26, 2011; “[Damon 1965,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roswellbooks.com/museum/?page_id%3D687&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014696217&usg=AOvVaw1j0AcCwvTycgUoP27tsTxJ)” Texas UFO Museum and Research Library, February 5, 2014; Patrick Gross, “[Damon, Texas, September 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/mccoy.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014696450&usg=AOvVaw3ZL4beWY-PjNlzgLjY39u-)”)

September 6 — 9:30 p.m. Capt. Marcelo Cisternas is piloting a DC-6b at 8,500 feet for LAN Chile Flight 904 in northern Chile when he sees a zigzagging object change course and approach his airliner. The UFO follows the aircraft for 13–14 minutes at a distance of 1.8 miles. It is emitting a light of an intense color that shifts to radiant white.

Cisternas checks with control towers in Arica and Iquque, but no other flights are expected in the area. (Good Above, [p. 311](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/310/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014696823&usg=AOvVaw0KxOJCg54TmgYwLR7bC4pO))

September 10 — 8:30 a.m. Farmer Antônio Pau Ferro is working on his farm in São João, near Garanhuns, Pernambuco, Brazil, when he hears a noise and sees two metallic objects descending from the sky about 26 feet away. They touch the ground in a uniform motion, let two humanoids about 2.5 feet tall exit, then rise up again to 16 feet and hover. The beings approach Ferro, then move back to the two UFOs. They pick up a tomato and examine it. The objects descend and envelop them, then take off with a whining and then a low sound. (Clark III 523; Brazil 76; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-09-10-brazil-garahuns.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014697161&usg=AOvVaw2t56O_aau8AAHmJ2G1Lj-5)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-09-10-brazil-garahuns.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014697374&usg=AOvVaw3tad_iOLTMKdY-AcfivFy8) May 17, 2008)

September 14 — 1:00 a.m. Engineer Paul Green is riding a motorcycle south of Langenhoe, Essex, UK, near Langenhoe Hall Lane when he hears a high-pitched humming to the east and notices a pinpoint of blue light moving in his direction. The humming becomes a loud buzzing, and his engine sputters and dies and the headlight goes out. The

* * *

light resolves into an enormous domed disc that tilts and slowly descends. The underside of the disc has numerous round items. Green walks toward the object, but he feels paralyzed as the flashing blue light becomes intense, fluctuating in rhythm with his heartbeat. He feels a tingling like an electric shock. The object seems to land in an area with farmhouses. Green notes that another cyclist has had a similar problem, but with some difficulty he gets his cycle started. The next day he notices that his hair and clothes are imbued with static electricity. (Bernard E. Finch, “[The Langenhoe Incident,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CNov-Dec%252CV%252011%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014697828&usg=AOvVaw3hpQQzRLWZmnRIUnHPiIBW)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1965): 3–4)

September 16 — Just after 12:00 midnight. Constables John Lockem and Koos de Klerk are patrolling on the Pretoria- Bronkhorstspruit highway in South Africa when their police van headlights suddenly illuminate a domed, disc- shaped object sitting on the road. The UFO is copper colored and about 30 feet in diameter. Within seconds, the object lifts off the road, emitting tongues of flame from two tubes or channels on the underside. Flames from the macadam road surface shoot up in the air about 3 feet as the UFO departs, blazing long after it is out of sight.

Later investigation shows that part of the road is caved in as if from a heavy weight, and the gravel is separated from the tar in a severely burned area about 6 feet in diameter. Lt. Col. J. B. Brits, district commandant of Pretoria North, tells the media that the incident is considered “as being of a highly secret nature and an inquiry is being conducted in top circles.” Samples of the road surface are taken for analysis by a leading scientific agency; the report is never made public. (Philipp Human, “[Two Policemen See Saucer on Main Road,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%252C1965%252CNov-Dec%252CV%252011%252CN%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014698321&usg=AOvVaw2LyvE8CJP3Dsr0MhzI1yJq)” Flying Saucer Review 11, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1965): 9–11; “[Police See UFO Blast Off from Highway,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/028%2520AUG-SEPT%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014698631&usg=AOvVaw2q4N6nCjQ1-tQl6glG4fAb)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 4

(Aug./Sept. 1965): 5; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014698994&usg=AOvVaw2JjvNzj4YIv14sn7ExIfCo)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014699218&usg=AOvVaw3EZaj4nt82iWyr7xVBlteC) pp. 187–192; UFOEv II 183–184)

September 17 — A UFO is seen hovering above Medina del Campo, Valladolid, Spain, for several hours. Heliodoro Carrión takes off in his light plane and goes to 15,000 feet. An Iberia Airlines jet passes him on the way up at 24,000 feet. Carrión estimates the UFO is at least 4 times larger than the jet. (“[More Sightings over Spain,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252001%252000%2520-%2520January-February.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014699587&usg=AOvVaw1xJPctBewxLTfG9syazsGm)” APRO Bulletin, Jan./Feb. 1966, p. 1)

Late September — 9:15 p.m. Two French submarines, the Junon (S648) and the Daphné (S641), escorted by the logistic support vessel Rhône, are anchored off Fort-de-France, Martinique, when a large luminous object the color of a fluorescent tube arrives slowly and silently from the west. Michel Figuet on the Junon goes into the coming tower and gets six pairs of binoculars that he distributes to companions. There are 300 witnesses, including four officers on the Junon, three officers on the Daphné, a dozen French sailors, and personnel of the weather observatory. All witnesses aboard the Junon see the object as a large ball of light or a disc on edge arriving from the west. It moves slowly, horizontally, at a distance estimated at 6 miles south of the ships, from west to east. It leaves a whitish trace similar to the glow of a TV screen. When it was directly south of the ships the object drops toward the earth, makes two complete loops, then hovers in the midst of a faint halo. Figuet watches the object vanish in the center of its glow “like a bulb turned off.” The trail and the halo remain visible in the sky for a full minute. At 9:45 p.m. the halo reappears at the same place, and the object switches on again. It rises, makes two more loops, and flies away to the west, where it disappears at 9:50 p.m. (Jacques Vallée, “[Estimates of Power Optical Output in Six](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/12/jse_12_3_vallee_1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014700473&usg=AOvVaw0IiTjvB9mA0RoI93bWnXPV) [Cases of Unexplained Aerial Objects with Defined Luminosity Characteristics,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/12/jse_12_3_vallee_1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014700737&usg=AOvVaw0c3DBto37oXmcMxIO2aR5r)” Journal of Scientific Exploration 12, no. 3 (1998): 348–350)

September 23 — A major blackout in Cuernavaca, Morelos, Mexico, coincides with the appearance of a glowing, disc- shaped UFO hovering low over the city. Witnesses include the governor of Morelos state, Emilio Riva Palacio; [Valentín López González](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valent%25C3%25ADn_L%25C3%25B3pez_Gonz%25C3%25A1lez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014701096&usg=AOvVaw0JiMGN4HGIfEeKrP0xNvau), the mayor of Cuernavaca; 24th military zone chief Gen. Rafael Enrique Vega; [Joaquín](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://clubdeleonescuernavacaac.club/1965-1966-joaquin-diaz-gonzalez/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014701360&usg=AOvVaw0X3J2GhY7LAMY-VZ4TPWad) [Díaz González](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://clubdeleonescuernavacaac.club/1965-1966-joaquin-diaz-gonzalez/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014701594&usg=AOvVaw0XVVE9rZBfoBH03pivjXQI)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://clubdeleonescuernavacaac.club/1965-1966-joaquin-diaz-gonzalez/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014701789&usg=AOvVaw2ZC4CzG33W3ue-mk1bhuJD) president of the Lion’s Club; founder of the Folkloric Ballet of Mexico, [Amalia Hernández](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amalia_Hern%25C3%25A1ndez&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014702007&usg=AOvVaw03yjJ4Mj1oScb2tLUYaiRZ); and future Mexican President [Luis Echeverría](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luis_Echeverr%25C3%25ADa&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014702224&usg=AOvVaw2AnpMI0lmK9vv7F7yjiE8t). The power only fails as long as the UFO is there. (Frank Edwards, FS Serious Business, Bantam ed., 1966, [p. 145](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/flyingsaucersser00edwa/page/144/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014702518&usg=AOvVaw3fmn1iWY7mevK07g5-Nnti); [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014702768&usg=AOvVaw34jdpCHHu77b2Gg2-P6MkC)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014702988&usg=AOvVaw1UvsGcYjhY0U0jW_HB8rUK) pp. 192–196; Antonio Huneeus, “[UFO Sighting by](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.openminds.tv/ufo-sighting-by-mexican-president-luis-echeverria/12459&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014703257&usg=AOvVaw38GHtOF83Dt5v0J6XeWe_6) [Mexican President Luis Echeverría,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.openminds.tv/ufo-sighting-by-mexican-president-luis-echeverria/12459&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014703510&usg=AOvVaw3u4C8KezS7hC0AETGzC-PL)” OpenMinds, October 6, 2011)

September 26 — The Centro Ufologico Nazionale is founded in Milan, Italy, as a test of cooperation among several regional UFO groups. It begins publishing Notiziario UFO, edited by [Roberto Pinotti](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roberto_Pinotti&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014703863&usg=AOvVaw3IPjTAe6wsVsaagaE3M0ey)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roberto_Pinotti&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014704049&usg=AOvVaw2-KJ8Zw2Rw6d9GWJdN9B9e) in January 1966. (Story, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/66/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014704278&usg=AOvVaw2kTgW_htqHVyOl0oq6EJ4f) [67](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/66/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014704500&usg=AOvVaw0zK1YKH7hKPZph49cYkCZS); 1Pinotti 143–146; [Notiziario UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Italy/Notiziario%2520UFO%2520(CUN)/Notiziario%2520UFO%2520-%25201967%2520No%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014704762&usg=AOvVaw27IpjcckqPjr52rxFx1otS) 1 (1967))

September 28 — USAF Director of Information Gen. [Eugene B. LeBailly](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106475/lieutenant-general-eugene-b-lebailly/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014705124&usg=AOvVaw1G5fNhe_JAam_g-V6WhFNL) writes to the military director of the USAF Scientific Advisory Board, saying that Gen. [Arthur C. Agan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/107889/lieutenant-general-arthur-c-agan/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014705422&usg=AOvVaw1rkFOvEUlbwgxwXK_LNvKF) has found Project Blue Book to be a worthwhile program and that the Air Force should continue to investigate UFOs “to assure that such objects do not present a threat to our national security.” The project will remain at the Foreign Technology Division (Wright-Patterson AFB). He also requests that a “working scientific panel composed of both physical and social scientists be organized to review Project Blue Book—its resources, methods, and findings.” (Maj. Gen. E. B. LeBailly, “[Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/650928lebailly_docs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014705706&usg=AOvVaw0czKeN9-ZDFEUEa8Zxbceu)” memorandum for military director, Scientific Advisory Board, September 28, 1965)

* * *

Fall — 10:30 a.m. A Chesapeake & Ohio train is moving 8 miles south of Fostoria, Ohio, when the fireman and engineer see a large cigar-shaped object in the sky a considerable distance away. It is dark in color and positioned at a 45° angle from the horizon. It appears to be creating its own cloud screen. Suddenly a small object falls out of the tail and descends slowly in a fluttering fashion. Near the ground the small object stabilizes, emits coal-black smoke from its top, and then rises upward faster and faster. Three more objects leave the large one, each taking 10–12 minutes. They go off in different directions. After the last one leaves, a white cloud forms around the large object, which remains in the sky with other normal white clouds. (Herbert S. Taylor, “Satellite Objects and Cloud Cigars,” IUR 29, no. 1 (Spring 2004): 3)

October — The Tasmanian UFO Investigation Centre is formed in Hobart, Tasmania, by Robert Burge. It publishes the TUFOIC Newsletter for many years, but the organization folds in December 2015. ([TUFOIC Newsletter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/TUFOIC%2520Newsletter/TUFOIC%2520Newsletter%2520-%2520No%2520007%2520-%25201971.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014706346&usg=AOvVaw0R7ubUkSSiBP0Tlzj22511), no. 7 (1971); Keith Basterfield, Vladimir Godic, and Pony Godic, “Australian Ufology: A Review,” JUFOS 2 (1990): 25)

October 1 — The Swedish Defense Staff transfers the responsibility for UFO investigation to the Swedish National Defence Research Institute \[now the Swedish Defence Research Agency\] in Sweden, where it remains. Few civilian reports are classified as secret, but sensitive reports by the military are restricted. (Swords 367–368)

October 2 — [John G. Fuller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_G._Fuller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014706865&usg=AOvVaw3Nsfyru8D-aGcAcOBRHIoZ) summarizes the Exeter sighting in his “Trade Winds” column in the Saturday Review. He writes to his editors beforehand that “reliable, but off-the-record information from the Pease AFB indicates frequent radar blips and fighters are constantly scrambled to pursue these objects. This information is not official, but it comes from a reliable source.” (John G. Fuller, “[Trade Winds,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/sim_saturday-review_1965-10-02_48_40/page/n9/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014707285&usg=AOvVaw0-CHc4ikardRgozGa315Gt)” Saturday Review 48, no. 40 (October 2, 1965): 10, 16)

Mid-October — 9:30 a.m. [Bill Hertzke](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134747591/william-hertzke&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014707633&usg=AOvVaw3CQf58vjheCtVoiCeieB_1)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134747591/william-hertzke&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014707829&usg=AOvVaw0KJ4i_jH3GD7ns2-cnk3Wl) a ranch hand on the Circle J Ranch near Cochrane, Alberta, is on his horse in a pasture when he sees an object like a small airplane parked on the ground. It is silver-gray with swept-back wings, about 16 feet long, a wingspan of about 12 feet, and its fuselage is about 4-5 feet deep. He rides over and examines it. The exterior is irregular, “like a waffle.” A transparent dome covers the cockpit. Through it he can see complicated instruments (knobs, dials, and switches), a TV screen, and two transparent (like Plexiglas) bucket seats. There are no visible motors, propellers, jets, insignia, or identifying marks of any kind. It has an exterior door about 2 feet wide and 3 feet high that is open about 2 inches. His horse is extremely skittish, so he ties it to a tree and returns on foot. He spends 10–15 minutes examining it and can see no landing gear (although it seems to be suspended 18–20 inches off the ground) or seams of any kind. He realizes he can go inside the door but is a bit too scared to even touch the object, and has to return to chores anyway. (Lorenzen, UFOs over the Americas, Signet, 1968, pp. 87–102)

October 21 — 6:10 p.m. Five witnesses are in a car near Saint George, Minnesota, returning to their homes in Gibbon from a bow-hunting trip. [Arthur A. Strauch](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/3506478/arthur-alfred-strauch&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014708265&usg=AOvVaw0DTN5j2Jq8IOCKZFg5bDuN), a Sibley County deputy sheriff, is the first to spot a strange object that seems to be 2,000 feet above the ground and a quarter of a mile distant in the northwest sky. After watching for about 10 minutes from the car, the group drives down the road about a half mile and stops. Strauch observes it both with the naked eye and through 7x35 binoculars. At first they hear no sound, but as the object flies over them, Donald Martin Grewe describes the sound as a “whistling whine.” Strauch snaps a photograph just as the object begins to move. The object then flies into the wind for several hundred feet, then stops for a few seconds, at which time its lights change from bright white to dull orange, alternating several times. It then moves toward the southeast at a high rate of speed and disappears out of sight. (NICAP, “[The St. George Multiple-Witness](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/651021st.george_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014708549&usg=AOvVaw2_XukmbWVHmPgluGM_A9Wh) [Photo Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/651021st.george_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014708761&usg=AOvVaw2guykLHdwXZFkiT7_Z-Nx4)”; “[Deputy Snaps UAO Color Photo,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252011%252000%2520-%2520November-December.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014709042&usg=AOvVaw3Hz6yBw7Q0i047n83rpoge)” APRO Bulletin, Nov./Dec. 1965, pp. 1, 3; Story, [pp. 351–352](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/350/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014709357&usg=AOvVaw2M_EvhK7U83_rNb5Z7t6Yl); Patrick Gross, “[The St. George Multiple-Witness Sighting and Photograph, USA, 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/stgeorge65.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014709590&usg=AOvVaw0jLoPG01l5tjGT0cLoQ0ne)”)

October 22 — Afternoon. Geof Gray-Cobb, a Canadian technician working with the Deep Space Instrumentation Facility \[now the Hartebeesthoek Radio Astronomy Observatory\] in Gauteng, South Africa, in tracking [Mariner 4](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariner_4&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014709872&usg=AOvVaw0Y_DM4jzJT2Pg28XccrEWz)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariner_4&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014710043&usg=AOvVaw3tIQFetj6y0L0Z5R8JOxS5) is present when the spacecraft’s signal strength begins rising at a point when it should not have. The team alerts the Jet Propulsion Lab. The signal strength is now so high that the instruments are clicking as they max out. Gray- Cobb says the “raw radio energy” is coming in indecipherable “blips and dashes.” Nothing can be seen visually. Eight minutes later, everything goes silent. JPL later asks them to point their dish in the direction it was pointing when they picked up the signal. They do, but forget to correct for the earth’s rotation. Nonetheless, they get the signal again, which means it is a local source. Nothing is visible in the sky, but a sound sweep reveals that the source is a perfect circle 2° in diameter. The team directs a packet of radio pulses at the source, but it falls silent. Two months later, Gray-Cobb discovers that the pages for the event are gone from the log; the tape recording of the event is also missing. The manager tells him that two men with “authorization” had come three days after the event to confiscate the tapes. (Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 16)

October 22 — Evening. José Camilo Filho is walking through a field near the city cemetery in Canhotinho, Pernambuco, Brazil, when he runs across two little men only 3 feet high with whitish hair sitting next to a tube 4 feet tall and

* * *

resting on the ground. When they see Camilo, they jump up in a disorganized fashion, colliding with each other. One picks up the tube and the other points a straw at Camilo, who runs ahead. He decides to return and take a closer look, but the men and tube are gone. (Gordon Creighton, “[The Humanoids in Latin America,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-SI%25201966%2520N%25201%252CThe%2520Humanoids.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014710618&usg=AOvVaw3KbsboctdQ6LJxE6Ho_-lV)” in Charles Bowen, ed., The Humanoids, special issue of FSR, Oct./Dec. 1966, p. 45; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-10-22-brazil-canhotinho.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014710989&usg=AOvVaw3l7m3-PTN8vYXxD43VK1m9)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-10-22-brazil-canhotinho.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014711197&usg=AOvVaw3e2BVbyGQH4hOhmYXdhbCk) July 27, 2008; Brazil 75)

October 23 — Night. KEYL-AM radio announcer James F. Townsend, 19, is driving on State Highway 27 four miles east of Long Prairie, Minnesota, when he slams on his brakes to avoid hitting a rocket-like device resting on three legs or fins. As his car skids to a stop 20 feet from the object, the vehicle’s motor and electrical system die. The object looks like it is made of stainless steel, stands 30–40 feet high, and is 10 feet in diameter. In a circle of light under it, Townsend sees three things that resemble beer cans with “tripod legs and three matchstick arms.” They have no eyes, but Townsend feels as if they are looking at him. He gets out of the car to try to knock one over, but they come over to him and they stand there looking at him. Eventually they turn around and “scoot under the ship,” disappearing into the light beneath it. An ear-splitting humming sound emanates from the UFO, which assumes a bright illumination and shoots off. The Todd County sheriff and UFO investigators assume that Townsend, a deeply religious man, is sincere. (“[‘Space Things’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95125276/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014711547&usg=AOvVaw21JDWbPO5rGrqpk5bCSECX) [Stop His Car,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95125379/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014711782&usg=AOvVaw0tKTcCSgXQ01YQdK4v3P6Z)” Minneapolis Star, October 25, 1965, pp. 1, 4; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014712210&usg=AOvVaw37Rx4rC9-ocAlJ-yb283pW)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014712508&usg=AOvVaw3nJNcKDgPOoWx4kDnSAZyP) p. 308; “[‘Little, Little Men’ in Minn.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252011%252000%2520-%2520November-December.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014712946&usg=AOvVaw0wa5pwd9Gl-ykJ4J8jJGEo)” APRO Bulletin, Nov./Dec. 1965, p. 8; Clare John Jansen, “Little Tin Men in Minnesota,” Fate 19, no. 2 (February 1966): 36–40; Clark III 280; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-10-23-usa-longprairie.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014713538&usg=AOvVaw37MgIkIHYrfqQvqFR4yypA), January 5, 2008)

October 25 — The [Betty and Barney Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014713967&usg=AOvVaw33Wqa-O9ZtosKQ92JSRtsO) story is publicly revealed in an article by reporter [John H. Luttrell](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/201568868/john-h_-luttrell&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014714337&usg=AOvVaw39dgSO4uRTflOtFL4Ngiwv) in the Boston Traveler newspaper. He has obtained a copy of the tape recording at the Quincy Center UFO group, as well as a tape of an interview the Hills gave to UFO investigators after they completed their therapy. UPI picks up the story the same day. The Hills are caught completely by surprise. (Clark III 585)

October 27 — The Air Force issues a press release that gives two basic explanations for the Exeter, New Hampshire, sightings: Some stem from a high-altitude SAC exercise out of Westover AFB \[now Westover Air Reserve Base\] near Chicopee, Massachusetts; others are explained by temperature inversion that causes the appearance of stars and planets to dance and twinkle. Around the same time, [John Fuller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_G._Fuller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014714765&usg=AOvVaw0ddJqPkhBewYNnpn8eRUtc) hears from an Air Force pilot that pilots have been ordered to shoot down UFOs when possible, but the objects appear to be “invulnerable” and can outmaneuver any aircraft. (John G. Fuller, Incident at Exeter, Putnam’s Sons, 1966, pp. 201–202, 205–206)

Early November — The USAF Scientific Advisory Board meets in Houston, Texas, to discuss the UFO investigation and the possibility of an independent study. (USAF Scientific Advisory Board, [Special Report of the USAF Scientific](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/obrien.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014715239&usg=AOvVaw1nUpjwpSMNsc6pBErBTdi_) [Advisory Board Ad Hoc Committee to Review Project “Blue Book,”](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/obrien.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014715475&usg=AOvVaw3CqHAJlBPTwiHeXHXglbTL) Brian O’Brien, chairman of the Advisory Board, March 1966)

November — 2:00 a.m. Aaron David Kaback is on duty at the motor pool in the Army’s Fort Riley Military Reservation in Kansas when the duty officer takes him to a remote area of the base where they see a landed UFO with an Army helicopter flying above it. He contacts [Leonard Stringfield](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_H._Stringfield&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014715797&usg=AOvVaw0D-n05ZqZT8xyP7OtscXxD) about his story. A subsequent investigation by Citizens Against UFO Secrecy finds many discrepancies in Kaback’s account and very little credibility. (“[Ft.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Just%2520Cause%2520(CAUS)/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520Old%2520Series/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520Issue%252006%2520-%2520Old%2520Series.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014716143&usg=AOvVaw1mU_Safq9D4vy4oRFvvhS5)

[Riley Landing: Hoax or Delusion?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Just%2520Cause%2520(CAUS)/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520Old%2520Series/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520Issue%252006%2520-%2520Old%2520Series.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014716537&usg=AOvVaw3Leh812Fg_n4OvYDGbiIQ2)” Just Cause 1, no. 6 (September 1978): 11–14; Clark III 603–604; Kevin D. Randle, A History of UFO Crashes, Avon, 1995, [p. 201](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/historyofufocras0000rand/page/200/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014716907&usg=AOvVaw2mdFxCDFWXgPy5zwg4nGXW))

November 5? — Day. Mauritz Löugren and a friend see a triangular-shaped object moving back and forth for 20 minutes over Luleå, Sweden. It disappears silently to the west at great speed. (“[World Round-Up,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014717207&usg=AOvVaw0w6MoN0j6KgK5PITp_PW0s)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1966): iii)

November 9 — 5:16 p.m. The Northeast power blackout, a significant disruption in the supply of electricity, affects parts of Ontario, Connecticut, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, Pennsylvania, and Vermont. Over 30 million people and 80,000 square miles are left without electricity for up to 13 hours. The cause of the failure is the setting of a protective relay on one of the transmission lines from the Sir Adam Beck Hydroelectric Power Station No. 2 in Queenston, Ontario, near Niagara Falls. Prior to and coincident with the blackout, there are a number of reports of unusual lights in Syracuse and Niagara Falls, New York, and Holliston, Massachusetts, and there is speculation that the blackout is related to UFO activity in some way. But there is no evidence of a direct connection. (Wikipedia, “[Northeast blackout of 1965](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northeast_blackout_of_1965&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014717621&usg=AOvVaw2NBP3dhMIuPi6FKrnT8MBR)”; “[New Clues to UFO Electrical](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/029%2520NOV-DEC%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014717863&usg=AOvVaw2JfC1Rij4cjPqjq29N0suo) [Interference,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/029%2520NOV-DEC%25201965.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014718096&usg=AOvVaw1Q--WvUWWpn5H-mqEbQS3o)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 5 (Nov./Dec. 1965): 3–4; “[The Question of the Power Blackouts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201965%252011%252000%2520-%2520November-December.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014718449&usg=AOvVaw3XHah9IvN7kkEYimA9C8dt)” APRO Bulletin, Nov./Dec. 1965, pp. 4–6; John G. Fuller, Incident at Exeter, Putnam’s Sons, 1966, pp. 230–235; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014718838&usg=AOvVaw3mUcR2EuqdrcRswvD07TfX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014719067&usg=AOvVaw2JHA720FkJW8oQXFXlDsEQ) pp. 201–203; Condon, [pp. 110–115](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/110/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014719311&usg=AOvVaw2M9MikRQKyvUO7c4nS1wV5); Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, pp. 130–137; Michael D. Swords, GrassRoots UFOs: Case Reports from the Timmerman

Files, Fund for UFO Research, 2005, p. 145; Chris Rutkowski and Geoff Dittman, The Canadian UFO Report,

Dundurn Press, 2006, pp. 99–102)

* * *

November 10 — Before dawn. Actor [Stuart Whitman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stuart_Whitman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014719878&usg=AOvVaw1IXEklIrZqja9Ryi_-jSFh) is staying in a hotel in Manhattan, New York City, during the Northeast power blackout. He hears a “sound, like a whippoorwill whistling outside my twelfth-story window.” He steps to the window and sees 2 luminous UFOs hovering nearby, one orange, the other blue. He hears voices from the UFOs in his head, telling him they are fearful of earth because humans are messing around with “unknown quantities” that might disrupt the balance of the universe. They claim the blackout is a small demonstration of their power and ask Whitman to do what he can to fight malice, prejudice, and hate on earth. The objects disappear. (“[El Paso Blackout Recalls New York Experience to Actor,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95137296/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014720181&usg=AOvVaw3KVI_B2HCS-_CT9DEdIb4b)” El Paso (Tex.) Herald-Post, December 24, 1965, p. 4; Jerome Clark, “[The Greatest Flap Yet? Part IV,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014720485&usg=AOvVaw16bz_9GFOiIEg8jZDD9m9u)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1966): 10; Clark III 1280–1281; Patrick Gross, [URECAT](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-11-09-usa-newyorkcity.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014720783&usg=AOvVaw3Tabnu0UTyZcp7W-8aXc-6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/ce3/1965-11-09-usa-newyorkcity.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014720984&usg=AOvVaw1AUJGI_ek3FnZ2R7dtl2LY) July 25, 2008)

November 26 — 8:00–9:00 p.m. Numerous power outages around St. Paul, Minnesota, are accompanied by observations of white or blue lights in the sky. (“[Power Outages Accompanied by Flashes,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252001%252000%2520-%2520January-February.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014721357&usg=AOvVaw32w-sCvzoeOp_hYZGSfYb8)” APRO Bulletin, Jan./Feb. 1966, pp. 3–4; [Schopick](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014721693&usg=AOvVaw0oHEi9eWLsofj370W5Vae7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/A_Study_of_Secondary_Effects-An_Unpublished_Manuscript_of_UFO_E-M_Cases.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014721919&usg=AOvVaw3GQtQbayHinmZ-qI5ln3d0) pp. 199–201)

November 30 — 3:30 a.m. Seaman Ian Kinsey is on watch at Canadian Forces Base Cornwallis \[now Cornwallis Park\] in Nova Scotia. As he is passing a window, he sees a lighted yellow oval object resting on the beach. Five minutes later a sliding door on the object’s side opens, emitting a white light. Then a smaller, cigarette-shaped UFO enters the larger object through the dear. The bigger object rises, pushing rocks and logs away from the center of the beach. It cruises slowly over a mountain and disappears. (Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014722293&usg=AOvVaw0QqgWN7cYvqrItZOXZMIck) [Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014722571&usg=AOvVaw0w5XVbQk_Aa9qixd5HKUzO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014722867&usg=AOvVaw13gZJFUfj11t0bhXOgUVWk) NICAP, 1969, pp. 59–61)

December 5 — During the [Gemini 7](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gemini_7&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014723267&usg=AOvVaw1j43iKcXoRT07XBVGtZ5Pa) mission, the astronauts mention a “bogey.” [James Oberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014723516&usg=AOvVaw1hZkCyplhYda0S8SRRRg1H)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014723689&usg=AOvVaw2PCFkQ8uL1TJw9sYFxdJEE) based on his trajectory analysis of the mission, describes the astronauts’ comments as referring to booster-associated debris and not a reference to some sort of UFO. Astronaut [Frank Borman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Borman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014723907&usg=AOvVaw0E_3WWsc8wFYR3BAU5nV1c) later confirms that what he saw was not a UFO. When he offers to go on the television show Unsolved Mysteries to clarify, the producers tell him, “Well, I’m not sure we want you on the program.” (Wikipedia, “[UFO sightings in outer space](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO_sightings_in_outer_space&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014724228&usg=AOvVaw1SynTj-aeJ6lOu_2Xg04ay)”; Condon, [pp. 207–208](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/206/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014724475&usg=AOvVaw01SWyxyoP_Uke332n9F_Zg); Good Above, [p. 378](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/B-001-014-055/page/378/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014724695&usg=AOvVaw3mImjefVBr0ZLgV50mFKky))

December 9 — 4:47 p.m. A large, brilliant fireball is seen by thousands in at least six states and Ontario, Canada. It streaks over the Detroit, Michigan–Windsor, Ontario, area, reportedly drops hot metal debris over Michigan and northern Ohio starting some grass fires and causes sonic booms in the Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, metropolitan area. It is generally assumed and reported by the press to be a meteor after authorities discount other proposed explanations such as a plane crash, errant missile test, or reentering satellite debris. However, eyewitnesses in the small village of Kecksburg, Pennsylvania, claim something has crashed in the woods. A boy sees the object land; his mother [Frances Kalp](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134458868/frances-margaret-kalp&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014725042&usg=AOvVaw3wjW7Y61nsDYhZUuVioSwK) sees a wisp of blue smoke rising from the woods and alerts local radio station WHJB. Another observer reports feeling a vibration and “a thump” about the time the object reportedly lands. Others from Kecksburg, including local volunteer fire department members (Carl Metz and Paul Shipco), report seeing an object in the shape of an acorn and about as large as a Volkswagen Beetle. Writing resembling Egyptian hieroglyphs is also said to be in a band around the base of the object. A reporter and news director for WHJB, [John J. Murphy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/129235426/john-j-murphy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014725380&usg=AOvVaw3Nbf6P0oiiMZmMts1yeOCm)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/129235426/john-j-murphy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014725615&usg=AOvVaw05DVopjeLDic56zzLX_oRF) arrives on the scene of the event before authorities have arrived, in response to several calls to the station from alarmed citizens. He takes several photographs and conducts interviews with witnesses. His former wife Bonnie Millslagle later reports that all but one roll of the film is confiscated by military personnel.

WHJB office manager Mabel Mazza describes one of the pictures: “It was very dark and it was with a lot of trees around and everything. And I don’t know how far away from the site he was. But I did see a picture of a sort of a cone-like thing. It’s the only time I ever saw it.” Witnesses further report that an intense military presence, most notably the US Army, is secures the area, orders civilians out, seals the area within 2 hours of the event, and then removes an object on a flatbed truck. The military claims they have searched the woods and can find “absolutely nothing.” The official explanation of the widely seen fireball is that it is a mid-sized meteor, as suggested, for example, by University of Michigan astronomer [William P. Bidelman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_P._Bidelman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014725983&usg=AOvVaw0IR4OCwJtc1f8XPcdB9awA)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_P._Bidelman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014726170&usg=AOvVaw3g7RQL6kZZoMGAyKfd8Epx) However, speculation as to the identity of the Kecksburg object (if there was one—reports vary) include an alien craft; debris from [Kosmos 96](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kosmos_96&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014726443&usg=AOvVaw2D4qcuAV8WpF6RgDf46Y_i) ([James](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014726680&usg=AOvVaw02ZMyYCwIrOgcPqy8AIekL) [Oberg](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Oberg&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014726878&usg=AOvVaw1jZAoIE2K-aDZd9L_pLtnc)), a Soviet space probe intended for Venus that fails and never leaves the Earth’s atmosphere (now seen as unlikely); December 13 — An amateur astronomer in Fort Worth, Texas, watches a UFO through several different telescopes. It has a recessed ring with small dark objects attached around its edge and a dark cross on its bottom. It moves from directly beneath the Moon and past Arcturus, then suddenly disappears. (Michael D. Swords, “Gazing at the Moons,” IUR 32, no. 4 (October 2009): 14)

December 15 — 8:45 p.m. C. M. W. Martyn of Worcester Park, southwest London, England, watches a “candle-wax white” triangular object, about 130 feet wide and completely silent, pass over his home toward the northwest at about 1,200 mph. (“[Surrey Deltavolant?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201966%2520V%252012%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014732725&usg=AOvVaw1fPxPtuQpOU040a_uSAua5)” Flying Saucer Review 12, no. 2 (March/April 1966): 35)

December 19 — 11:45 p.m. Edward A. Bruns is driving his father’s 1962 Ford pickup truck, heading west just south of Herman, Minnesota. He sees a bright, oval-shaped object hovering several feet above the road. It covers the entire road and is shaped like two saucers with a dome on top. A window-like structure surrounds the dome and emits a green light. Suddenly the truck engine stops, the headlights go out, and the vehicle lifts up, spins violently to the right, ending up in a ditch on the other side of the road. Stunned, Bruns stares at the UFO, which makes a whistling sound, emits sparks, shoots upward, and disappears. He runs home, scared and nervous. His father goes to the site of the crash but cannot get the truck out. A reporter later confirms seeing the truck in the ditch with a complete “absence of skid marks in the snow to account for how it got there.” (Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014733190&usg=AOvVaw1AKSleDou51CtK3EpZosQN)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014733453&usg=AOvVaw1UKzzdxzQmc2DZnB-RMLuw) NICAP, 1969, p. 50)

1966 — [Jacques](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Vall%25C3%25A9e&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014733935&usg=AOvVaw2ZXjPWR7nhVEJcBCDCN7mM) and [Janine Vallée](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.tributes.com/obituary/show/Janine-Marcelle-Vallee-87751069&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014734213&usg=AOvVaw0fOxiBFXMH3maScGVtsFKe) publish Challenge to Science: The UFO Enigma, a general survey of the present state of the UFO problem. The first section gives an analysis of UFO patterns by examining UFO features, the second part deals with sighting frequencies, and the third part analyzes cases according to type. (Jacques and Janine Vallée, [Challenge to Science: The UFO Enigma](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/challengetoscien00vall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014734537&usg=AOvVaw3zvPnAF5OA-RxRV3B106CE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/challengetoscien00vall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014734715&usg=AOvVaw2orst_0wtnJdjq-v2oV0Pm) Regnery, 1966; Clark III 1213)

1966 — Cornell University astronomer [Carl Sagan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Sagan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014735009&usg=AOvVaw0ajTxd2E9_O6LuKzpknFkP) coauthors a book with Russian astrophysicist [Iosif Shklovsky](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iosif_Shklovsky&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014735263&usg=AOvVaw0k09_bBkKigz9sO71l-Cvu) on Intelligent Life in the Universe (an expansion of Shklovsky’s 1962 book) in which he speculates that Earth might have been visited by aliens many times in the past few billion years, at least once in “historical times.” Discussing the biological as well as astronomical issues of the subject, its unique format—alternating paragraphs written by Shklovsky and Sagan—allows them to express their views without compromise. (I. S. Shklovskii and Carl Sagan, [Intelligent Life in the Universe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/intelligentlifei00shkl/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014735630&usg=AOvVaw3H-YA8i2ceMcSFEYKOZzNU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/intelligentlifei00shkl/page/n5/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014735835&usg=AOvVaw2II16MTrXohQYbCST_RixP) Holden-Day, 1966; Michael D. Ordway III](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_I._Ordway_III&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014736278&usg=AOvVaw0_6YIYZxSkmvnwSLPR2Bae) publish Intelligence in the Universe, discussing cosmology, biological origins and evolution, SETI within and outside the solar system, and speculations on intelligence. January 7 — 4:10 a.m. Police Constable Colin Perks is checking business property along Alderley Road in Wilmslow, Cheshire, England, when he hears a high-pitched whine. He sees a greenish-gray glow in the sky about 300 feet away and 35 feet in the air. It comes from a glowing elliptical object about 30 feet long and 20 feet wide that remains stationary for 5 seconds before moving away quickly to the east-southeast. (J. Cleary-Baker, “[Police](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/BUFORA%2520-%25201964-1981%2520BUFORA%2520JOURNAL%2520Vols.1%2520to%252010/BUFORA%2520Journal%2520-%2520Volume%252001%2520No%252009%2520-%2520Summer%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014737501&usg=AOvVaw3z3LFSXd5dMxRz2z6sSRHx) [Constable Observes a UFO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/BUFORA%2520-%25201964-1981%2520BUFORA%2520JOURNAL%2520Vols.1%2520to%252010/BUFORA%2520Journal%2520-%2520Volume%252001%2520No%252009%2520-%2520Summer%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014737868&usg=AOvVaw2KUDp6LpHdUwmugeKxm9PH)” BUFORA Journal and Bulletin 1, no. 9 (Summer 1966): 5; UFOFiles2, [pp. 73–75](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n121/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014738362&usg=AOvVaw2c4LGbgjVdkRAEVTqqmccT); Jenny Randles, “Perks of the Job,” Fortean Times 344 (October 2016): 29)

January 7 — 3:27 p.m. High school student Gary Finch is driving on the Wilmer-Georgetown Road about 3 miles southwest of Georgetown, Alabama. He sees a large silver ball about 15–20 feet in diameter that descends then hovers about 5 feet above the road. On top of it is a cone with a large green light, and it is making a whining sound. As he approaches it, his car engine cuts out and his watch stops. After 1–2 minutes, it disappears in a gradual climb. (“[Mobile Reports Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/99801734/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014739043&usg=AOvVaw2TmLd3vxMa4Mb3V_2wDQZW)” Selma (Ala.)
