January 14 — 5:55 p.m. After his 11-year-old son runs into the house in Weston, Massachusetts, and says a flying saucer is outside, an associate laboratory director at Massachusetts Institute of Technology goes outside with the rest of the family and sees an erratically moving bright light. They observe it through binoculars for 5–10 minutes. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 43](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/42/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014744388&usg=AOvVaw3-IIXKX-stuo5xzpGBPUlB), [52–53](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/52/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014744731&usg=AOvVaw24rTwzBO1ZST7vQ5tOAd1T))

January 17 — A B-52G Strategic Air Command bomber collides with a KC-135 tanker during mid-air refueling at 31,000 feet over the Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Spain. The tanker is completely destroyed and the B-52G breaks apart, killing 3 of its 7 crew members. Of the four Mk28-type hydrogen bombs the B-52G carries, three are found on land near the small fishing village of Palomares, Spain. The non-nuclear explosives in two of the weapons detonate upon impact with the ground, resulting in the contamination of a 0.77-square-mile area by plutonium.

The fourth, which falls into the Mediterranean, is recovered intact after a 2 1⁄2-month-long search. Some 800 individuals with no hands-on expertise improvise search and decontamination procedures. More than 1,400 tons of radioactive soil and plant life are excavated and shipped to the Savannah River plant in South Carolina for burial. (Wikipedia, “[1966 Palomares B-52 crash](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1966_Palomares_B-52_crash&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014746060&usg=AOvVaw2ENfP29To6LI1v7vjzeD3e)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [pp. 297–300](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/296/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014746516&usg=AOvVaw1A8-aP88T7tiRa09XcTxRq))

January 18 — 4:55 p.m. Two surveyors are taking readings at China Lake Naval Ordnance Test Station \[now Naval Air Weapons Station China Lake\] in the western Mojave Desert, California. The surveyor using a theodolite hears a hum, looks up, and sees a UFO flying nearly straight at him from an angle of 35°–40° and from almost exact north. It passes directly overhead at less than 150 feet, then dives smoothly, turns to the east, then comes to within 10 feet of the sloping ground. The surveyor observes the object through the theodolite until it is lost in front of a lava flow about 2 miles away. Both observers (the other one is in a truck) say it is moving at 150 mph and it is a dull black color and very quiet. They attempt to report the sighting, but the radio is garbled. Their truck has difficulty starting, and the theodolite exhibits an odd change in the gravity reference indicator, requiring it to be

re-leveled. (“A Professional Observation,” IUR 7, no. 2 (March 1982): 7–8)

January 19 — Around 9:00 a.m. A banana grower, George Pedley, is driving a tractor about one half mile from a farmhouse at Tully, Queensland, Australia, owned by Albert Pennisi. Pedley’s attention is drawn by a hissing sound, clearly heard over the noise from the tractor’s engine. He looks about for the source of the noise and sees an unusual object about 75 feet away. It is some 30 feet in the air, rising vertically, and is shaped like “two saucers face to face.” It is light gray in color, dull, and non-reflective. He estimates its size as 25 feet long by 8–9 feet deep. The hissing diminishes as the object rises to a height of 60 feet, then departs, climbing at about an angle of 45°, extremely fast, to the southwest. The duration of his observation is only 5–6 seconds. The object appears to be always rotating. After its departure, Pedley finds a clearly defined, nearly circular depression in swamp grass, in a water-filled lagoon, at the point where he first saw it. The marking is about 32 feet long by 25 feet wide. The grass on the surface of the water is flattened in a clockwise direction. Royal Australian Air Force intelligence officers find a variety of circles in the area, ranging from 8 to 30 feet in diameter. Within each circle the plant roots are pulled completely out of the soil, as if the ground has been subjected to an intense rotary force. (“[The Tully ‘Nests’: How Freakish Can Whirlwinds Be?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201966%252007%2520-%2520no%25205%2520VFSRS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014747659&usg=AOvVaw0IStzs460mEPcySL9ZerAq)” Australian Flying Saucer Review (Victorian Edition), no. 5 (July 1966): 3–7; “[UFOs No Strangers to Tully,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201966%252011%2520-%2520no%25209%2520UFOIC.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014748249&usg=AOvVaw0UrUv2Y6VYvhHXQ8fwFfCE)” Australian Flying Saucer Review, no. 9 (November 1966): 15; “[1966: Tully…After Tully,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201966%252011%2520-%2520no%25209%2520UFOIC.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014748668&usg=AOvVaw1Z2AC0AKVu9tx-fSEqio-v)” Australian Flying Saucer Review, no. 9 (November 1966): 16–21; Keith Basterfield, Vladimir Godic, and Pony Godic, “Australian Ufology: A Review,” JUFOS 2 (1990): 26–27; Bill Chalker, “[The 1966 Tully Saucer ‘Nest’: A Classic UFO Physical Trace Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/forum/bctully.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014749090&usg=AOvVaw1Ewo05dZ9J7zuUEkarP3Hh)” 1997; Bill Chalker, “Tully Saucer Nests of 1966—Part One,” IUR 22, no. 4 (Winter 1997–1998): 14–20; Bill Chalker, “Tully Saucer Nests of 1966, Part Two,” IUR 23, no. 1 (Spring 1998): 17, 31; Clark III 1136–1138)

January 19 — 7:55 p.m. Two luminous objects pass over Acarigua, Venezuela, one from the north, the other from the east. When the paths of the two objects cross, the lights go out in the entire city. (“[More S.A. Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252003%252000%2520-%2520March-April.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014749807&usg=AOvVaw0bOIlbR3-MUplfdFvY4ZiL)” APRO Bulletin, March/Apr. 1966, p. 8)

February 3 — A six-member Ad Hoc Committee to Review Project Blue Book, headed by University of Rochester optical physicist [Brian O’Brien](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_O%2527Brien&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014750359&usg=AOvVaw1B1wQ0qQq9CWzSBGWFbwkY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_O%2527Brien&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014750569&usg=AOvVaw1e-mS-nFy95dNa5j-V6KuN) meets at Wright-Patterson AFB in Dayton, Ohio. All but one (astronomer [Carl Sagan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Sagan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014750785&usg=AOvVaw1CaVtg8pLKW6RmDEr9Hbs6))

* * *

are members of the Air Force Scientific Advisory Board (psychologist [Launor F. Carter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://prabook.com/web/launor_franklin.carter/362018&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014751165&usg=AOvVaw04_BWbdsq1yRFd4zgrdRmA)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://prabook.com/web/launor_franklin.carter/362018&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014751460&usg=AOvVaw1tT03Cv-nGPB8ELyiwxgEU) industrial psychologist [Jesse Orlansky](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://prabook.com/web/jesse.orlansky/3479778&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014751779&usg=AOvVaw1sB3qyGl1WbUS06efhZx0G)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://prabook.com/web/jesse.orlansky/3479778&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014752045&usg=AOvVaw3U3rUL7dxlnTeER34wKuCK) rocket scientist [Richard W. Porter](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nytimes.com/1996/10/10/us/richard-w-porter-83-led-early-space-effort.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014752452&usg=AOvVaw21D1f2dvGB04HwH5ePlgm4), computer engineer [Willis Ware](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willis_Ware&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014752774&usg=AOvVaw0jlkxKQl8Y4-qhqdZldk2s)), and none have any sympathy with the idea that UFO reports represent anything extraordinary. Also attending is Lt. Col. [Harold A. Steiner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/175992768/harold-a-steiner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014753127&usg=AOvVaw3eX7z_8w-GkWK04ztY8gwQ), assistant secretary to the Scientific Advisory Board. They receive a briefing from [Quintanilla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hector_Quintanilla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014753463&usg=AOvVaw0AEm1JXLjFfEEyTufEgUnh)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hector_Quintanilla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014753726&usg=AOvVaw0QUHEo-VaHiKEtc0eJC8SZ) review the Robertson Panel report, and examine a few UFO cases. The group recommends that Blue Book “be strengthened to provide opportunity for scientific investigation of selected sightings in more detail and depth than has been possible to date.” Furthermore, USAF should negotiate contracts “with a few selected universities to provide scientific teams to investigate promptly and in depth certain selected sightings of UFOs…. The universities should be chosen to provide good geographical distribution.” They also conclude that “perhaps 100 sightings a year might be subjected to this close study, and that possibly an average of 10 man-days might be required per sighting so studied. The information provided by such a program might bring to light new facts of scientific value.” The group recommends that Blue Book data be given “wide unsolicited circulation among prominent members of the Congress and other public persons.” The Air Force ignores their recommendations. ((USAF Scientific Advisory Board, [Special Report of the USAF Scientific Advisory Board Ad Hoc Committee to Review](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/obrien.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014754168&usg=AOvVaw0ZOHbu-dY5G_AVxJTTMZ4b) [Project “Blue Book,”](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/obrien.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014754553&usg=AOvVaw0avXDiSHLlS-p39sCGoRHf) Brian O’Brien, chairman of the Advisory Board, March 1966; Clark III 1191)

February 6 — 6:05 a.m. Mr. and [Mrs.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/176088286/rosetta-l-gulley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014755043&usg=AOvVaw1hLYmiqpymTmkAlYw0cArL) [Kenneth R. Gulley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72265511/kenneth-r-gulley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014755393&usg=AOvVaw0nXoWMpZh7q3C1u9xgd9gP) see a tadpole-shaped object about 14 feet long and 2 feet wide with eight yellow-and-red, neon-like lights at 250–500 feet altitude in Nederland, Texas. It casts a pulsating red glow on the lawn. Her house and street lights go out as high-frequency sound assaults the witnesses’ ears. The object blinks out when aircraft pass overhead, then comes on again afterward. It departed to the west about 1.5 miles to the vicinity of the airport, where an aircraft’s landing lights light up the UFO. Then it disappears in a slow climb. (NICAP, “[House Lights Go Out When ‘Tadpole’ Flies Over](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/660206nederland_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014755835&usg=AOvVaw2-28K8X3wehIchdK7LeSql)” ; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014756138&usg=AOvVaw09sIrQBJPLCi1jJKFjMirN)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014756391&usg=AOvVaw1YCA-dQV915wVAZpl-hPeH) p. 309; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 103–104](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/102/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014756812&usg=AOvVaw12KZBhihRZOWx7WCCmh26n))

February 6 — Around 8:00 p.m. Several persons in the barrio of Aluche, Madrid, Spain, allegedly see an unusual flying object. Looking out a window, Maria Ruiz Torres watches an object descending. She sees a “gigantic eye” looking at her through a porthole. Another witness, Juan Jiminez Dias, thinks he sees a door open in the craft. Other observers include soldiers at a nearby ammunition dump. Motorist [José Luis Jordán Peña](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ummowiki.fr/index.php/Jos%25C3%25A9_Luis_Jord%25C3%25A1n_Pe%25C3%25B1a&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014757330&usg=AOvVaw3jGVsDMMOwrDjgkh1X69Tf) gets a close, extended view of the object, which he characterizes as “enormous.” Jordán Peña sends Spanish ufologist [Antonio](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ummowiki.fr/index.php/Antonio_Ribera&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014757733&usg=AOvVaw2z9xGZHVPVnuFPQ7_oSJqP) [Ribera](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ummowiki.fr/index.php/Antonio_Ribera&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014758060&usg=AOvVaw1HhHMm041xdCnEFf3XHVw2) a sketch of the UFO, which has three legs and a curious symbol on its underside—something like two reverse parentheses with a vertical bar positioned between them. No other witness mentions anything like this. In 1992, Jordán Peña confesses to hoaxing his sighting, including the landing marks and physical traces, in order to prove his theory that paranoia is much more widespread in Spain that psychiatrists are willing to admit. (Antonio Ribera, “[The San José de Valderas Photographs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201969%2520V%252015%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014758458&usg=AOvVaw3DS43DJmAlmpjjMLSGIIPi)” Flying Saucer Review 15, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1969): 3–10; “Background of ‘Ummo’ and the Sightings,” CUFOS Bulletin, Spring 1977, pp. 2–3; Clark III 1183; Scott Corrales, “[The UMMO Experience: Are You Experienced?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.strangemag.com/ummo.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014758812&usg=AOvVaw1EWMhsIp5moYyOGv-noMk8)” Strange Magazine, January 31, 2001; Alain Moreau, “[UMMO: Une imposture?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.mondenouveau.fr/presence-extraterrestre-ummo-une-imposture-ou-pas/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014759158&usg=AOvVaw3dNws_REhyVQ9-KSeGbT-w)” Les Cles de l’Inexplique)

February 27 — A nationally broadcast public affairs interview program, The Open Mind, presents a panel discussion titled “Are Flying Saucers Only Science Fiction?” Princeton University history professor [Eric F. Goldman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_F._Goldman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014759701&usg=AOvVaw3s3lxXdiMRt2u7tAD1DpXp) is moderator. Panelists include astronomer [Donald H. Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014760079&usg=AOvVaw1aVFT0TwOemGBxUYdoZN6e)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014760387&usg=AOvVaw1GcrAbu4TVNkRJZG64hjD-) plant physiologist [Frank B. Salisbury](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_B._Salisbury&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014760735&usg=AOvVaw3GXHUAYrMA7wpDcjBi_8kU)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_B._Salisbury&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014761009&usg=AOvVaw1NcFAi14n62pcioQdwJo6r) journalist [John G. Fuller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_G._Fuller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014761335&usg=AOvVaw1GqvH9MoxhlI6nFPLISRQA), psychologist [R. Leo Sprinkle](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2021/11/leo-sprinkle-has-died.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014761682&usg=AOvVaw3XwSqnNXytv7Vk365FJprX)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2021/11/leo-sprinkle-has-died.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014761978&usg=AOvVaw1tlrFRWpbudKm4TxlO_Z6v) and astronomer [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014762294&usg=AOvVaw0UqY5RFcg6UCyMeJmt_eJ8)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014762543&usg=AOvVaw2FDcWXoqxhT1PVk2oOrL7f) Menzel calls the Exeter police officers “hysterical subjects,” although he cannot remember their names and is unfamiliar with the case. (“[Notable Broadcasts of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/jufoh/JournalUFOHistoryVol1No2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014762862&usg=AOvVaw2rM9VEHuiZys0vAgcuy00P) [Past:](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/jufoh/JournalUFOHistoryVol1No2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014763099&usg=AOvVaw0lyD-kJLGNPdUJA7vpPi1y) [The Open Mind](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/jufoh/JournalUFOHistoryVol1No2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014763295&usg=AOvVaw1v7rLPCGfK_O6oQf_h33Tb) [NBC Public Affairs Presentation, February 27, 1966,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/jufoh/JournalUFOHistoryVol1No2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014763488&usg=AOvVaw0-zXGS7vZK7AwkazqWiNQP)” Journal of UFO History 1, no. 2 (May/June 2004): 3–6)

March — Kathleen Reeves and a friend are walking on a rural road near their homes in Toledo, Oregon, when they think they see a neighbor’s field on fire. The fire seems oddly dome-shaped. They continue walking and see another smaller, duller light. Kathleen thinks it might be a prank, so she throws a rock at it. Suddenly, a group of much larger lights come on all around the small one. Frightened, the girls run home. Over the next few months, through October, the Reeves home experiences such poltergeist phenomena as whirring or sawing noises, rose-colored lights inside, small rings of light that crawl over the bedroom walls, and light beams. (Michael D. Swords, “A Trick of the Light,” IUR 31, no. 2 (June 2007): 8)

March 5 — The D-21 is first launched from an M-21 off the coast of California. The drone is released but stays close to the M-21’s back for a few seconds, which seems like “two hours” to the M-21 crew. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed D-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_D-21&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014764048&usg=AOvVaw2wngWG1GmnpJLzsreXdpBk) [21](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_D-21&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014764276&usg=AOvVaw056nFwi5Ohu6npp9LlM5HS)”)

March 6 — 2:00 a.m. Ivan de Almeida and other medical staff at the Lourenço Jorge Municipal Hospital in Barra da Tijuca, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, watch an oval object with a bright red-orange light that shines on the ocean waters

* * *

below. After 2 hours it climbs up slowly, dims, and disappears. (Olavo T. Fontes, “[Report from Brazil: The First](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252003%252000%2520-%2520March-April.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014764747&usg=AOvVaw2cWuKjHkmXqaBS3aU3uDTj) [UAO Sightings in 1966,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252003%252000%2520-%2520March-April.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014765057&usg=AOvVaw2RpH8VkcfB4Iy3yMtIEvz_)” APRO Bulletin, March/April 1966, p. 5)

March 12 — 10:40 a.m. A security guard at the Fábrica Nacional de Motores in Duque de Caxias, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, alerts 10 employees to a mysterious light that is approaching the factory. It descends to 1,500–1,800 feet and hovers above the plant. The object is approximately 18 feet in diameter and emits a brilliant white light that makes it difficult to look at directly. It periodically flashes even brighter. Plant director Col. Jorge Alberto Silveira Martins calls the Army and Air Force. After 30 minutes, the object dims and moves away at tremendous speed before the Army trucks arrive. (Olavo T. Fontes, “[Report from Brazil: The First UAO Sightings in 1966,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252003%252000%2520-%2520March-April.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014765519&usg=AOvVaw1M5pB24PPEY-KlxR_E6Ox3)” APRO Bulletin, March/April 1966, p. 5)

March 14 — 3:30 –5:30 a.m. Washtenaw County sheriff’s deputies Buford Bushroe and John Foster see highly maneuverable disc-shaped UFOs with flashing red and green lights over Dexter, Michigan. They call in a report that sets off a two-and-a-half hour chase that stretches over three counties and out over Lake Erie. Police from five jurisdictions are involved. Selfridge AFB \[now Selfridge Air National Guard Base\], near Mount Clemens, reports tracking UFOs on radar over Lake Erie. (UFOEv II 184–185; O’Connell 177; Patrick Gross, “[Michigan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/michi66.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014765936&usg=AOvVaw3Xg9C0DoIC-0jLJPzxef88) [1966: Sheriffs Watch High-Performance Discs, Also Tracked on Radar](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/michi66.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014766167&usg=AOvVaw1GbLbkiQxtD0FSztJ4w50j)”)

March 16 — 5:45 p.m. Many people see a white, oval object crash into the Atlantic Ocean close to the Ilha Cagarras off Ipanema, Brazil. Some see a few smaller white parachute-shaped objects fall from it. A thorough search turns up nothing in the sea or the island itself. (Lorenzen, UFOs over the Americas, Signet, 1968, p. 54)

March 17 — 4:25 a.m. Police Sgt. Neil Schneider and Deputy David Fitzpatrick see top-shaped objects making sharp maneuvers over Milan, Michigan. They alternatively hover, rise and fall quickly, dart around at jet-like speed, dimming and brightening periodically. Two objects are operating together, while a third UFO hovers at a lower altitude. (UFOEv II 185; O’Connell 177; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014766586&usg=AOvVaw1bjibVRJuPVzDrli_pbNhP), p. 310)

March 20 — 7:30 p.m. After his dogs start making a racket, [Frank Mannor](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49963015/frank-e_-mannor&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014766978&usg=AOvVaw13XvwGSv44PYJY7MNefsi4) and his 26-year-old son Ronald see strange lights over a swampy area in Dexter Township, Michigan. They walk over to the area for a look, taking about 30 minutes, and see a pyramid-shaped object with a rounded top, corrugated surface, and blue, red, and white lights. Mannor’s son-in-law Bob Wagner, back at the house, sees the object light up and rise to 500 feet, then come down again making some noise. Washtenaw County sheriff’s deputies David Fitzpatrick and [Stanley McFadden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/136211746/stanley-arthur-mcfadden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014767299&usg=AOvVaw3iW3lf-furzydQUnpEX5Vb) arrive about 9:00 p.m. drive towards the swamp on Quigley Road. They see a brilliant light that dims and then reappears. By this time a crowd has gathered. One man reports that when two flashlights appear in the distance, the object seems to react by flying away at high speed. At another point the object passes directly over the Mannors with a whistling sound like a rifle bullet ricocheting. It remains in the swampy area for 30 minutes. (“[Swamp Gas Answer Disproved](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/031%2520MAR-APR%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014768040&usg=AOvVaw2b8uNawbM43h7TGGwb3T6Z),” UFO Investigator 3, no. 7 (March/April 1966): 5; UFOEv II 185–186; O’Connell 175–177, 184–185; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014768348&usg=AOvVaw3Y3RZcWl6YX1X3RgeyZPK2), p. 310; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1966_03_20-21_US_MI_Dexter-Hillsdale_CUFOS_MultiWit_NLr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014768596&usg=AOvVaw3o3gZUG2AJ8XQy2FYlaE9_)\]; Patrick Gross, “[Hillsdale, Michigan, 1966: The Infamous ‘Swamp Gas’ Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/hillsdale66.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014768827&usg=AOvVaw22aQPnXxNvEUTPA7LUUknB)”)

March 21 — 10:32 p.m. Cynthia “Pinky” Poffenberger and 16 other Hillsdale (Michigan) College students see a football- shaped object with red, green, and white pulsating lights descend from the sky and pass close to their dorm. It settles in a hollow in the Slayton Arboretum about 1,500 feet away. Some 87 students collect to watch the UFO, then they notify Civil Defense Director William Van Horn, who arrives with police. From the dormitory, the landed lights appear yellowish-white, dimming and intensifying. Only student [Barbara Kohn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ncnewsonline.com/archives/barbara-kohn/article_ac8bed04-0b06-5a0d-9a0e-05368dbed1f7.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014769199&usg=AOvVaw2DH916pUQdSEKoqyMgAnFy) stays most of the night, watching the lights vanish, reappear, and recede. Around 5:10 a.m., Kohn sees a lighted object move away and disappear from sight. Radiation is later detected at the landing area of about 330–600 microroentgens/hr, roughly 10–20 times the background level. (O’Connell 177–180, 185–188; Clark III 950; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014769491&usg=AOvVaw0c4jrglZZfALtl56_LldXe), p. 311; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1966_03_20-21_US_MI_Dexter-Hillsdale_CUFOS_MultiWit_NLr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014769747&usg=AOvVaw1U_UIvHCgVRp7gJQA728c8)\]; Jack Butler, “[UFO: In 1966, Hillsdale Had Its Own Close Encounter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://hillsdalecollegian.com/2015/03/ufo-in-1966-hillsdale-had-its-own-close-encounter/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014770019&usg=AOvVaw1-bzd4m5amd5QSeD5ZI2Hz)” The Collegian (Hillsdale College), March 19, 2015)

March 22 — Morning. Contactee [George Hunt Williamson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Hunt_Williamson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014770396&usg=AOvVaw226-k_FFjQg0RotWblo7kt) sees three large UFOs with brilliant, flashing, blue-white lights hover above him for one minute in Key West, Florida. He hears a familiar buzzing in his head. (Michael D. Swords, “A Little Walk in the Strange Life of George Hunt Williamson,” IUR 26, no. 2 (Summer 2001): 14, 32)

March 22 — 10:00 p.m. Several people standing outside the Waterfront Playhouse in Key West, Florida, during an intermission, see three UFOs ringed with flashing blue-white lights hovering nearby. They zoom off over the Gulf. (“[Keys Theatre-Goers Report ‘Flying Discs,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/92455628/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014770856&usg=AOvVaw2ANBjPwU8tHMxLRzSjrPtc)” Miami (Fla.) Herald, March 24, 1966, p. 3-C)

March 23 — 5:05 a.m. As Sheppard AFB (near Wichita Falls, Texas) civilian instructor William E. “Eddie” Laxson is driving west on US Highway 70 eight miles south of Temple, Oklahoma, he finds the road blocked by a wingless aircraft, shaped like a fish, in the road. It is about 75 feet long, nearly 8 feet high, 12 feet wide, with a Plexiglas bubble on top, and bright lights forward and aft. Laxson stops his car about 300 feet away and walks to within 50 feet, noticing a designation on its side like “TLA138” or “TLA738” or “TL 4768.” He sees a “man” wearing a baseball cap or mechanic’s hat climbing up steps or a ladder on the object. Soon after it lifts off with a hissing or

* * *

high-speed drilling sound and heads off southeast at about 700 mph. There are no landing traces. Laxson finds another witness, truck driver C. W. Anderson, parked a mile down the road. Laxson thinks it is some kind of military vehicle. (NICAP, “[Wingless Craft Blocks Road / ‘Man’ Observed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/660323temple_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014771385&usg=AOvVaw0PLWFJSOwd7JEbKSLGrc0V)”; Hynek UFO Report, [pp. 208–210](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/hynekuforeport00alle/page/208/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014771673&usg=AOvVaw0erQNU5g0LBioG-yBlg5FU); Clark III 681–682; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014771887&usg=AOvVaw0Y13EdJttiM_zRkqohzmaY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014772060&usg=AOvVaw2lNpEPWVqvfIpUB0oZHTy1) p. 312)

March 23 — 5:00 p.m. At least a dozen adults and children in Trinidad, Colorado, see two disc-shaped objects with domes flying in-line, traveling with a bobbing motion over the terrain. (“[Discs at Trinidad, Colorado,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252003%252000%2520-%2520March-April.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014772427&usg=AOvVaw2VEF5F1dTwgqBPqs9ghQhQ)” APRO Bulletin, March/April 1966, p. 1; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23multiwit&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014772789&usg=AOvVaw3jxon3UVuU90fK2Xi6pds9)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, pp. 51–52)

March 23 — 11:50 p.m. John T. King sees a yellowish, elliptical object with a dome-like projection on top just off the ground near Bangor, Maine. It has a yellow-orange light in the center, a bluish light on the right, and a white light on the left. When the object moves toward his car, the car lights dim and his radio stops playing. King says he can hear the elderberry bushes scraping as it approaches and hovers 50 feet away. Frightened, he takes his .22 magnum pistol and fires it four times at the UFO, which glows brightly and takes off at high speed, making a “zinging” sound like the recoil of a spring. (“[Close-Range Sightings Increase,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/031%2520MAR-APR%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014773236&usg=AOvVaw03eyVAedLmsAVsSoqcYXr1)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 7 (March/April 1966): 3)

March 23–25 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014773583&usg=AOvVaw0wsJIjhl9iREI7HMnfuVwN) spends three days in Michigan, interviewing witnesses in Dexter and Hillsdale, finding the reports contradictory and vague, and encountering a media frenzy. He participates in a police UFO chase that turns out to be the star Arcturus. A photograph taken by Deputy David Fitzpatrick on March 17 is obviously a time lapse of the Moon and Venus. He interviews two Hillsdale students, Sara Robechek and Jo Wilson. William Van Horn tells him that he at first thought the lights were marsh gas until they rose into the air 150 feet and he seemed to perceive a “convex-shaped” solid mass between two lights. (O’Connell 183–190)

March 25 — [Quintanilla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hector_Quintanilla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014773937&usg=AOvVaw2jbo512iXedqPBvesDdLf2) needs quick answers, so he schedules a press conference at Selfridge AFB \[now Selfridge Air National Guard Base\] near Mount Clemens, Michigan, for [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014774194&usg=AOvVaw1prhMCqVA6S538f7WprJg1) to make a statement. Hynek, disappointed with the quality of the sightings and suspecting a mundane explanation, announces: “It would seem to me that the association of the sightings with swamps, in these particular cases, is more than coincidence. No group of witnesses observed any craft coming to or going away from the swamps. The glow was localized there…. It appears to me that all the major conditions for the appearance of swamp lights were satisfied.” The swamp gas theory doesn’t go over very well with the witnesses, the media, or the public. (“[Termed Marsh Gases by Air Force](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95258199/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014774491&usg=AOvVaw0hmp7uyfQeSMGJpSdKBJf2) [Expert,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95258199/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014774697&usg=AOvVaw0KLVF0onVsYuIvZNJI42_z)” Lansing (Mich.) State Journal, March 25, 1966, p. 11; “[Gas Theory Belittled by Viewers of UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/57781176/lansing-state-journal/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014774991&usg=AOvVaw1OpAbZVPCXG57ToKPNazCw)” Lansing (Mich.) State Journal, March 26, 1966, p. 1; “[Swamp Gas Answer Disproved](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/031%2520MAR-APR%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014775304&usg=AOvVaw0XzEchDG59H_iZu7PcQ8Rc),” UFO Investigator 3, no. 7 (March/April 1966): 5; O’Connell 190–198; Swords 307; Jennie Zeidman, “I Remember Blue Book,” IUR 16, no.

2 (Mar./Apr. 1991): 12)

March 25 — House Minority Leader [Gerald Ford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Ford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014775750&usg=AOvVaw1NBJbI8zaT-C0w6jqlmAew) (R-Mich.) issues a press release proposing that Congress investigate the rash of UFO reports in southern Michigan and the rest of the country: “I think the American people would feel better if there was a full-blown investigation of these incidents, which some persons allege have taken place.” (Gerald R. Ford Presidential Library, \[[Ford UFO news releases and other documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fordlibrarymuseum.gov/library/document/0054/4525586.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014776047&usg=AOvVaw3BcgY0IysJgRNGcjBXXrnh)\])

March 25 — Mrs. R. H. Chappell and her sister Janie Kidd see two triangular UFOs hovering 40–50 feet above Saanich Inlet, British Columbia. Ruby-red lights flash back and forth between them, as if they are signaling. The objects remain motionless for a couple of minutes before moving off slowly and gracefully. (Marler 79)

March 25 — Evening. Mrs. Robert Gorisek of LaSalle, Illinois, sees a triangular object hover above her car for more than an hour as she is driving home from work. The object keeps up with them as they drive through several towns. It has red, orange, and white lights. (“[UFO Sightings Widespread over Country,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/98871710/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014776412&usg=AOvVaw0ieVQlqk6wZBOzYAYLBNfv)” Great Bend (Kan.) Daily Tribune, March 25, 1966, p. 1)

March 27 — 5:30 a.m. Both Federal Aviation Administration operators at Muscogee County Airport \[now Columbus Metropolitan Airport\] and military operators at Fort Benning report a radar-visual sighting of a maneuvering, oblong, green-white object over Columbus, Georgia. The object appears to change shape from cigar to wedge to triangle. (“[Glowing Object in Sky Is Sighted in Georgia,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/98873193/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014776766&usg=AOvVaw0NoGwk6EyI5jtH-WNZr76P)” Casper (Wyo.) Star-Tribune, March 28, 1966, p. 14; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1966_03_27_US_GA_Columbus_NICAP_MultiWit-RV.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014777065&usg=AOvVaw0v1Q4YegtgsWUFBki7KKyF)\])

March 28 — [Gerald Ford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Ford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014777408&usg=AOvVaw2sFtFd5kLz3C69hgeBXgIx) writes to [George P. Miller](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_P._Miller&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014777652&usg=AOvVaw29X1lROn3xShP-mPliV_2V) (D-Calif.), chairman of the House Science and Astronautics Committee, and [L. Mendel Rivers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L._Mendel_Rivers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014777896&usg=AOvVaw3KPt8iRksFdRt5b6xy_vbf) (D-S.C.), chairman of the Armed Services Committee, saying he is dissatisfied with [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014778129&usg=AOvVaw0k4fl7KjKi9w1ldEeTONf1)’s explanation of the Michigan sightings. He “strongly recommends” a House committee investigation into the “UFO phenomena.” (Gerald R. Ford Presidential Library, \[[Ford UFO news releases and other](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fordlibrarymuseum.gov/library/document/0054/4525586.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014778387&usg=AOvVaw1SC5V9xg4HQMJFPN1W_bVK) [documents](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.fordlibrarymuseum.gov/library/document/0054/4525586.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014778616&usg=AOvVaw1nwayJKZZsx-0JhtHqQY3q)\])

March 28 — University of Arizona atmospheric physicist [James E. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014778934&usg=AOvVaw3b0q2veKX4thfuzgQH1Lo3) writes a 2-page letter to [Thomas F.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_F._Malone&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014779176&usg=AOvVaw3UiWN8zAuZauEUOQhVmjAH) [Malone](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_F._Malone&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014779386&usg=AOvVaw2DSCh9dhRl0eKIt3lTWNWF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_F._Malone&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014779559&usg=AOvVaw3JOJ1pJZ2f9cjkRuz792Pe) chairman of the National Academy of Sciences’ Committee on the Atmospheric Sciences, urging that a

* * *

panel be set up by a scientific body to study Blue Book’s UFO files. He also writes to his legislator Rep. [Morris](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mo_Udall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014779886&usg=AOvVaw3MBdsQhy2Ig8Uyt7fpQWtN)

[K. Udall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mo_Udall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014780123&usg=AOvVaw2xrc4YZZvpR5CBzT9G8y8R) (D-Ariz.) about the idea, asking him to pass the letter on in confidence to [Gerald Ford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Ford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014780364&usg=AOvVaw27Ppu9hbYzfOecFXVuBdmu) (R-Mich.). (Bill Murphy, “The Swamp Gas Aftermath: Some Notes from the Gerald Ford Files,” IUR 33, no. 2 (July 2010): 11, 13; Clark III 696)

March 28 — 8:00 p.m. A man driving about 60 mph in Fayetteville, Tennessee, encounters a large, lighted object only 3 feet above the road on a hilltop. The object is oval-shaped, 23 feet long, dark gray, and has about 30 lights around its perimeter. As it flies off, his car engine and headlights die. The driver has to replace the light bulbs in his headlights after the incident. (Herbert S. Taylor, “An Update on Vehicle Interference Reports, Part Two,” IUR 34, no. 1 (September 2011): 19; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014780822&usg=AOvVaw3eq5stCM_rGc5HMzPBK7E5), p. 312)

March 29 — NICAP board member [Charles A. Maney](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/129667039/charles-a_-maney&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014781120&usg=AOvVaw30TUDOkgwBOC3IbGrr4b8Q) writes to [Gerald Ford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Ford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014781366&usg=AOvVaw1zUyg-3gcyVDCqfa4wfcAP), imploring him to contact NICAP for proof that the Air Force is withholding evidence about UFOs. (Bill Murphy, “The Swamp Gas Aftermath: Some Notes from the Gerald Ford Files,” IUR 33, no. 2 (July 2010): 12)

March 29 — 4:15 p.m. A 10-year-old boy and his Dalmatian are walking familiar paths in a wood lot behind their home near Hampton Falls, New Hampshire. He notices something silver on a ridge and walks toward it. He sees an “L” shaped box, long side parallel to the ground, sitting on tripod legs. His dog runs ahead and sniffs the boxy structure, and then, appearing uninterested, the dog goes off into the woods. The boy stops about 24 feet away, not sure what he is seeing. The object makes intermittent sounds and movements in the following minutes. Then a blast of air from the object sends debris flying. A short high-pitched, then low-pitched, sound is heard as the object lifts off the ground about one foot, stops, swings in a clockwise motion, and settles back on the ground.

Intermittent electric-like humming sounds are heard until the object again, with a blast of air stirring up debris and the same sounds as earlier, ascends vertically, this time to about 10 feet, where it pauses, moves horizontally, pauses and rotates clockwise again, then accelerates straight up. On the final ascent, the sound increases in pitch and loudness. The witness’s mother and sister who were at some distance from him also hear the sound. When the object moved horizontally, saplings directly under it swayed. Three elongated imprints are found in the form of a triangle. Reportedly plants do not grow in the area for the next 2 years. (NICAP, “[Hampton Area, New](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/ar-660329dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014781865&usg=AOvVaw3NcuittFGk2dPZDL0oFbpn) [Hampshire: March 29, 1966](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/ar-660329dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014782086&usg=AOvVaw2LK9osT_WQL6s_9WTNjiU2)”; Raymond Fowler, “The Flying Box, and Other Cases,” IUR 28, no. 2 (Summer 2003): 15–20, 26)

March 29 — 9:15 p.m. Charles Cozens, 13, is strolling in a field behind the Hamilton Mountain Police Station in Hamilton, Ontario. He sees two luminous oval objects about 8 feet in diameter descend and land, making a buzzing sound. The objects have a row of multicolored lights around their rims “flickering like a computer.” He approaches for a closer look and touches the nearest object, which feels hard and smooth like metal, but neither hot nor cold. He then touches an antenna-like projection at the end of one of the objects and receives a shock.

Frightened, he runs home. His parents confirm a 3-inch burn mark on his hand and question him thoroughly before reporting the incident to authorities. His first-degree burn is treated at a hospital and heals normally. (Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014782597&usg=AOvVaw1DS2e6Yi4v0y3Bu7wA2Rlu)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014782843&usg=AOvVaw1rIRsMXS0pZ-_HmBEW4hnI) NICAP, 1969, pp. 4–5; Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, pp. 45–46)

March 30 — 8:35 p.m. A woman and her four children watch an oval object crossing the road as they are driving south about 9 miles north of Lewisburg, Indiana. It comes close to the car and she hears a pulsating sound, but it seems to come through the car radio, not directly from the object. She drives away, but the UFO pursues her for 8 miles. It changes from reddish-orange to blue-white before it accelerates away. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014783240&usg=AOvVaw2hvPUpnPdALo1VNImp6e6y), p. 313)

March 31 — 2:00 a.m. Jeno Udvardy is driving home from a late work shift near Vicksburg, Michigan. He sees a cluster of lights on the highway ahead and slows down. When he is within 10 feet, he realizes the lights are on a disc hovering a few feet above the road. It has a brilliant white light, and red, green, and purple blinking lights.

Udvardy backs up and his car is buffeted by gusts of wind as the object lifts up. The car motor stalls. He rolls down the window and hears a humming sound. Moments later, the UFO speeds off at a steep angle. (“[Close-](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/031%2520MAR-APR%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014783651&usg=AOvVaw3O5mE4hHTIFDdmbKJIqcjv) [Range Sightings Increase,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/031%2520MAR-APR%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014783909&usg=AOvVaw0dihl7d5o5laM5p7eywmlo)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 7 (March/April 1966): 3)

March 31 — JANAP 146(E), a joint Canadian–US instruction, adds that photos should be sent to the US Director of Naval Intelligence and adds special CIRVIS reporting instructions for unidentifiable objects. The Canadian Air Defence Command ends its investigation of UFOs and transfers the responsibility to the Directorate of Operations. (Joint Chiefs of Staff, “[JANAP 146(E) Canadian–United States Communications Instructions for](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/janp1462.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014784264&usg=AOvVaw0R1caWRA5WFvbrUlEQW6eg) [Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufon.org/cufon/janp1462.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014784477&usg=AOvVaw0i3J-kEDTyUhSZVCvCb-WY)” March 31, 1966; Antonio F. Rullán, “[Blue Book UFO Reports at Sea by](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.waterufo.net/bluebook/bbpdf.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014784686&usg=AOvVaw250OhPH5WnU8sb5vxXun4z) [Ships,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.waterufo.net/bluebook/bbpdf.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014784889&usg=AOvVaw0plIu6AwkbrNnymUG3DmZp)” December 10, 2002; Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Canada, Signet, 1981, pp. 171–172)

April 1 — 10:40 p.m. A man driving 5 miles south of Tangier, Oklahoma, reaches a hilltop and sees a green object wider than the road flying north at very high speed, emitting a shrieking noise and a “heat wave.” The car engine dies. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014785275&usg=AOvVaw25I_o80vn0WVT3HejlmasG)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014785457&usg=AOvVaw19QI7GslxjrZbAkl7VOEjB) p. 313)

* * *

April 1? — Night. Students at Western Michigan University in Kalamazoo, Michigan, see a star-like object that looks football-shaped through binoculars. It moves in geometric angles around two bright stars until it shoots straight up and disappears. (Michael D. Swords, “We Know Where You Live,” IUR 30, no.2 (January 2006): 10–11)

April 2 — 2:02 p.m. James Kibel, a Melbourne businessman who is a member of the Victorian Flying Saucer Research Society, sees a shiny, hemispherical object above his garden in Balwyn, Victoria. It looks to be 20–25 feet in diameter and 120 feet in the air. “It seemed to float down towards me,” he says. “It resembled a big mushroom with a stalk pointing towards the earth.” He snaps a Polaroid photo, after which the object takes off and disappears to the north. However, when [B. Roy Frieden](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B._Roy_Frieden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014785923&usg=AOvVaw12m76_o5E1dg_B0eVzOI8X)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B._Roy_Frieden&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014786110&usg=AOvVaw05zFlnPQcWlJV4PvIlT1ae) professor of optical sciences at the University of Arizona, examines the photo, he finds a jagged line of discontinuity running across the center of the image suggesting there are separate photos joined together and rephotographed. In 2017, Canadian researcher François Beaulieu reexamines the original and notices the reflection of the house below in the shiny object, and he finds that the discontinuity is actually caused by the Polaroid developing chemicals spreading unevenly across the photo. (“[V.F.S.R.S. Member Snaps a UFO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201966%252007%2520-%2520no%25205%2520VFSRS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014786538&usg=AOvVaw18ggmTOth4oxYETQzO4P3C)” Australian Flying Saucer Review (Victorian Edition), no. 5 (July 1966): 2; “[Report on UFO Photographed at Balwyn,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review/Australian%2520Flying%2520Saucer%2520Review%2520-%25201966%252012%2520-%2520no%25206%2520VFSRS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014786936&usg=AOvVaw1Om807zx8srFVFDaVX8smK)” Australian Flying Saucer Review (Victorian Edition), no. 6 (December 1966): 11–12; Story, [p. 40](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/40/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014787252&usg=AOvVaw0IvCqTf83wdSQBdzOH9OBT); Keith Basterfield and Paul Dean, “[Stage One Report on the 2nd April](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/kbcat/Balwyn_UFO_stage_one_report_final_version.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014787511&usg=AOvVaw1HEnwuU9LP6QRUnekkqaah) [1966, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia, UFO Observation and Photgograph by James Johnson Kibel,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/kbcat/Balwyn_UFO_stage_one_report_final_version.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014787764&usg=AOvVaw3X6lb8UEwvI9V4ob0EVWIM)” 2016; Keith Basterfield and Paul Dean, “[Stage Two Report on the 2nd April 1966, Balwyn, Melbourne, Victoria, Visual and](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/kbcat/Balwyn_UFO_stage_two_final_version.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014788015&usg=AOvVaw3w3Y-Tri8Ara1i17FUlBtq) [Photographic UFO Sighting by James Johnson Kibel,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/kbcat/Balwyn_UFO_stage_two_final_version.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014788262&usg=AOvVaw2gJDTqgIrGR0Bc2fN99MZp)” 2016; François Beaulieu, “[A Re-evaluation of the Balwyn](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/kbcat/Balwyn_Francois_Beaulieu_2017.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014788560&usg=AOvVaw0X6iCH0t8wg6BFXyufXPP8) [UFO Photograph,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/kbcat/Balwyn_Francois_Beaulieu_2017.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014788800&usg=AOvVaw0VJOQgjHOa3dbgjvUcxi-K)” February 23, 2017)

April 4 — 7:50 p.m. Businessman Ron Sullivan is driving about 60 mph near Burkes Flat, Victoria, Australia. In the distance he sees a light near the road. Suddenly, the headlights of his vehicle bend to the right and light up a nearby fence. He brakes his car. In the middle of an adjacent field, he sees a column of light some 25 feet high and shaped like an inverted ice cream cone, 3 feet wide at the bottom and 10 feet wide at the top. It then rises to a height of 20 feet, after which the whole light complex disappears. There is no associated noise. Sullivan drives on to Wycheproof, where he checks his lights but finds nothing wrong. On the night of April 7, 19-year-old Gary Taylor is killed at the same spot when the car he is driving leaves the road and hits a tree. Police find a circular impression about 2–5 inches deep and 5 feet in diameter in the freshly plowed field. (NICAP, “[Bent Headlights](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/660404australia-dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014789224&usg=AOvVaw3U8AU5LQ8vz2VQktiqqQ0Y) [Case](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/660404australia-dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014789454&usg=AOvVaw0gcIxD0U_GrjROC4rm9emm)”; Bill Chalker, “[The Bent Headlight Beam Case Revisited,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/UFO%2520Research%2520Australia%2520Newsletter/UFO%2520Research%2520Australia%2520newsletter%2520vol%25205%2520no%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014789751&usg=AOvVaw3UQiEXcMYi86IzjC2ke3wo)” UFO Research Australia Newsletter 5, no. 3 (May/June 1984): 17–29)

April 5 — 1:30 a.m. A woman in Durhamville, New York, is awakened by a flash. She thinks her trailer heater has exploded, but everything is in order. The next day, three witnesses tell her a pulsating, luminous object had flown directly above her trailer. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 327](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/326/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014790166&usg=AOvVaw208TyV2BNXCWti6FInTUbS))

April 5 — 3:00 a.m. [Lillian Louis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/163475830/lillian-e_-louis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014790464&usg=AOvVaw0ul4oeSR10lAjvuBMr2eCc), in Lycoming, New York, sees a spinning object from her kitchen window. It seems to be 10 feet in diameter and is shooting exhaust 20 feet above the ground near her house. It departs suddenly, leaving a trail. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014790688&usg=AOvVaw0PtzJCfcVY9YK-RQZXDpGV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014790857&usg=AOvVaw0MwtqT9vWVIkk11RXZYM0_) p. 313)

April 5 — The House Armed Services Committee conducts the first public hearing by the US Congress on the topic of UFOs. Air Force Secretary [Harold Brown](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harold_Brown_(Secretary_of_Defense)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014791147&usg=AOvVaw17IgmdrccpxEsCl1I5Mth2) testifies that while USAF has done an excellent job on UFOs, perhaps there is room for “even stronger emphasis on the scientific aspects.” [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014791404&usg=AOvVaw3EW3gYylJdeO3ad30Z1BQK) recommends that a “civilian panel of physical and social scientists … examine the UFO problem critically for the express purpose of determining whether a major problem exits.” [Quintanilla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hector_Quintanilla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014791652&usg=AOvVaw0OzLrJyrykO1anfNfdIUEN) is the only other witness. After Committee Chairman [L. Mendel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L._Mendel_Rivers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014791886&usg=AOvVaw1OBN5l1NBLQcBGH29jYoyG) [Rivers](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L._Mendel_Rivers&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014792101&usg=AOvVaw3N3kJKnuhU8okrVtRhQkRR) expresses some enthusiasm for the idea, Brown suddenly realizes that maybe he has found a way to get the Air Force out of UFO investigations. Shortly after the hearing, Brown tells the USAF Office of Scientific Research to accept the February 3 [O’Brien](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brian_O%2527Brien&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014792410&usg=AOvVaw2g2_LtLabO65EGRaVv2tUW) recommendation to seek a university that will accept a contract to study the 600 officially unidentified UFO sightings. (US House Committee on Armed Services, Hearing, [Unidentified Flying Objects](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ia600402.us.archive.org/1/items/UfoHearing19662/ufo_hearing1966%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014792737&usg=AOvVaw1QowIAixxqp3bOmxfo21l8)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ia600402.us.archive.org/1/items/UfoHearing19662/ufo_hearing1966%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014792955&usg=AOvVaw2xTBUFSGUB4boem9U7aUIA) 89th Congress, 2nd Session, April 5, 1966; Clark III 1192)

April 5 — Midnight. W. Smith and another man in Alto, Tennessee, stop to watch a 100-foot long UFO hovering 15 feet above a swamp. They try to follow it, but it flies away, flying between a high-tension power line and a row of trees. Cows, dogs, and horses are restless in all the areas where the object passes over. ([Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014793270&usg=AOvVaw3anH3pv4jgC_vzsviNnOyc), p. 313)

April 6 — Around 11:00 a.m. A class of students and a teacher from Westall High School \[now Westall Secondary College\] in Clayton South, Victoria, Australia, are just completing a sport activity on the main oval when they see an object, described as a gray saucer-shaped craft with a slight purple hue and about twice the size of a family car. Witness descriptions are mixed: Andrew Greenwood, a science teacher, tells The Dandenong Journal at the time that he saw a silvery-green disc. According to witnesses, the object is descending and then crosses and flies over the high school’s southwest corner, going in a southeasterly direction before disappearing from sight as it descends behind a stand of trees and into a paddock at The Grange in front of the Westall State School (primary students). After about 20 minutes, the object—with witnesses now numbering over 200—then climbs at speed and

* * *

departs towards the northwest. As the object gains altitude, some accounts describe it as being pursued from the scene by five unidentified aircraft that circle it. Some describe one disc, others claim to see three. The Victorian Flying Saucer Research Society arrives on the site on April 8, speaks to students, and views the ground marking, originally described as a large patch of yellow, flattened grass with a swirly pattern. (“[Audio Reveals Creepy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.ph/5TnZj&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014793790&usg=AOvVaw1Z_rjdqYJHyfSiSMtp6U79) [Details of Australian UFO Mystery,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.ph/5TnZj&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014793990&usg=AOvVaw1WQCk07USWNxtSr06pUALq)” Melbourne Herald Sun, August 7, 2018; Wikipedia, “[Westall UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Westall_UFO&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014794256&usg=AOvVaw2vYEKKacFADiBVlJW6L_35)”)

April 6 — NICAP Assistant Director [Richard Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014794527&usg=AOvVaw2wbps_tOWSAec3zQZN-sEq) writes to [Gerald Ford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Ford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014794754&usg=AOvVaw3OBK2Ku5MflnzVXKgk-PbF)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Ford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014794923&usg=AOvVaw11Q-gT-P3xvIVwYUGnbqq-) congratulating him on his call for a congressional investigation, saying, “History will record the important role you have played in helping to bring about a rational study of UFOs and public enlightenment on the subject.” (Bill Murphy, “The Swamp Gas Aftermath: Some Notes from the Gerald Ford Files,” IUR 33, no. 2 (July 2010): 10, 13)

April 8 — 8:05 a.m. Mike Dorsey and Gary Hunt, both 12, are walking along Redcoat Road in Norwalk, Connecticut, when they see sunlight reflecting off a distant object to the west and behind them. It zooms toward them in a flash, passes overhead from west to east, turns, makes a second pass from east to west, turns again, and makes a third pass. It makes a low humming sound when it passes about 15 feet above them. The boys run to the Holy Ghost Seminary nearby and hide under a nearby bridge abutment as the object continues to maneuver. When it hovers, it does so edge down and makes a fluttering motion. The disc looks metallic, 8 feet in diameter, has a black spot on top near its rim, and a red light on top of an antenna-like protrusion. Red and white lights appear to rotate counterclockwise. Nearly 2 hours later, the object takes off in a burst of speed. (“[Boys Chased by UAO,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252005%252000%2520-%2520May-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014795416&usg=AOvVaw37j3Wo0i3Yp_Uh62SG4CVX)” APRO Bulletin, May/June 1966, p. 5)

April 17 — 5:00 a.m. Portage County Deputy Sheriff [Dale F. Spaur](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/165680198/dale-floyd-spaur&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014795786&usg=AOvVaw18djIl2iuJbRAR2xntS0A1) and Deputy Wilbur Neff are 4 miles east of Randolph, Ohio, when they see a moving light through some trees at the top of a small hill along the road. The light is headed in their direction. They have heard of a UFO reported over police radio that night and figure this must be what was seen. The object hovers 50–100 feet in the air, bathing the two officers in a bright light. Spaur’s eyes water up. They rush to the cruiser and radio the station; the dispatcher says to wait there until a car with a camera arrives. The object makes some sharp maneuvers, and Spaur drives toward it cautiously. The UFO is 18–24 feet thick and about 35–45 feet in diameter. The object is so bright he hardly needs his headlights to drive. It speeds up whenever Spaur accelerates, and soon he is driving at 80 mph. As the UFO reaches Mahoning County, the pursuit is being broadcast over police radios in three counties. As they reach East Palestine, Ohio, Patrolman [H. Wayne](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133276534/howard-wayne-huston&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014796165&usg=AOvVaw3wUzSPeek0IabYNOTY-o0L) [Huston](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133276534/howard-wayne-huston&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014796406&usg=AOvVaw1xIRMaKj8kLTLncDcjMIEv) sees the UFO and follows Spaur and Neff, at times reaching 100 mph. Just before 5:30 a.m., two police officers in Salem, Ohio, see the UFO as a “bright ball” much larger than a jet. They also see three jets following it, apparently Air Force Reserve planes from Youngstown, Ohio. Police officer Frank Panzarella in Conway, Pennsylvania, sees the UFO, very bright and in the “shape of a half of a football.” He hears on his radio that a jet interception is in progress. Now in Pennsylvania, Spaur and Neff are given orders to abandon the chase. For most of the event, the object has remained at 1,000 feet, but now it rises to 3,500 feet and hovers. Then it shoots even higher and disappears. In 30 minutes, many police and civilians have seen the UFO. Panzarella alerts the Rochester, Pennsylvania, police operator, John Beighey, and asks him to contact the Greater Pittsburgh International Airport. Beighey calls Panzarella and says the Air Force wants to talk to the police witnesses. Spaur, Neff, and Huston go to the Rochester, Pennsylvania, police station and Spaur phones the USAF station at Pittsburgh. Spaur speaks to some colonel who tries to convince him he has seen something conventional.

NICAP’s William B. Weitzel, a philosophy professor, begins his own investigation, tracking down witnesses. Within a few weeks, he or his NICAP associates have interviewed all the police officers, as well as several others who have figured in the UFO chase, either as dispatchers or as those who overheard the radio communications.

NICAP members also interview some civilians who claim to have seen a UFO at the same time of the chase and/or had monitored police scanners. (NICAP, “[Portage County UFO Chase](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/660417ravenna_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014796875&usg=AOvVaw1XNRyBifqcW7b8f7QJHoEw)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014797087&usg=AOvVaw0wx5ThvVnJ0WIQsJyW-4WH), p. 314; “[Saucer Chase](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/30825497/the-akron-beacon-journal/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014797323&usg=AOvVaw2GuGk0NjbDkElPyXXQgP_A) [Sets Probers Humming,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/27079563/revenna-saucer-story-continued-p-a2/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014797561&usg=AOvVaw3yMF1KL3PSAUIjW2d4FRFT)” Akron (Ohio) Beacon-Journal, April 18, pp. 1–2; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 113–124](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/112/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014797898&usg=AOvVaw3lL57u8036-km6w1CL0QCq); Patrick Gross, “[1966 Portage County UFO Chase by Policemen](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/portage66.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014798120&usg=AOvVaw2doQpm8O4hXR5Hh2stA9u6)”; William B. Weitzel, “[The P-13 UFO: Summary Report on April 17, 1966, UFO ‘Chase’ from Portage County, Ohio, into](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Portage-County/1966_04_17_US_OH_Portage-County_NICAP_Weitzel_P-13_UFO_Reportr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014798404&usg=AOvVaw2mMhLc9Z7yoq19HohMLvxS) [Conway, Pennsylvania,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Portage-County/1966_04_17_US_OH_Portage-County_NICAP_Weitzel_P-13_UFO_Reportr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014798731&usg=AOvVaw2M4Vtxvudn146I1De-RvYv)” June 28, 1966; William B. Weitzel, “[The Portage County Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Portage-County/1966_04_17_US_OH_Portage-County_NICAPr.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014799001&usg=AOvVaw1NWhmAXRCs0s82A6Jad1xe)” April 8, 1967; NICAP, \[[case photos and drawings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Portage-County/1966_04_17_US_OH_Portage-County_NICAP_Photos%2526Drawings.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014799283&usg=AOvVaw09Ho7c8N3Bw6db-fZggX5e)\]; Michael D. Swords, \[[case files and clippings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/146C.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014799524&usg=AOvVaw0yHLRcOafVUClCUG1ZWb_d)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[[Gerald Buchert photo case file](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Portage-County/1966_04_17_US_OH_Portage_County_BB_Spaur%2526Neff.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014799775&usg=AOvVaw0QtJIzp22Ehp0N1yHcRdc1)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[clippings, [part one](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Portage-County/1966_04_17_US_OH_Portage_County_Clips_Part1R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014800028&usg=AOvVaw1fz_B0NUZBKZMwjOUlUGtD)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Portage-County/1966_04_17_US_OH_Portage_County_Clips_Part1R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014800251&usg=AOvVaw1hGq72NDf6rywqJM3ceqYs) [part two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/Portage-County/1966_04_17_US_OH_Portage_County_Clips_Part2R.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014800500&usg=AOvVaw1tPJfk28XOlDHrZdm1oeUI)\]; Clark III 906–914)

April 18 — The Air Force begins a cursory investigation into the Portage County, Ohio, police chase case. Initially they telephone local news outlets, seeking information. However, local newspapers and radio have only vague outlines of the case. Air Force investigators also interviewed meteorologists and weather agency personnel, hoping to learn that a weather balloon was launched in the area during the UFO chase. They learn that there were no weather balloons launched that morning, and also that the wind had been so mild that the police would have had no difficulty catching up with any wind-borne object. [Quintanilla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hector_Quintanilla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014800923&usg=AOvVaw3X9OgrTe-BdYW_m4dQ62Wt) calls [Spaur](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/165680198/dale-floyd-spaur&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014801210&usg=AOvVaw0cVI5gf9iUN31947jWug7t) to ask him about “this mirage you saw.” Spaur insists he has seen a clearly defined metallic object maneuvering at very low altitudes. When

* * *

Quintanilla asks if they watched the object for more than a few minutes, Spaur asserts that he and Neff chased it for over half an hour, and that [Huston](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/133276534/howard-wayne-huston&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014801654&usg=AOvVaw2FMjeZpxZo75-dOpiOr891) saw the object for much of that period, and that Panzanella too had seen it. Quintanilla then, as Spaur said, “kind of lost interest.” (Clark III 910)

April 18 — An egg-shaped object, 80 feet in diameter and 15 feet high, is observed from a distance of 80 feet by a 42- year-old witness driving a car near Battle Creek, Michigan. The object supports a cockpit with windows and three rows of lights, emits red flames, and makes the same noise as a heavy truck on wet pavement. The object follows the car for some time. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 329](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/328/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014802101&usg=AOvVaw2VYa4Mzi9dKKpEYSdDfzP2); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014802329&usg=AOvVaw1YJkP4rPEy6nV3EP5Z9LfI)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014802505&usg=AOvVaw3cqBQwgaOhmJOaijlZ0X3P) p. 314)

April 19 — 10:45 p.m. In Peabody, Massachusetts, witnesses report an oval object with red, green, and white body lights, oscillating up and down when in motion. The object appears to land in a field off State Highway 114. At 12:00 midnight, two men driving along that route see the lighted disc rise and fly away. (Vallée, Magonia, [p. 329](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/passporttomagoni0000vall/page/328/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014802907&usg=AOvVaw09LklazxA6NqVRrMZoahFo))

April 21 — [William Dean Howe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Dean_Howe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014803218&usg=AOvVaw2I_Ui3Fj3o_kFuUVaBQNXH)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Dean_Howe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014803428&usg=AOvVaw0XjnUHkdNhBWLvrmBy7szJ) MP for Ottawa, Ontario, urges a serious investigation of UFOs in the Canadian House of Commons. (“[Canadian Projects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/046%2520FEB-MAR%25201969.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014803702&usg=AOvVaw3HaJ63jHZHCPHox_gj-BgY)” UFO Investigator 4, no. 10 (Feb./March 1969): 6)

April 22 — [Quintanilla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hector_Quintanilla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014804067&usg=AOvVaw3p2I_eUZ-Gq4kJYJ3yt43K) announces in a press release that the Portage County, Ohio, UFO is an Echo satellite, with later observations (in Pennsylvania) of Venus. Quintanilla calls [Spaur](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/165680198/dale-floyd-spaur&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014804347&usg=AOvVaw2PUm79dL-Sv05zsZpoJjz7)’s superior, Portage County Sheriff [Ross](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/181108098/ross-dustman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014804574&usg=AOvVaw3bCmxGuwLbgDoN-xqsadBw) [Dustman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/181108098/ross-dustman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014804792&usg=AOvVaw3HmxG5H4JGXFMjCT882W-7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/181108098/ross-dustman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014804977&usg=AOvVaw2dHlwvE7if9T_6_z5yjPm2) to give him this explanation, and Dustman laughs out loud. April 22 — Lt. Col. [Robert R. Hippler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65715202/robert-r-hippler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014805313&usg=AOvVaw19XD1W5cgkQqkzgOsZH5kN) of the USAF Directorate of Science and Technology is tasked with recruiting a university for the UFO project suggested by the O’Brien committee in February. Guyford Stever](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guyford_Stever&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014805590&usg=AOvVaw2cS_7ZK2NsDzGyvC5oiuo_), head of the Air Force Scientific Advisory Board.
