Fuller, “[Aboard a Flying](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Look/1966%252010%252018_Look_John%2520Fuller_Aboard%2520UFO%25202_Lagrange%2520scan.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014875917&usg=AOvVaw2hI-AiwhXfPPo4V0cWAWih)

[Saucer, Part II,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Look/1966%252010%252018_Look_John%2520Fuller_Aboard%2520UFO%25202_Lagrange%2520scan.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014876271&usg=AOvVaw094k4QlJzfKSAbQ2MkpIVp)” Look 30, no. 21 (October 18, 1966): 111–121; Clark III 585)

October 4–5 — 5:00 a.m. Jack Jones is delivering newspapers on John Street in Connersville, Indiana. He notices a group of lights in a field to the west past the dead end. He thinks it might be a new light installation and moves on. The next day, Jones is with another paper carrier, Don Doe, and he suggests they go see the new lights. Jack sees the lights, but they are in a different position somewhat to the north. Both boys sit on their bicycles and watch a dark disc-shaped object with flashing red, green, and white lights on it that is apparently on the ground some 840 feet into the field. They estimate it is 27 feet in diameter and 10 feet high. They hear a high-pitched whirring sound and smell a faint odor of sulfur and tannic acid. After watching it a few minutes, they hear a new sound as if someone is walking slowly toward them through some thick weeds. They take off on their bicycles and don’t look back. Some days later, investigators find three holes, 8 feet apart in an equilateral triangle, where the object was seen. The holes measure 7 inches at the top and 1 inch at the bottom. (“[UAO Landing in Indiana,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201966%252011%252000%2520-%2520November-December.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014876769&usg=AOvVaw3CsT0wl2iBQlpI6soBYjkA)” APRO Bulletin, Nov./Dec. 1966, pp. 1, 3)

October 5 — At a University of Arizona Department of Meteorology colloquium, [James E. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014877165&usg=AOvVaw3NU-RKHlEDH30jdloAdlty) gives his views on the reality of UFOs and the Air Force’s concealment of information. His colleagues respond negatively, and McDonald acknowledges to [Gerard Kuiper](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerard_Kuiper&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014877426&usg=AOvVaw1Mw-mVL8NJ4D9G4A3V0eC5) that what he is doing is professionally risky. Nevertheless, the university’s Space Sciences Committee gives him a $1,300 grant toward his research expenses. (“[UFOs Are](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95391798/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014877674&usg=AOvVaw0DXvf-ipOSOTY7zZjErcUm) [‘Real,’ Physicist Asserts,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95391798/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014877879&usg=AOvVaw2U85aENf9Bf4Ig2Y4zgb7b)” Arizona Daily Star, October 6, 1966, p. B-1; Clark III 697)

October 6 — [Thurston Manning](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.legacy.com/obituaries/name/thurston-manning-obituary?pid%3D171867180&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014878238&usg=AOvVaw0xvHOgNjIFXGn0thCa0Ujm) signs the University of Colorado contract with the Air Force. The project is to run from November 15, 1966, to January 1968. (Clark III 1193)

October 7 — The Air Force publicly announces the creation of the University of Colorado UFO project. [Low](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014878577&usg=AOvVaw3HYWqGAkCkdKJIaYLk6n6X) is made project coordinator. The primary team will be [Saunders](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://psycnet.apa.org/record/1993-27194-001&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014878832&usg=AOvVaw2IoS6u6Bw8ZXGgVjmW8ZAM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://psycnet.apa.org/record/1993-27194-001&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014879006&usg=AOvVaw1hmW-cooazOEjJSiOb12Bd) ESSA astronomer [Franklin Roach](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_E._Roach&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014879213&usg=AOvVaw01H9KjXwPMbDyuJEGsCczf), Wertheimer, chemist [Roy Craig](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://legacy.lib.utexas.edu/taro/tamucush/00151/tamu-00151.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014879448&usg=AOvVaw1qFQUf2g8DqcVWhQBNKn2d)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://legacy.lib.utexas.edu/taro/tamucush/00151/tamu-00151.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014879644&usg=AOvVaw0FjU3Cv1q1LVoiYkKQ5WqP) University of Arizona electrical engineer Norman Levine, administrative assistant Mary Lou

* * *

Armstrong, University of Arizona astronomer [William K. Hartmann](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Kenneth_Hartmann&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014879980&usg=AOvVaw2NOrGRo7dse-SUJ9f_YITr), physicist [Frederick Ayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.seattletimes.com/archive/?date%3D19981022%26slug%3D2779034&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014880220&usg=AOvVaw2lgVpMtJaouascY6Bu-DV2), and psychologists [Dan Culberson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/in/dan-culberson-3427b218&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014880449&usg=AOvVaw013ww_Ezq2aO4iZM422OrZ) and James Wadsworth. (Office of Assistant Secretary of Defense (Public Affairs), “Air Force Selects University of Colorado to Investigate Unidentified Flying Object Reports,” October 7, 1966, release no. 847-66, in Lorenzen, UFOs over the Americas, Signet, 1968, pp. 222–224; “[UFO Probe Given to Colorado U.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95391145/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014880763&usg=AOvVaw3VkyqL8dyUcC-euV2_8owA)” San Francisco Examiner, October 7, 1966, p. 42; Clark III 697, 1193)

October 7 — [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014881094&usg=AOvVaw07xyo1135YpOJAmqOv9S2U) speaks to the media about the secret Robertson Panel report. The CIA has ordered the Air Force to debunk UFOs, he says. (“[UFO Hush](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95392849/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014881354&usg=AOvVaw3qVAdgUc6r7WyARdZYv8YX) [Blamed on CIA Men,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95393279/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014881566&usg=AOvVaw3oF7OLlx4CttLTaDt3XH-x)” Phoenix Arizona Republic, October 7, 1966, pp. 21–22)

October 8 — [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014881936&usg=AOvVaw3ADaZBXnvlDbtrpjvEsd5W) is widely quoted in the media as saying it is “highly improbable” that UFOs exist. “The view that UFOs are hallucinatory will be a subject of our investigation, to discover what it is that makes people imagine they see things.” (Chesly Manly, “[UFOs Prober](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95388374/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014882196&usg=AOvVaw0YBd9xckUTvTdtz9oL_HPW) [Keeps Open Mind and Door,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95388589/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014882409&usg=AOvVaw2XrNEhAQSePheJv8xEw36Y)” Chicago Tribune, October 16, 1966, pp. 1, 4)

October 8 — 7:00 p.m. Loch Ness monster researcher [Frederick William “Ted” Holiday](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fredrick_William_Holiday&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014882749&usg=AOvVaw2ZqqurGhBUFXBnW8EaNPoV) is fishing on the lifeboat slipway at Tenby harbor, Pembrokeshire, Wales, when he and other fishermen notice a small, bluish, luminous cloud moving in a circle about three times its own diameter above them. After a short time, he resumes his fishing, but 10 minutes later a dark object emerges from the cloud and beams down a brilliant ruby light on them. The cloud moves west and the object moves southwest. By the time he retrieves binoculars from his car, both objects are gone. (F. W. Holiday, “[Was God at Aberfan?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201972%2520V%252018%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014883051&usg=AOvVaw0N2UqYsQBWBt_wRY855f2z)” Flying Saucer Review 18, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1972): 3–4)

October 10 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014883413&usg=AOvVaw0PDLGvbJmEtQA4sEe052fa) discusses UFOs in Newsweek. (“UFO’s for Real?” Newsweek, October 10, 1966, p. 70)

October 10 — 9:15 p.m. Police Sgt. Benjamin Thompson of the Wanaque (New Jersey) Reservoir Police watches a bright light performing fantastic maneuvers over the reservoir. He notices a slight mist in the wake of its movements. It descends to 150 feet above the water, then shoots up. Thompson has also seen UFOs at the reservoir in January and March. Some teenagers see a UFO in the area 2 nights later. (“[UFOs Return to Wanaque Reservoir,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/034%2520OCT-NOV%25201966.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014883888&usg=AOvVaw06auY28qrL1bWzlUfc67UK)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 10 (Oct./Nov. 1966): 6; Sanderson, [InvRes](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014884236&usg=AOvVaw218BuDG9bmDg8H9nE39pWR)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014884473&usg=AOvVaw3cVLjVXm_QLYO1APNjzQ4i) pp. 58–62; Center for UFO Studies, \[[case files](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1966_10_10-26_US_NJ_Wanaque-Reservoir_NICAP_MultipleWit.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014884726&usg=AOvVaw0bqscVSNHL1V_xrQSKJU9O)\])

October 11 — 9:45 p.m. Two boys in Elizabeth, New Jersey—Martin Munov and James Yanchitis—are walking home on 4th Street near East Jersey Street, adjacent to the elevated New Jersey Turnpike. Yanchitis tells his friend that there is someone following them. They turn and see a man standing behind a high wire fence separating them from the turnpike 30 feet above them. The fence is 8 feet high and the embankment running up to it is steep. John Keel interviews the two boys three days after the incident. They tell him that the man is 7 feet tall, has a dark complexion, and is wearing a green work suit. He has a bald head, large eyes, and a huge grinning mouth full of white teeth. (John Keel, Strange Creatures from Time and Space, Fawcett, 1970, p. 176)

October 15 —4:45 a.m. Forester Jerry H. Simons is driving home from a camping expedition, notices a reddish glow behind him, and stops his car near Split Rock Pond, south of Newfoundland, New Jersey, to investigate. A flat- bottom, red-orange disc with a dome on top is hovering above and behind his car. Near panic, he flees the area with the object following him. When the light from the object illuminates the ground around him, his car engine, dashlights, and headlights all fail. When the object recedes, his lights and engine function normally. This sequence is repeated three times, strongly demonstrating a direct correlation between the light from the UFO and the failure of his car’s electrical system. Shortly after the sighting, Simons begins experiencing a recurring illness (the reason for his story appearing in a medical journal); it is characterized by fatigue, anorexia, soreness, muscle weakness, chills, and significant weight loss. After about 6 months he has fully recovered. (Berthold Eric Schwarz, “[UFOs: Delusion or Dilemma,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.semanticscholar.org/paper/UFOs%253A-delusion-or-dilemma.-Schwarz/0258161f6ed733279963cfcfe4df78aa4f361458&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014885357&usg=AOvVaw0e5G9cw4aNYAOhtUkJOYpV)” Medical Times 96 (October 1968): 967–981; UFOEv II 37; Herbert S. Taylor, “An Update on Vehicle Interference Reports, Part 2,” IUR 34, no. 1 (Sept. 2011): 14)

Mid-October — [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014885776&usg=AOvVaw1MS9s52zppCjFsBfIGlYk4) is stressed by [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014886018&usg=AOvVaw34mbk4r_F9chAJWSJDPZly)’s statements, so he calls both Condon and [Low](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014886265&usg=AOvVaw30FYEFfbqXXK6NZuuJrQHW)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014886471&usg=AOvVaw1APRuM7Ze6hQJbT2UJZXvd) Both assure him they were misquoted and ask for NICAP’s support. He expresses his doubts to [Saunders](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://psycnet.apa.org/record/1993-27194-001&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014886707&usg=AOvVaw0Qm0LF5xiJG93gKTZ3MOFn)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://psycnet.apa.org/record/1993-27194-001&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014886928&usg=AOvVaw2uLSYlNP3W_h9dVa8TvH8F) who with [Richard Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014887145&usg=AOvVaw3YksFLTsEhxJqRrkL_hZXe) convinces him to lend his support to the project, for now. (UFOs Yes, 117)

October 19 — [James E. McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014887470&usg=AOvVaw1iWXZroDxVnHJgf1JessEw) speaks to the Washington, D.C., Chapter of the American Meteorological Society on the inadequacy of military UFO investigations and the need to take seriously the “possibility that these aerial objects may be some type of extraterrestrial probes.” (James E. McDonald, “[The Problem of the Unidentified](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kirkmcd.princeton.edu/JEMcDonald/mcdonald_102166.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014887767&usg=AOvVaw24qx4WvNjQwMUptciLkTlE) [Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kirkmcd.princeton.edu/JEMcDonald/mcdonald_102166.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014887997&usg=AOvVaw3dwUAJPpxg-uAPIh4-3BS6)” October 19, 1966; Clark III 697)

October 20 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014888283&usg=AOvVaw2jdXO7hH4fsxd-kfWrx-I8) visits [Franklin Roach](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franklin_E._Roach&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014888533&usg=AOvVaw0nQ7MwdLB4V10NDC85HOHP) in Boulder, Colorado, to meet [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014888782&usg=AOvVaw21o8z-HK3F34QcKqflqowb) and other Colorado project members.

He notes that Condon has a “basically negative attitude.” (Clark III 1193)

October 20 — 11:50 p.m. A telecommunications technician in Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan, sees a strangely behaving nocturnal light. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [p. 45](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/44/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014889258&usg=AOvVaw1rIlLEAYOnL04KHY26D3IZ))

October 21 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014889543&usg=AOvVaw1B1jyiVVp_bjKCgIntByNK)’s letter on misconceptions about UFOs is belatedly published in Science. (J. Allen Hynek, “[UFO’s](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jstor.org/stable/1719233?refreqid%3Dexcelsior%253A2a1122ffa895b7dc3c96c05f040cc7ef&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014889852&usg=AOvVaw2YGVSHYHvLJiA0e1d9CZZS) [Merit Scientific Study,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.jstor.org/stable/1719233?refreqid%3Dexcelsior%253A2a1122ffa895b7dc3c96c05f040cc7ef&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014890107&usg=AOvVaw20dER7NxyqULMV2eVlaAu7)” Science 154 (1966): 329)

* * *

October 21 — Night. Three junior high school students are standing at one end of their street in Amsterdam, New York, when they notice a star-like light to the right of the Moon. The star proceeds to draw aright-angle step around the Moon and continues northward, where it joins two other objects. The three objects then form 90° angles, equilateral triangles, and other geometrical figures. Two of the students go home for binoculars, and while they are away the sky show stops. They remain in the sky, but stationary. The objects look spherical through binoculars with some sort of lighted, colored areas that rotate. (Michael D. Swords, “We Know Where You Live,” IUR 30, no. 2 (January 2006): 10)

October 26 — 11:50 p.m. A man is driving in a rural, wooded area near Takoma Park, Maryland, when he sees a disc that seems about to land in a clearing. It puts on a red-and-green light show as it hovers. A large central beam of light shines onto the field below. The car radio bursts with static, and he hears a whirring sound coming from the object. He tries to accelerate the car, but it won’t move. Radio and drive functions resume when the UFO moves away. (Michael D. Swords, “Messing Around with the Force,” IUR 31, no, 4 (March 2008): 17, 29)

October 28 — The Space Defense Center’s satellite-tracking Delta I computer system at Cheyenne Mountain, Colorado, becomes operational. (Wikipedia, “[Space Defense Center](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_Defense_Center&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014890933&usg=AOvVaw09LMD8R1wKKruteHQe3JNc)”)

October 31 — Night. An observer in Gloucester, Massachusetts, notices a particularly bright star in the southwestern sky that is moving in a wide arc. When it reaches Ursa Major, it paces along the Big Dipper, then turns and takes an approximately parallel course to the front of the constellation. (Michael D. Swords, “We Know Where You Live,” IUR 30, no. 2 (January 2006): 10)

November 1 — The University of Colorado UFO project officially launches. [Michael D. Swords](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_D._Swords&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014891416&usg=AOvVaw2HjRZyBJoxdkULzaqAR2nw) writes: “It was one of the most peculiar scientific grants of all time. Normally a governmental grant goes to a scientist who has initiated it or is at least vitally interested and experienced in the field, and essentially knows exactly what he is going to do.

This grant was to a scientist who was pushed into it, had little interest and apparently no experience, and, despite his brilliance, ‘didn’t have a clue.’ Because the reports of the UFO phenomenon are so complex and multidimensional, this short-term ‘backwards grant’ was doomed to fail before it was even signed.” (Swords 309– 312)

November 1 — 8:00 p.m. Mrs. Ray Tibbetts is talking on the phone in her home at Newfields, New Hampshire, when her son, Dale, yells that there is a strange light outside. Her foster daughter, Anita Purrington, joins Dale and they both get excited. Mrs. Tibbetts runs to a window when the house lights begin blinking on and off. She goes to her son’s room and sees a huge object with two tiers of four windows from which a strange, yellow-green light is shining. The size of one of the windows is as big as her living room wall. An apparent ceiling line is visible in the bottom tier. Suddenly an intense white light shoots out from the object at Mrs. Tibbetts, who is knocked backward and gets spots before her eyes. When her vision clears, the UFO is gone. She has pains in her eyes the next two days and they are extremely sensitive to light. She drives to a clinic in Exeter, New Hampshire, which finds a spasm in the eyelid and tearing, but it attributes this to the cobalt therapy she has been getting. (Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., [Strange Effects from UFOs](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014891964&usg=AOvVaw2VuUTU14fqBGdeapZ3rypZ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Books/Other/Lore%252C%2520Gordon%2520-%2520Strange%2520Effects%2520from%2520UFOs.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014892203&usg=AOvVaw33evhugr1K-gI7HTFugfWr) NICAP, 1969, pp. 10–11)

Early November — [Low](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014892556&usg=AOvVaw0AFPGBNif1VhfT8gPaeix1) and [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014892804&usg=AOvVaw0MO2pJ754OlViOZ_r5aV3X) make the Colorado project’s first field trip, to Minot and Donnybrook, North Dakota. November 2 — 7:25 p.m. [Woodrow Derenberger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53218997/woodrow-wilson-derenberger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014893081&usg=AOvVaw3IjYyEtjlCGyrQfbQp8F8n) is driving his panel truck home to Parkersburg, West Virginia, on

Interstate 77 when a low-flying dark object about 35 feet wide cuts in front of him and forces him to stop. It hovers a foot above the ground, only 20 feet ahead. The object has a profile similar to a kerosene lamp chimney flattened on the bottom side. A door opens and a smiling man of dark complexion descends, wearing a topcoat (“blue and quite shiny, having a glistening effect”) over shiny blue trousers. Without opening his mouth, which bears a fixed grin, he addresses Derenberger telepathically, asking him to open his window. For the next 10 minutes he conducts a telepathic conversation, first asking Derenberger’s name and saying that his own is “Indrid Cold” from a planet called Lanulos in the “Ganymede galaxy.” He tells Derenberger not to think of him as an alien and concludes by saying, “We will see you again.” After admitting Mr. Cold, the UFO rises vertically and disappears. A truck driver named [Walter Vanscoy](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/116946916/walter-glenn-vanscoy&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014893479&usg=AOvVaw0dmVw0eBSkQsbipQB2ckhz) is going north on I-77 and sees, in apparent confirmation of the encounter, a truck parked on the berm of the southbound I-77 lanes with a man wearing a knee-length coat standing by the passenger side. Derenberger’s space adventures are only beginning. (“[The Woodrow Derenberger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://themothman.fandom.com/wiki/The_Woodrow_Derenberger_Interview&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014893782&usg=AOvVaw3Eg-n5jaREe1wXme_PmJym) [Interview, November 3, 1966,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://themothman.fandom.com/wiki/The_Woodrow_Derenberger_Interview&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014894016&usg=AOvVaw03nT1gcUSvXgconfTbXz92)” The MothMan Wikia; “[Parkersburg Salesman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95400976/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014894235&usg=AOvVaw0AsBekhPUW2hr6RmXASWN-) [Speaks with Spaceman,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/8137890/parkersburg-salesman-speaks-with/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014894476&usg=AOvVaw2gnojahDzpiTsSbnswQdYl)” Beckley (W.Va.) Raleigh Register, November 4, 1966, pp. 1–2; John A. Keel, The Mothman Prophecies, Tor ed., 1991,

[pp. 50–52](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mothmanprophecie00keelrich/page/50/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014894872&usg=AOvVaw2PUK8uUEXidVvI3OU6I3VQ); Woodrow W. Derenberger and Harold W. Hubbard, Visitors from Lanulos, Vantage, 1971; Clark III 402–403; Jerome Clark, “The Adventures of Woody Derenberger,” IUR 20, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1995): 7–8; Taunia Derenberger-Bowman, Beyond Lanulos: Our Fifty Years with Indrid Cold, The Author, 2016; Theo Paijmans, “The Terrible Grinning Men,” Fortean Times 397 (October 2020): 32–34)

* * *

November 4 — [Derenberger](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53218997/woodrow-wilson-derenberger&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014895469&usg=AOvVaw38AzTZPytAWT8jyUl9LKnw) has another encounter when he lapses into a trance while driving a truck with a colleague along US Highway 50 near Parkersburg, West Virginia. He starts speaking, sometimes mumbling, other times conveying messages about “ships.” Derenberger later says that Cold was sending him a telepathic message that his ship was directly above the truck. A sighting of a UFO “like two glass chimneys from a kerosene lamp welded together at their widest or bulging ends” at 6:45 p.m. by [Irma Hudgins](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/186221336/irma-hudgins&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014895776&usg=AOvVaw06sNMcUZjd8mHpoJtyudXx) and her daughter [Pamela Sue](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/205012268/pamela-sue-chase&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014896033&usg=AOvVaw22LcGNui2eaDRk6MXTbrkl) near the intersection of I-77 and State Highway 47 seems to confirm some UFO activity. Derenberger has further meetings with Indrid Cold and his companion Carl Ardo, who often pass undetected among earthlings, through the early 1970s and in 1984. (John A. Keel, The Mothman Prophecies, Tor ed., 1991, [pp. 54–55](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mothmanprophecie00keelrich/page/54/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014896373&usg=AOvVaw3t3J0Eaoywjh3ymujYpiZ8); Clark III 404–410; Jerome Clark, “The Adventures of Woody Derenberger,” IUR 20, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1995): 8–11, 20–23)

November 5 — [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014896736&usg=AOvVaw2DAbIccK7qdzZtnLL8Mx_F) tells the press that he knows “some people \[[McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014897035&usg=AOvVaw3JpF_QeXkAWaRKTrdCO8Dx)\] who believe the air force is misleading us, but I don’t think so. Maybe they are. I don’t care much.” (Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [p.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/112/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014897353&usg=AOvVaw0TyIppbRXxVQ7PHTqERoxP) [113](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/112/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014897591&usg=AOvVaw07TpLk0Aj8Lttz_ZGqNMPw))

November 6 — 6:30 p.m. A driver on State Highway 47 near Parkersburg, West Virginia, sees a UFO and gets out to watch it. At first it looks like two lights near the American Viscose plant across the Little Kanawha River. The object crosses the river and the highway then turns off its lights at about 100–150 feet altitude. The lights come back on and it starts moving toward the witness, stopping right over his car and focusing a bright beam of light on him for 10 seconds. It shuts off and the object moves leisurely away to the south. (Clark III 405)

November 11 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014897968&usg=AOvVaw0Ymn_o3yWQa23SJiK3tp4o) and [Vallée](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Vall%25C3%25A9e&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014898224&usg=AOvVaw3VOvtUwg0rxDpICMpsu-tm) give an extended briefing to [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014898519&usg=AOvVaw2GzBYv25510Gup-pZho-hL) and his staff. Hynek urges the project to adopt a rating system, by which if a sighting emerges as both strange and credible, it will be deemed worthy of further investigation. Vallée recommends standardized report forms that ask all the right questions. They both sense that [Low](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014898837&usg=AOvVaw06jjwl1LvXKgJ22SRKDS5U)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014899093&usg=AOvVaw04fQiHO1DMEtAaXZN4A6zF) not Condon, is “clearly the decision-maker.” Hynek tells [Craig](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://legacy.lib.utexas.edu/taro/tamucush/00151/tamu-00151.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014899392&usg=AOvVaw17KmRw4_AIbX5wO9fPLgT4) that the project must recommend that scientific investigation of UFOs be continued. (Clark III 1193; UFOs Yes, 50–61; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014899799&usg=AOvVaw2-FU134QjavRdNlN1_l6Ps), p. 5)

November 13 — Barber and amateur astronomer [Ralph Ditter Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/189417696/ralph-william-ditter&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014900121&usg=AOvVaw1M52saFRBwd8k0bxUitJRA) of Roseville, Ohio, takes several “spectacular” photos of a daylight disc. Later, Raytheon deals with the photographic analysis of the photos. The report states that the object in the photos is 3–4 inches in diameter, not 30 feet as claimed by Ditter; the object is not at a considerable distance, but a mere 3–4 feet from the camera lens; and the photos are not taken in rapid succession, but approximately 70 minutes has elapsed between photos. Also, the numbers on the backs of the photographs are out of sequence with Ditter’s story. (NICAP, “[The Ditter Photo Hoax](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/661113zanesville_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014900417&usg=AOvVaw3wWP4wjI52mjg_zq3b9Pst)”; Center for UFO Studies, \[[Ditter photos](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/ZanesvilleDocs/1966_11_13_Zanesille_Photos.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014900650&usg=AOvVaw2mzCvfUZl-3baWRZrkoCzZ)\]; Center for UFO Studies, \[case documents, [part one](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/ZanesvilleDocs/Zanesville_Documents.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014900974&usg=AOvVaw0OVx8_Ted53ZEr_GBNfwGy)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/ZanesvilleDocs/Zanesville_Documents.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014901202&usg=AOvVaw1bs6Iwx-HBeZ1EtkYxiLZz) [part two](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/ZanesvilleDocs/Zanesville_Documents_2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014901456&usg=AOvVaw3jvppx23HlCTys2C6Xk8Y3)\]; E. L. Merritt, “[Photogrammetric Analysis of a](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/ZanesvilleDocs/Zanesville_Photogrammetric.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014901688&usg=AOvVaw2HY8-a8A3iwzpG0OVO6cjv)

[Non-Synchronous Pair of U.F.O. Exposures,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/ZanesvilleDocs/Zanesville_Photogrammetric.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014901959&usg=AOvVaw0DqMeCAZxQLxe24YbsvX1_)” June 1967)

November 14 — [Quintanilla](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hector_Quintanilla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014902225&usg=AOvVaw30wwGjUNUqrDnyzJ3hC6GV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hector_Quintanilla&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014902419&usg=AOvVaw1-GwISAa6_oUHIbxopNIbS) Lt. [William Marley](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/103904684/william-h-marley&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014902651&usg=AOvVaw0tV2gWV4T88lllSaWHeex2), and Col. [Robert Hippler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65715202/robert-r-hippler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014902879&usg=AOvVaw1Zp6lT-gNKgdjUsVpiPw0q) of AFOSR brief the Colorado project staff.

Quintanilla contradicts [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014903181&usg=AOvVaw0RGu8Fokjm5uqySQyXnfQK)’s account of the swamp gas explanation. (UFOs Yes, 61)

November 15 — 11:30 p.m. Two young couples from Point Pleasant, West Virginia—Roger and [Linda Scarberry](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92851560/linda-sue-scarberry&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014903511&usg=AOvVaw1-elAd5_Dd-dgESdieVMDX) and Steve and Mary Mallette—are joyriding in an area outside of town known as the “TNT area” \[the site of a former World War II munitions plant and now part of the McClintic Wildlife Management Area\] when they

encounter a large gray creature whose eyes glow red when the car’s headlights pick it up. Scarberry describes it as shaped like a man but nearly 7 feet tall. They describe it as a “large flying man with 10-foot wings” that are folded against its back. Terrified, they drive away but pass a similar creature on a hill by the road. As they pass it, it spreads its wings, rises into the air, and pursues their car, keeping pace at even 100 mph. The entity does not pursue them into town, but they drive directly to the Mason County Courthouse, where they tell their story to Deputy [Millard Halstead](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63046926/millard-w_-halstead&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014903993&usg=AOvVaw0q_-PeCreIEXfop1UDcz1j)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/63046926/millard-w_-halstead&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014904199&usg=AOvVaw3oMgo8uEc74Yw5hdwLPuZy) who accompanies the witnesses back to the site. He hears strange static disturbances coming from his radio, but they find no evidence of the encounter. On November 16, Sheriff [George E. Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61853560/george-e-johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014904443&usg=AOvVaw1NQlPXpBNehRhXngs7qL6S) holds a press conference to discuss the sighting, the press begins calling the creature “Mothman” based on a comic book character. The Scarberrys and Mallettes go back to the site in the daylight and find odd-looking tracks like “two horseshoes put together.” After this sighting, more people begin reporting encounters, and hundreds of cars swarm out to the TNT area at night in search of a Mothman sighting. In May 1976, representatives of the Ohio UFO Investigators League reinterview several witnesses, all of whom stick to their stories and sometimes add interesting details. (John A. Keel, The Mothman Prophecies, Tor ed., 1991, [pp. 59–61](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/mothmanprophecie00keelrich/page/58/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014904829&usg=AOvVaw2_24hvZ4jsoCr7SyOFV04a); Clark III 779–781; “[Scarberry and Mallette’s Mothman Sighting,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://themothman.fandom.com/wiki/Scarberry_and_Mallette%2527s_Mothman_Sighting&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014905080&usg=AOvVaw1RHVjTLMOzf-ZQccp6UNQo)” The MothMan Wikia)

November 17 — 4:00 a.m. Two police officers see a round, glowing object with a wide, flat rim around the center resting on the ground near Gaffney, South Carolina. They estimate the diameter to be about 20 feet. As they watch from less than 50 feet away, a door opens and a small humanoid being descends. The observation lasts several minutes. Footprints are found at the site. (John A. Keel, “[The Little Man of Gaffney,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201968%2520V%252014%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014905426&usg=AOvVaw3Qv3TCaEPVWx_xxiOgmvPS)” Flying Saucer Review 14, no. 2 (March/April 1968): 17–19)

* * *

November 22 — [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014905859&usg=AOvVaw2hlnAx4nZ6AVPp6H55Ar0V) informally visits several Colorado project members. He explains radar complexities and mirage effects and tells them that they will soon be “confronting astonishing evidence of mishandling of the UFO problems by your sponsoring agency.” (UFOs Yes, 64)

November 22 — 9:00–10:00 a.m. A biochemist and consultant to a logging company and his wife are traveling on State Highway 58 through the Willamette Pass, Oregon, when he decides to stop and take photos of some scenery. He stops at the Diamond Peak overlook, takes 2 photos, then pauses to take a third. Suddenly, he claims, a disc- shaped object with a domed top ascends into his field of view. After stopping for 3 seconds, it shoots off toward the right and disappears into a cloud bank. When he develops the roll of film, the photos show a blurred disc- shaped object with two black bands beneath and sitting atop a seeming column of vapor. NICAP is given the photo but is not impressed. In 1989, physicist [Irwin Wieder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.aip.org/history-programs/niels-bohr-library/photos/wieder-irwin-b1&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014906296&usg=AOvVaw1mtk7M9g7mVz9W04fmx195) performs a detailed analysis of the photo and determines that it is a blurred photo of the “Diamond Peak” sign taken from a passing car. (Clark III 1281–1283; Irwin Wieder, “[The Willamette Pass Oregon UFO Photo Revisited: An Explanation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/7/jse_07_2_weider.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014906615&usg=AOvVaw2MKICFvICN8WvuqRaRI3en)” Journal of Scientific Exploration 7, no. 2 (1993): 173–198; Irwin Wieder, “The Willamette Pass Photo Explained,” IUR 18, no. 6

(Nov./Dec. 1993): 18–19)

November 22 — 10:00 a.m. A deer hunter searching for game near Roaring River State Park, Missouri, returns to his group’s camp and becomes alarmed when he sees smoke rising from it. He finds their tent and other camping equipment destroyed. The tent is still smoldering, one of the aluminum tent poles is singed, and the aluminum cots are melted. The tent is set up under two trees, but their leaves show no traces of damage at all. About 15 feet away is a dead tree with its top still burning. The witness then heasr a low humming sound and sees an object rising from the valley about 300 feet away. He is able to take a photograph of it as it ascends and manages a second photo a few seconds later. It is an aluminum-colored disc, about 25 feet in diameter and 8 feet thick, with a band around its center and some kind of projection at its rear. The humming sound intensifies as the object picks up speed and disappears in 20 seconds. (CUFOS case file; Ted Phillips, [Physical Traces Associated with UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Physical_Traces.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014907133&usg=AOvVaw0_Pen7XnGtaBbeNrpx8xG7) [Sightings](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Physical_Traces.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014907351&usg=AOvVaw1Lss2ao3HGgI9MgSb405D7)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/books/Physical_Traces.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014907517&usg=AOvVaw3WUeUCd3dBsew6sPBbPcPz) Center for UFO Studies, 1978, p. 44; B. J. Booth, “[UFO Encountered, Photographed, Roaring River,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufocasebook.com/roaringriver.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014907756&usg=AOvVaw1-3w1k8B2El1F65ujj8N-3) [Missouri, 1966,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufocasebook.com/roaringriver.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014907972&usg=AOvVaw0hkSPvJrStgI8vQi8u4ODb)” UFO Casebook)

November 22 — 4:20 p.m. At least eight employees of the American Newspaper Publishers Association in New York City watch a UFO from their offices on the 17th floor at 750 Third Avenue. The UFO is a rectangular, “cushion- shaped” object whose bright, reflective surface first catches the eye of Assistant General Manager Donald R. McVay. They go outside onto the terrace and watch the object move southward over the East River, then hover above the United Nations building. It flutters and bobs “like a ship on agitated water.” It rises slowly and moves south then west. One of the other witnesses is the manager of the Publications Department, William H. Leick. (“[Major Sighting Wave,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/035%2520JAN-FEB%25201967.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014908319&usg=AOvVaw1AjQXF26LBHqqGjMEQTW4M)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 11 (Jan,/Feb. 1967): 4; James E. McDonald, “[Statement on](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23cities&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014908629&usg=AOvVaw2WtAx0GNa1NFG5xzoqlNEY) [Unidentified Flying Objects,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.project1947.com/shg/symposium/mcdonald.html%23cities&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014908861&usg=AOvVaw3qvfeldlkW0Kn1aCkUlqpY)” in Symposium on Unidentified Flying Objects, Hearings, US House Committee on Science and Astronautics, 90th Cong., 2nd Sess., July 29, 1968, p. 54)

November 28 — At [Saunders](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://psycnet.apa.org/record/1993-27194-001&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014909199&usg=AOvVaw0uWX8xSY8alewKptalBHNj)’s invitation, [Hall](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_H._Hall&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014909422&usg=AOvVaw2JkcD6Iwx3ooaA-LPxnsW1) and [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014909651&usg=AOvVaw0YDKPy3rSg6ZIYNCOVMks5) brief the Colorado project members. They meet with [Low](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014909908&usg=AOvVaw03HJ0kN2Y0zksAMZs-ScoC) and show him some strong NICAP reports like the 1959 Redmond, Oregon, case. Low dismisses it as too old because the witnesses “wouldn’t remember the details.” Keyhoe focuses on the cover-up, while Hall argues that the best way to assess UFO evidence is to look at the aggregated evidence. (Clark III 1193; UFO Yes, 62–63; Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [pp. 108–110](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/108/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014910253&usg=AOvVaw3_296Yc02t3-oj3Q9aO7fs))

November 28 — 12:10 a.m. Spanish contactee [Enrique Villagrasa](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ummowiki.fr/index.php/Enrique_Villagrasa&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014910542&usg=AOvVaw0PPStVQY-5HC5BA3HRUcPe) receives by telephone his first message from inhabitants of the planet Ummo. The caller speaks in a slow monotone and with a foreign accent, answering questions about history and science. Villagrasa has the impression he is talking to an “electronic brain.” Other messages follow, and Villagrasa passes them on to [Fernando Sesma](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ummowiki.fr/index.php/Fernando_Sesma&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014910810&usg=AOvVaw3WD4SMPQ0oURnXdeEthH6d), an employee of the Spanish telegraph service and head of Amigos de los Visitantes del Espacio. (Clark III 1184)

November 28 — Night. Janis Bodungen, 17, is on her way home on Farm Road 1300 northwest of El Campo, Texas, when she sees teo bright lights coming toward her. As they approach, the two lights turn into one large golden light as tall as the trees. She turns the car around and speeds away. (“[The Texas Flap,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201967%252001%252000%2520-%2520January-February.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014911268&usg=AOvVaw1BCB2qe9UPZ_KeUKOFG3kH)” APRO Bulletin, Jan./Feb. 1967, pp. 3, 5)

November 30 — 4:35 p.m. J. G. Hockenberry is flying a Cessna 150 near New Kingstown, Pennsylvania, when he sees a saucer-shaped object, about 30 feet in diameter, approach and hover beside the aircraft. It has a dull, gray-white finish and one blinking red light. When the pilot flies into a cloud layer, the object rises straight up and out of sight. (NICAP case file)

December — [Low](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014911778&usg=AOvVaw3PTzUHkUFEJxawTTHPHESj) visits NICAP headquarters in Washington, D.C. He admits that [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014912034&usg=AOvVaw0bSRluWGSCP0gdNfl-N1Sv) thinks the early reports are worthless. [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014912278&usg=AOvVaw3lkQJfQ4CcRDs1yjCBooDJ) tells Low that before he wastes any time supplying them with reports, he wants to know what

* * *

Condon thinks of the 1965 cases they already provided. Otherwise, NICAP might pull out. (Keyhoe, Aliens from Space, Signet ed., 1974, [p. 112](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/aliensfromspacer00keyh/page/112/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014912706&usg=AOvVaw1OewKtvvbwqdjFlLiLy3UF))

December — Colorado project member and psychologist [William A. Scott](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://psycnet.apa.org/record/1993-27194-001&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014912979&usg=AOvVaw31Ua4qGufTdDPWaL5BoDxY) devises a witness questionnaire. One page is devoted to the UFO, the other 20 are about the psychological profile of the witness. When he discovers that the witness is not the project’s main focus, he goes home. (UFOs Yes, 67–69)

December 2 — Wertheimer goes to Washington, D.C., to interview witnesses of the National Airport radar-visual sightings of 1952. Virtually every witness disputes Gen. [John A. Samford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_A._Samford&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014913354&usg=AOvVaw2kg9JWizSxMKvKIekjwhj0)’s explanation of temperature inversions. (UFOs Yes, 72–74)

December 7 — A TAP Air Portugal airliner piloted by Capt. Henrique Maia is paced by two luminous objects near Luanda, Angola. (Lorenzen, UFOs over the Americas, Signet, 1968, p. 24)

December 15 — 5:30 p.m. Four witnesses driving northwest toward Woodstown, New Jersey, see a triangular object with rounded corners and three blinking lights. It is moving slowly in the opposite direction. When they leave Woodstown to the southeast at 6:15 p.m., it reappears and passes over the car. (Marler 134)

December 17 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014913823&usg=AOvVaw1PoQW92Rl4VypTddKLk00n)’s article, in which he states that hundreds of puzzling UFO cases exit and urges a serious inquiry, appears in the Saturday Evening Post. (J. Allen Hynek, “[Are Flying Saucers Real?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/0%2520-%2520Articles/United%2520States/Saturday%2520Evening%2520Post/1966%252012%252017_Saturday%2520Evening%2520Post_Hynek.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014914195&usg=AOvVaw3A74HWCFbEUNSaSHrU0D2S)” Saturday Evening Post, December 17, 1966, pp. 17–21, [transcribed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/articles/SatEvePost-661217.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014914499&usg=AOvVaw0znGvrYLj72rlkpjAiPb6M) by NICAP)

December 21 — Lockheed test pilot [William C. Park](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roadrunnersinternationale.com/park.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014914797&usg=AOvVaw08wVuO2SW9BCjf1hff5ePV) flies an A-12 for 10,198 statute miles in only 6 hours, at an average speed of 1,660 mph. (“[William C. Park Jr.,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://roadrunnersinternationale.com/park.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014915042&usg=AOvVaw20n2y7iXX4is5_lo0zd8dl)” Roadrunners Internationale)

December 28 — The Defense Department makes a recommendation to President [Johnson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyndon_B._Johnson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014915349&usg=AOvVaw0mY6NcDfAYHF4XZkOyAAmy) to terminate the A-12 program due to budget concerns and because of the development of the SR-71 Blackbird. It is to be phased out by June 1968. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed A-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_A-12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014915619&usg=AOvVaw2hIOK_j93015SsigouoDdT)”)

December 30 — 8:15 p.m. A physics professor named Galloway \[possibly [Louie A. Galloway III](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/houston-tx/louie-galloway-7703617&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014915921&usg=AOvVaw2epmKGjDnHkQbUagq6okgp)\] is driving through a wooded area near Haynesville, Louisiana, and sees a bright, pulsating glow, changing from orange to white, in the woods about one mile away. He estimates its visible light power output at about one megawatt. Coming back the next day, he locates traces of burns and calls the USAF and University of Colorado UFO project. (Condon, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/60/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014916180&usg=AOvVaw3iAiRacJu1tKipiCxiHf-x)

[61,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/60/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014916454&usg=AOvVaw0H9a4riAV8py93RzKHAru_) [277–280](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/60/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014916685&usg=AOvVaw2o2XR4m19UBizJdMdnS09f); [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014916887&usg=AOvVaw3jlRcsowHtN6fvltlS7WNK)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014917055&usg=AOvVaw1sNkBBpH0HhzTth5giDLvw) p. 320; Jacques Vallée, “[Estimates of Power Optical Output in Six Cases of Unexplained](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/12/jse_12_3_vallee_1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014917300&usg=AOvVaw2omJBurgOJ30VEy1X85-WW) [Aerial Objects with Defined Luminosity Characteristics,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scientificexploration.org/docs/12/jse_12_3_vallee_1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014917542&usg=AOvVaw071ofcvABFTDjvhn-_y-Z8)” Journal of Scientific Exploration 12, no. 3 (1998): 350– 352)

1967

1967 — The US nuclear stockpile reaches its peak at 31,255 bombs. (Ryan Crierie, “[U.S. Nuclear Stockpile, 1945–2009](https://web.archive.org/web/20190123105349/https://www.alternatewars.com/BBOW/ABC_Weapons/US_Nuclear_Stockpile.htm)”) 

1967 — Night. Miss E. R. East, of Gibsons, British Columbia, is awakened by a banging noise and sees a brilliant orange-red light soaring above hills behind the town. As she watches, its color changes to glowing white and the object moves toward the Strait of Georgia. Suddenly, a 10-foot-wide beam of light shoots down to the water. As it strikes the surface, it bends and lies flat on the surface, lighting up the wharf on Keats Island. As she stares at it, her eyes begin to sting. (John Magor, Our UFO Visitors, Hancock House, 1977, pp. 37–38)

1967 — A French government UFO project, to be led by former inspector general at the Commissariat à l’Energie Atomique [Jean-Luc Bruneau](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/b/BruneauJeanLuc/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014918598&usg=AOvVaw2q7OrYYTcsDPN6L2x9wMRx)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/b/BruneauJeanLuc/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014918778&usg=AOvVaw2gQ-hRDeDCmlp3z2bgd9t5) is approved. Bruneau recommends that the study first become a project of the Centre Nationale d’Études Spatiales, and later a European initiative. But the project is postponed because of the political crisis in France in May 1968. (Gildas Bourdais, “From GEPAN to SEPRA: Official UFO Studies in France,” IUR 25, no. 4 (Winter 2000–2001): 11)

1967 — [Robert M. Wood](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/Robert_M._Wood&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014919131&usg=AOvVaw2Rj-vPKES5TjxC2980XbD-), physicist and aerospace manager for McDonnell Douglas Corporation, is assigned the task of exploring breakthroughs in gravity propulsion. The project includes laboratory evaluation of hypotheses, field observations, and examination of UFO literature. At one point there are 4 full-time and 3 part-time employees involved in the effort, code-named BITBR (“Boys in the Back Room”). Wood networks with [James E.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014919384&usg=AOvVaw3yBpmqjRIT8mzbtYJLWiIV) [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014919591&usg=AOvVaw1gwQbPcYJcsT7GQmzQNG99)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014919769&usg=AOvVaw1VwVIuZs7oISSXbMbYBLN-) [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014919972&usg=AOvVaw1YxlWfKj2wf6GF1YW9BtAE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014920142&usg=AOvVaw3L4-pIAKjB_KCeBRxbx-V2) [Carl Sagan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Sagan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014920346&usg=AOvVaw3HZsg8JSuc2tA4cp0Qgjxs)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Sagan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014920512&usg=AOvVaw29Y4BZtomfIzpp0-ydlbhL) and the Colorado project. The initiative is terminated in 1969 at Wood’s recommendation due to its inability to project a technological payoff. (Robert M. Wood, “A Little Physics…A Little Friction: A Close Encounter with the Condon Committee,” IUR 18, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1993): 6–10)

January — Night. French rocket scientist [Jean-Pierre Morin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/m/MorinJeanPierre/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014920885&usg=AOvVaw1IpdwILnrtiGRNu2QDX0xQ) is driving three members of a launch team to the tower at Interarmy Special Vehicles Test Center at Hammaguir, Algeria. When they arrive at a row of buildings, they notice a light in the sky silently coming toward them. Their car engine sputters and fails. It stops and hovers at an elevation of 45° about 1,600 feet away. Morin thinks it is attached to a black, cylindrical object 980–1,300 feet in length and 100 feet in diameter with “flames” of different colors along its side. The light begins moving slowly

* * *

again, and a car with astrophysicists stops and watches it for another 20–30 minutes before it ascends and disappears. (Good Need, [pp. 296–297](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/296/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014921341&usg=AOvVaw2PmvtKtxNy_hSF0II89iVh))

Early January — 7:30 p.m. Robert Blaine is driving with five other witnesses on State Highway 55 two miles southeast of Farwell, Minnesota, when his headlights and engine suddenly go out. He sees an orange flash to his left at the level of his hood and tiny beads of light cross in front of the windshield. A passenger sees an orange-and-red flash go by on the driver’s side at window level. The car coasts to a stop, then the engine and headlights go back on again by themselves. (“[Car Buzzing Incidents on Increase,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201967%252005%252000%2520-%2520May-June.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014921763&usg=AOvVaw39irJJLtu7_mBrA2mWaWRL)” APRO Bulletin, May/June 1967, p. 5)

January 3 — 2:00 a.m. A dome-shaped object hovers for several miles and 10–15 minutes above a car in New Richmond, Michigan. It illuminates the road, and the car draws to a stop with loss of steering control and the radio failing.

Examination of the car by Fred Hooven and David Moyer, engineers at the Ford Motor Company, two months later shows no faults unexplainable by ordinary causes. (Condon, [pp. 102–106](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/102/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014922361&usg=AOvVaw1OvIvebLhsvqDnP4ndPkTB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/102/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014922594&usg=AOvVaw2eSt9tr7wN1E4S8ONoLbaV) [282–285](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/282/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014922867&usg=AOvVaw0t3mdsco_e-D1hDBv3lOV5); Randle, Levelland, 2021, pp. 65–66)

January 5 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014923412&usg=AOvVaw1Wq8VZDBhItHDHXHJ60_96) writes to [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014923791&usg=AOvVaw3yBNthXys4jQcCUu8pwFk0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014924059&usg=AOvVaw3A9EENTD3lRTks6iR2AvqW) telling him that he, [Jacques Vallée](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacques_Vall%25C3%25A9e&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014924382&usg=AOvVaw1JqMa4h3FPHWod3-h_I4le), and William T. Powers are devoting more personal time to the UFO problem and are setting up a file area in the Lindheimer Observatory at Northwestern University in Evansto, Illinois. He mentions that there is enough underground interest in UFOs among his scientific colleagues that he is thinking of creating an informal “invisible college” to discuss the subject quietly. He mentions that he sat in on a hypnosis session a few weeks previously with Benjamin Simon and was allowed to question [Betty and Barney Hill](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014924800&usg=AOvVaw3izKQacoxHGsMG0KkvjOb1)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barney_and_Betty_Hill&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014925105&usg=AOvVaw2KhyB5qniU47DuiWwfSQpn) He also suggests that the Colorado project recommend that police squad cars carry cameras that can document ongoing UFO reports. (Center for UFO Studies, \[[Hynek correspondence](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/cases/1965-69_00_00_US_IL_Hynek-AF-letters.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014925476&usg=AOvVaw2RfGEwHCpod7fNfA-fTXF9)\], pp. 6– 7)

January 5 — An A-12 flown by pilot [Walter Ray](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://roadrunnersinternationale.com/ray.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014925907&usg=AOvVaw2StQizGpn79dV41GmDAv3Y) is lost during a training flight near Leith Canyon, Nevada. Due to a faulty fuel gauge, the aircraft runs out of fuel 70 miles from Groom Dry Lake. Ray glides to a lower altitude to perform a controlled bailout but cannot separate his parachute from his ejection seat. He is the first pilot to be killed in an A-12 accident. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed A-12](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_A-12&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014926322&usg=AOvVaw0KOO2oSX04OlKbK22VRLbP)”)

January 6 — [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014926730&usg=AOvVaw0otDCSrWyDsYKxNecOgm25) speaks to an overflow crowd at the Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. He says he has had to revise his thinking on UFOs, urges scientists to take an active role in investigations, and confirms reports that NORAD and SAC radar has tracked UFOs, citing a case in which SAC radar tracked a UFO at 4,000 mph on an erratic flight path. (Story, [p. 413](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/412/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014927155&usg=AOvVaw38gXDWfdx4LJ6rl33PFCIX))

January 9 — Two teenage brothers of Mount Clemens, Michigan, Daniel A. and [Grant P. Jaroslaw](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://temrowski.tributes.com/obituary/show/Grant-Paul-Jaroslaw-94892245&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014927610&usg=AOvVaw1PGi0wYkf56AcXYt92eu3J), take some Polaroid photos from the backyard of their home of a domed object moving slowly above Lake St. Clair. After they release the images to a wire service, the Air Force requests the originals for analysis. They refuse to relinquish them but give an officer at Selfridge AFB \[now Selfridge Air National Guard Base\] some copies. Maj. [Raymond Nyls](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/200131916/raymond-woodrow-nyls&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014927972&usg=AOvVaw1bYSw6B4nY5ZWq8QuwY-5G) attempts to recreate the photos at the original site using a block of wood hanging from a string on a children’s swing set. USAF turns the copies and Nyls’s recreations over to the National Photographic Interpretation Center, which takes a serious look and suspects a hoax but cannot prove it conclusively. (“[Two Brothers Photograph](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/two_brothers_photograph_circular_object_in_Michigan.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014928309&usg=AOvVaw0z77_0YgrvxawV8xCYXykF) [Circular Object in Michigan,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/two_brothers_photograph_circular_object_in_Michigan.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014928559&usg=AOvVaw0NgiEyqdfSYm5hbB8JhBzI)” Northern Ontario UFO Research and Study; Joey Del Ponte, “[Formerly Secret](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.muckrock.com/news/archives/2018/feb/14/ufo-photo-analysis/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014928801&usg=AOvVaw0vJdJ5AiLYHK9Vn-KIQxcD) [Memo Shows How the Air Force Investigated UFO Sightings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.muckrock.com/news/archives/2018/feb/14/ufo-photo-analysis/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014929040&usg=AOvVaw0avujPe9OgpvS4F6tSYxJa)” Muckrock, February 14, 2018; Curt Collins, “[Dr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2021/10/dr-hynek-and-ufo-photo-investigation-of.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014929312&usg=AOvVaw127SZgzX_N9VzsR05f2pvm) [Hynek and the UFO Photo Investigation of 1967,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://thesaucersthattimeforgot.blogspot.com/2021/10/dr-hynek-and-ufo-photo-investigation-of.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014929581&usg=AOvVaw23GCSYZrErT_i5iFz_YYH_)” The Saucers That Time Forgot, October 21, 2021)

January 12 — The USAF advisory committee holds a special briefing in Boulder, Colorado. [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014929868&usg=AOvVaw0MsJpQ5kuR7P-RUAJiqM03) discusses project plans and asks the Air Force where the project should place its emphasis. Lt. Col. [Hippler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65715202/robert-r-hippler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014930131&usg=AOvVaw3anovsu9cv13eFbLJwY36v), along with Col.

[Raymond Sleeper](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149575947/raymond-starrett-sleeper&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014930413&usg=AOvVaw38HulpdcXPSDJZ3sHUrg3n)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149575947/raymond-starrett-sleeper&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014930615&usg=AOvVaw1nbLcoXYcfSC77m3EmEvha) Blue Book’s boss as Foreign Technology Division Commander, says the project is not required to prove or disprove anything, but that “we don’t want any recommendation from you unless you feel strongly about it.” He rejects Wertheimer’s suggestion that the project should concentrate on witnesses, not sightings.

Hippler and [Ratchford](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.aaas.org/archives/j-thomas-ratchford-files&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014930924&usg=AOvVaw20H9XCzkAjWa1BUHJjHnDJ) do not adequately respond to [Low](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014931194&usg=AOvVaw0i-I9tdj7kK3MvPv6XZOGr)’s question about what USAF wants from the project. (“[Air Force Advisory Panel Briefing,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/1967_01_12_AF_PanelBriefing.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014931433&usg=AOvVaw3nStU6kDIJvYKQkriC525T)” January 12, 1967; Roy Craig, UFOs: An Insiders’ View of the Official Quest for Evidence, University of North Texas, 1995, p. 235; Michael D. Swords, “[The USAF-Sponsored](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/shg/articles/swordscc.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014931766&usg=AOvVaw2BkdLbNJl0OVL3C8TapD83) [Colorado Project for the Scientific Study of UFOs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.project1947.com/shg/articles/swordscc.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014931994&usg=AOvVaw0DZ_gk-OfXK-OYvONP7a4B)” 1995 MUFON Symposium Proceedings, MUFON, 1995; Clark III 1194; Swords 314–315)

January 12 — 7:30 p.m. A luminous object crosses the sky off Agadir, Morocco. It leaves a white trail that turns into a rainbow and falls into the sea with a deafening sound. The US Defense attaché in Rabat, Naval Capt. C. G. Strum, says the sighting “could be valuable in pursuit of Project Moon Dust.” (US Department of Defense, “[UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/Majestic-12%2520Documents%2520-%2520New%2520Batch/Project%2520Moondust/moondust_morocco_18jan67.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014932420&usg=AOvVaw37Wmh4uTv6q3MZIBeEMBX_) [Sighting over Agadir, Morocco,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.noufors.com/Documents/Majestic-12%2520Documents%2520-%2520New%2520Batch/Project%2520Moondust/moondust_morocco_18jan67.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014932720&usg=AOvVaw2ZQMvmsbNAL9XuD-3zix7a)” January 18, 1967)

January 13 — [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014933002&usg=AOvVaw1MGEfhLcOFlnNEh-1MbSsi) and [Low](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://ufohistoryfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/CO%252067%2520NEWS.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014933269&usg=AOvVaw2Ene5oW8GGyz7UUK5o-VU7) visit Cheyenne Mountain, NORAD’s underground Space Defense Center complex in Colorado, for a “classified briefing” by orbital analysts 1Lt. [Henry B. Eckert Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/196875867/henry-baldwin-eckert&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014933556&usg=AOvVaw3zAT5gcTsh82UFZOjR16Hl) and Capt. Dick A. Cable of the 9th Aerospace Defense Division’s 1st Aerospace Control Squadron about NORAD’s radar network, hours after another classified briefing for Condon and staff at Boulder concludes. The Cheyenne Mountain briefing is the first

* * *

in a series of tactical moves designed to discourage Condon’s project staff, [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014933926&usg=AOvVaw01XawZvknSsyxeH0DrfCbk)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014934112&usg=AOvVaw0snLllKaWca4BVpWYLc-Sl) and [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014934327&usg=AOvVaw2Tj3alsjratJumcWrVUPaI) from using NORAD as a source of UFO data or resource for future investigations or instrumentation. (Clark III 804–805; UFOs Yes, 66)

January 13 — Early morning. Sgt. Norman Finley of the Joplin, Missouri, police alerts fellow officers about an unexplained object overhead. Pittsburg, Kansas, police dispatcher James Cunningham notifies the Joplin police that a UFO has been seen over Pittsburg. He describes it as an object with bright colors of “vivid blue-green with flashing lights.” Cunningham alerts the Joplin station because the object seems to be leaving Kansas and heading for Missouri. After receiving that call, Joplin’s Lt. [Charles Hickman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62696468/charles-r_-hickman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014934684&usg=AOvVaw2jWRNuolUy00H2UbKZBCr2) drives to Stone’s Corner near the Joplin airport. He waits for nearly an hour before spotting a UFO in the sky, which he watches for more than an hour. It is about 1,000 feet high and seems about as big as two houses. It makes turns and maneuvers “as if it were being controlled.” For the next three days, there are more sightings in the early morning hours at Coffeyville, Kansas; Joplin, Springfield, and Newton County, Missouri; and northeast Oklahoma. (UFOs Yes, 109–110; Condon, [pp.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/286/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014934987&usg=AOvVaw1KVNnuuPaNaPJ8xgRASdpu) [286–290](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/286/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014935222&usg=AOvVaw3HaaLtMHjZyMOiAqYsb4YT))

January 13 — 10:00 p.m. The crew of a Lear Jet flying at 41,000 feet over southwestern New Mexico sees a flashing red luminous object in their 10 o’clock position. The object splits into four smaller red objects vertically several times, each separated by about 2,000 feet and each emitting a “red ray.” It then retracts the lowest objects into the top object. Albuquerque radar tracks a target 39 miles ahead of the Lear Jet moving on the same heading, with no transponder signal. At that moment the object blinks off visually for 30 seconds then blinks back on. The UFO floods the jet with an intense red light so bright that the pilot has difficulty seeing his instrument panel. It maintains its position in front for a few minutes then blinks out, comes on again, and falls back behind the left wing. It then pulls forward again. Albuquerque radar reports that it looks like the target had merged with the jet. Both the UFO and the jet make left turns over Winslow, Arizona, after which Los Angeles Center radar picks up both targets. Past Flagstaff, the object climbs at a 30° angle and disappears to the west in less than 10 seconds. (NICAP, “[R/V](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/670113winslowdir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014935579&usg=AOvVaw1-gAnGcy5Y0hFVokMy86gr)”; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014935789&usg=AOvVaw1QAuEE3pT6hJWoDVQRnmRO)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014935957&usg=AOvVaw1YcS14LqmkzIdzyXTcq1ul) p. 321; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 82–83](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/82/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014936287&usg=AOvVaw04M2U05e4lmqfCptE8Px-v))

January 15 — 5:45 p.m. Helen Godard and her two nieces see a domed disc with white light emanating from portholes in its base in Granville, Massachusetts. They hear a humming sound, and the sky and ground are illuminated by white light. Red flame jets appear at one end when the object moves. Speed is variable. At one point, all the lights go out, and when they come back on the portholes are showing red light. The object is seen three times within 20 minutes before it disappears over a mountain to the east. (“[Major Sighting Wave,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/035%2520JAN-FEB%25201967.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014936683&usg=AOvVaw0yke6pPkJsG5WAH78TgubU)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 11 (Jan./Feb. 1967): 4; Condon, [pp. 285–286](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/scientificstudyo0000unse_l5t2/page/284/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014936994&usg=AOvVaw3BoQPtM_YQ-33cvNefDiWP))

January 16 — [Hippler](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65715202/robert-r-hippler&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014937281&usg=AOvVaw3PCNufZo349l8G6ql3dV0D) writes to [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014937548&usg=AOvVaw2L6fZ6KHr-2Mu9VA1lbBGd), saying that “No one knows of a visitation. It should therefore follow there has been no \[extraterrestrial\] visitation to date.” Moreover, Condon should “consider the cost of the Air Force program on UFOs, and determine if the taxpayer should support this for the next decade.” (Lt. Col. Robert H. Hippler, [Letter to Edward U. Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/HipplerLetters.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014937820&usg=AOvVaw1Pzfq6KBMYNj0B-PH2LB8j)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/HipplerLetters.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014938045&usg=AOvVaw38Vxt-uC4AGleomX2djM9z) January 16, 1967; Kevin D. Randle, “[The Hippler Letter,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2007/03/hippler-letter.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014938398&usg=AOvVaw0HUP_Akz0CarOBoldrhhUW)” A Different Perspective, March 21, 2007)

January 17 — Night. Francis Bedel Jr. is driving on State Highway 135 five miles north of Freetown, Indiana, when a glowing white light darts into his field of vision. It hovers above the road for a few seconds, then slowly reverses its course. Bedel is so busy staring at the spectacle that he loses control of his car, which goes off the road and is badly damaged. Phil Patton and his wife apparently see the same object, about 30 feet in diameter, that comes within 100 feet of their car on the same road. It has a brilliant red light and flashing ywllow and white lights on its perimeter. (NICAP, “[The 1967 UFO Chronology](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1967fullrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014938894&usg=AOvVaw2jLSCiIRx6rugSv-ot-CuM)”; “[UFO Caused Car Wreck?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201967%252001%252000%2520-%2520January-February.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014939326&usg=AOvVaw1rS-ZLpArvrr2AKCJRkTpM)” APRO Bulletin, Jan./Feb. 1967, p. 1)

January 18 — 6:00 p.m. A family in Shamokin, Pennsylvania, watches through binoculars a disc with a red light on a projection at the rear approach them at about 400–500 feet altitude. As it nears, the object emits two pinkish-white light beams downward at about a 45° angle from its forward edge. It then turns, rises suddenly, joins a second object, and both speed away. (Donald E. Keyhoe and Gordon I. R. Lore Jr., UFOs: A New Look, NICAP, 1969, [Appendix D](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/newlook/appendD.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014939948&usg=AOvVaw0TSmibhJEGEc8oWYUzRVTI))

January 19 — 9:05 a.m. Tad Jones is driving a truck in Dunbar, West Virginia, when he sees a dull, aluminum sphere about 20–25 feet in diameter hovering about 4 feet above the road some 500 feet ahead of him. It has two antennae protruding from the top and two legs beneath it, with a propellor between them that rotates slowly when hovering (but faster when flying). There is a window at the top and a flange in the middle. When he gets to about 10 feet of it, the object ascends swiftly. (“[Major Sighting Wave,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/035%2520JAN-FEB%25201967.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014940445&usg=AOvVaw0evmeXenjJB_HYzMd3Yohe)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 11 (Jan./Feb. 1967): 4)

January 20 — 6:30 p.m. Three girls (Kimberly Lodge, Ellen Kenney, and Janice Shafer), 16–17 years old, are driving near Methuen, Massachusetts, when they see a string of 9–10 bright red lights on a dark object that is moving over a field. The object hovers and swings around, revealing lights of a different color and configuration. When the girls stop to watch, their car stalls and the radio and lights go off. It has four glowing lights in the shape of a trapezoid,

* * *

with red lights on top and white lights forming the base. The lights appear to be reflecting off a metal surface. The object starts moving slowly and then shoots away at high speed. A second car about 3 miles away also sees 7–8 bright lights flying low. (NICAP, “[Car Stalls after Girls See UFO over Field](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/670120methuen_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014941184&usg=AOvVaw0oqeRH7CMsbXdiysHz9TnR)”; “[Major Sighting Wave,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/035%2520JAN-FEB%25201967.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014941546&usg=AOvVaw2hLFmw-QvBDpzUMPEOFUJQ)” UFO Investigator 3, no. 11 (Jan./Feb. 1967): 3–4; Raymond Fowler, UFOs: Interplanetary Visitors, Prentice-Hall,

1974, pp. 138–143)

Late January — [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014942240&usg=AOvVaw3v93KR7LyBZjxeqtnBLGtW) is lobbying [Frederick Seitz](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Seitz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014942640&usg=AOvVaw1Ms6z4fgPNiXQmb8Q7NazQ)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Seitz&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014942933&usg=AOvVaw2491tqtvWj-yR_MlUIhOU0) president of the National Academy of Sciences, with some mild criticisms of the Colorado project and the establishment of a UFO research panel. Seitz is not convinced. (Clark III 698)

January 24 — 5:25 p.m. A 14-year-old boy in Yorba Linda, California, sees an object shaped like a top hat apparently hovering above houses across the street. It seems large and cylindrical, dull metallic, and has four legs. He grabs a camera and snaps a photo of the object, which has started moving away. (Ann Druffel, “[The Yorba Linda](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-SI%25201973%2520N%25205%252CUFO%2520Encounters.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014943513&usg=AOvVaw09XijvTA4tx-9loYv6qEuo) [Photograph,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-SI%25201973%2520N%25205%252CUFO%2520Encounters.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014943934&usg=AOvVaw32a6NsA8l_nassy3DqYmrb)” in Charles Bowen, ed., UFO Encounters, special issue no. 5 of FSR, November 1973, pp. 26–35; UFOEv II 286–287; Patrick Gross, “[Yorba Linda, California, January 24, 1967](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://ufologie.patrickgross.org/htm/yorba.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014944489&usg=AOvVaw3-evwXQDJ1yCxuKmDeV6-f)”)

January 25 — [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014944883&usg=AOvVaw2r98s8ld_CEsiFiXzHVGtP) gives a talk in Corning, New York, and says: “It is my inclination right now to recommend that the government get out of this business. My attitude right now is that there’s nothing to it … but I’m not supposed to reach a conclusion for another year.” [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014945277&usg=AOvVaw2hgWxMXa_vMfxRlKRr2PP9) is astonished by Condon’s remarks. (“[Most UFOs Explainable, Says](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95440493/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014945623&usg=AOvVaw0oDOQgpVl7sW2dHtvMjyRG) [Scientist,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/95440493/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890014945921&usg=AOvVaw3-J5UKmOJwcu8JY9kCPzMH)” Elmira (N.Y.) Star-Gazette, January 26, 1967, p. 19; UFOs Yes, 117–119)
