The witnesses shift their position and can still see the light hovering in the northwest. The light is now seen as circular with hazy edges and about half the diameter of the full moon. At about 7:00 p.m. it moves at high speed to the north. The mother calls the radar station at Kalamunda, which simultaneously gets a request from Perth Airport to check out an unidentified echo on their meteorological radar. The Kalamunda operator sees a large echo some 9 miles away, which reappears for short durations on 5 further occasions and is last seen at 7:42 p.m. (Swords 397–398; Bill Chalker, “[1969: The Great UFO Daze of Oz,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://theozfiles.blogspot.com/2020/09/1969-great-ufo-daze-of-oz.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015389527&usg=AOvVaw3tOhvjPuAt6GKF6G-w00ky)” The Oz Files, September 19, 2020)

May 28 — [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015389812&usg=AOvVaw0gkYT76N6eHAJ4d9Oy4Lf3) presents a talk that is critical of the Colorado project at the Sacramento, California, section of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics. (James E. McDonald, “A Very Creditable Effort?” May 28, 1969; Story, [p. 415](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/414/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015390088&usg=AOvVaw0baX2A3vc4CHY99DLN8i_h))

May 31 — The Midwest UFO Network (later Mutual UFO Network) is founded in Quincy, Illinois, by [Walter H. Andrus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152550777/walter-harrison-andrus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015390395&usg=AOvVaw1OZmKCmf01SvS-0Dm-xOpg) [Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152550777/walter-harrison-andrus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015390629&usg=AOvVaw0nvul6pQsw69_pzogZLnoM)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152550777/walter-harrison-andrus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015390825&usg=AOvVaw0v9muOC6biokf9PchKPsU1) who leaves APRO and takes many of its members with him. It is conceived as a grassroots organization with state and local leaders overseeing activities and investigations. Allen R. Utke, associate professor of chemistry at Wisconsin State University, is selected as the first MUFON Director (Clark III 784)

June — Although President [Richard Nixon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Nixon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015391227&usg=AOvVaw0wBXCsmZrIPrfV36Qn56gW) does not trust [J. Edgar Hoover](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015391483&usg=AOvVaw2t2ly4GVcJbcxsDw-nIiSl)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Edgar_Hoover&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015391663&usg=AOvVaw07qRPdReYfwQVMMi1-gO51) he accepts the FBI’s help through an “intelligence letter” program, codenamed INLET. This program is not only intended to provide the president with domestic and international security issues, but also, “items with an unusual twist or concerning prominent personalities which may be of special interest to the President.” Nixon orders seven wiretaps on his staffers. (John Greenewald, “[INLET (Intelligence Letters) Reports, 1960s and 1970s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.theblackvault.com/documentarchive/inlet-intelligence-letters-reports-1960s-and-1970s/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015391960&usg=AOvVaw38l47RyVb-tomTalAJmqr_)” The Black Vault, May 7, 2020)

June 10 — [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015392249&usg=AOvVaw3LAsMr6a2ofAcC0mBbLZlc) gives a public talk sponsored by NICAP in Washington, D.C., on “UFOs Unsolved: A Scientific Challenge.” (James E. McDonald, “[UFOs: Unsolved: A Scientific Challenge,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kirkmcd.princeton.edu/JEMcDonald/mcdonald_nicap_061069.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015392532&usg=AOvVaw0JmLVRduOv8jHSVUJCwxLC)” June 10, 1969; Story, [p. 415](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/414/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015392766&usg=AOvVaw2ZBqq_cFp3QPr20mL7D_Q5))

June 11 — [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015393032&usg=AOvVaw0eauKhRjAMeruBVFEdccng) meets privately with representatives on the Air Force Office of Scientific Research in Arlington, Virginia, urging a new look at the UFO problem. (Story, [p. 415](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/414/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015393303&usg=AOvVaw2fCOZ52ORMlXwBY1yjTocq))

June 17 — 2:00 a.m. Kaneto and Kioko Nobutoshi witness a “brilliantly illuminated window” hovering in the air in Ibiúna, São Paulo, Brazil. It appears to be 30 feet in diameter, 10 feet high, and illuminates a small part of the ground. The sighting lasts 45 minutes, with the object stationary all the time. It then vanishes. Later examination of the ground underneath reveals a circle of flattened grass, 25 feet in diameter, swirled counterclockwise, with some small secondary swirls. (Hans Bemelmans, “[Reports from Ibiuna,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015393640&usg=AOvVaw3plfU-t4OaTRACC0kdFkgH)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1970): 15–19; Terry Wilson, “[1969: Ibiuna,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://oldcropcircles.weebly.com/brazil-1969-ibiuna.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015393938&usg=AOvVaw1Ekjux5Rsb9XjP2X-3CYOa)” Old Crop Circles)

June 17 — Turkish Air Force pilot Süleyman Tekyildirim is ordered to intercept a UFO above his base in Turkey in a US- built F-5A Freedom Fighter. He flies above it, thinking it is a meteorological balloon because it looks gray and like an upside-down light bulb. However, it moves to his left and takes off at fantastic speed. He tries to reach it, but it eludes him and speeds away. (Good Need, [p. 299](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/298/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015394268&usg=AOvVaw2q8yYq4SkCQNPSCLL3rLmH))

June 19 — 12:25 a.m. Radio/TV engineer Robin Peck is driving a van just north of Bircham Newton, Norfolk, England, when his headlights and motor fail. He looks under the hood, feels some “static electricity,” and his hair stands on end. He looks up and sees a bluish, upside-down-mushroom-shaped object hovering 100–150 feet over the trees on a nearby farm. It has an orange glow around it. Peck feels that the air is electrified. His luminous wristwatch glows intensely and unnaturally. After about one minute the object takes off and disappears rapidly. The van’s electrical system returns to normal. (Peter Johnson, “[Auto-Stop near Docking,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-CH%25201971%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015394606&usg=AOvVaw0YJuB5Ch3-jd26JHqzjY4O)” Flying Saucer Review Case Histories, no. 5 (June 1971): 1–2; UFOFiles2, [p. 81](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n133/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015394943&usg=AOvVaw3GEt7Zpr7vR4Jtya-8upXk))

* * *

June 19 — 11:50 p.m. Arthur Hendry, 17, is getting ready to cycle home near Docking, Norfolk, England, when he hears a strange whistling noise above him that intensifies and becomes a powerful throbbing. His muscles feel frozen or paralyzed as if he is receiving a severe electric shock. After a few seconds the noise stops, and he feels normal again. (UFOFiles2, [p. 81](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/the-ufo-files-the-inside-story-of-real-life-sightings-david-clarke/page/n133/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015395361&usg=AOvVaw0X6P8g1l7c84FmjBGcdZ6-))

June 26 — 2:30 p.m. Sr. Benedito, a justice of the peace, is walking along a trail about 4 miles northwest of Ibiúna, São Paulo, Brazil, when he hears a humming noise like a swarm of bees. He sees an odd object rocking from side to side that suddenly drops into the brush out of sight. Thinking it is an accident, he approaches to within 20 feet and sees the landed object, which then ascends, hovers a moment, and takes off in a gentle climb. He hears the humming sound again and feels a blast of air as it moves away. The Brazilian Air Force investigates the landing, and UFO investigator Hans Bemelmans finds some scorched grass in the thickly tangled brush. (Hans Bemelmans, “[Reports from Ibiuna,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015395715&usg=AOvVaw1EghqLqZvvbhO9gno5LZmX)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1970): 15–19)

July — After a series of UFO sightings and landing traces are reported in the area around Ibiúna, São Paulo, Brazil, the Brazilian Air Force informs local officials who are investigating the reports that they must not “under any circumstances give any information on UFO activity to any press, radio, or television reporter or representative. This is a matter of national security, and all press releases will be made by the Brazilian Air Force Public Relations Department.” (Hans Bemelmans, “[Reports from Ibiuna,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015396145&usg=AOvVaw3A2wcRwS83io6-GdbxJMld)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 1 (Jan./Feb.

1970): 15; “[Brazil: Censorship of UFO Reports,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201973%2520V%252019%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015396513&usg=AOvVaw0bhj0kLlAlKz6h7wSxX7wG)” Flying Saucer Review 19, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1973): 29)

July or August — 1:00 a.m. A US Marine private named [Earl Morrison](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/35225416/earl-morrison-1970/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015396897&usg=AOvVaw3AbXy4NBynnIXT-l3j1JvT) is on guard duty with other soldiers in a bunker near Da Nang, Vietnam, when they see a black, naked woman with bat-like, glowing wings moving through the air toward them. It flies about 6–7 above their heads. She soon starts flapping her wings and flies away. (“Don Worley, “[The Winged Lady in Black,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR-CH%25201972%2520N%252010.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015397209&usg=AOvVaw33WqiivB2NdIgC3PRAVVsJ)” Flying Saucer Review Case Histories, no. 10 (June 1972): 14–16; Clark III 779)

July 4 — 8:00 p.m. Two children, Mauricio Gnecco and Enrique Osorio, in Anolaima, Colombia, see a glowing object about 900 feet away. It approaches to within 180 feet and the children run over the hill to tell other children and adults. Thirteen people, including their father, return to see the object. Arcesio Bermúdez takes a flashlight with him and returns in terror after seeing a small person and a craft that lights up and flies away. Within 2 days, Bermúdez loses all appetite, his skin temperature drops, blue spots appear on his skin, and his stools become bloody. Within a week, two Bogotá physicians, unaware of his UFO experience, concludes he has gastroenteritis. Within hours of his exam, Bermúdez dies. His doctor claims he has previously been in good health. His injuries suggest a fatal whole-body ionizing radiation dose of 300–500 rems. Likely only X-rays, gamma rays, or neutrons could travel a distance of 45 feet through the air. (“[UFO Observed at Farmhouse in Colombia,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201969%252007%252000%2520-%2520July_August.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015397736&usg=AOvVaw1xMx-_xJaFUWk00canCEPH)” APRO Bulletin, July/Aug. 1969, pp. 1, 4–5; Story, [pp. 23–25](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofuf0000unse/page/22/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015398054&usg=AOvVaw0jwsyhPOj8MzGURM0sx9Mc); Clark III 253, 950; “[Colombia: Arcesio Bermúdez, the Man Killed](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://inexplicata.blogspot.com/2015/12/colombia-arcesio-bermudez-man-killed-by.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015398343&usg=AOvVaw1rcJUGGZY3vqDaT86xht-a) [by a UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://inexplicata.blogspot.com/2015/12/colombia-arcesio-bermudez-man-killed-by.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015398605&usg=AOvVaw172EJYw6z9uZKeaLd4DaSu),” Inexplicata, December 14, 2015; Cristian Ávila Jimenez, “[La misteriosa muerte de columbiano 3 días](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.eltiempo.com/colombia/otras-ciudades/ovni-avistamiento-y-desaparicion-de-hombre-en-anolaima-cundinamarca-363292&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015398896&usg=AOvVaw0ysR97u8nfJ70sorQ3DD98) [después de ver supuesto OVNI,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.eltiempo.com/colombia/otras-ciudades/ovni-avistamiento-y-desaparicion-de-hombre-en-anolaima-cundinamarca-363292&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015399183&usg=AOvVaw01ULj7ChuokUNmSZDL7vM_)” El Tiempo (Bogotá), August 20, 2021)

July 11 or 18 — 8:30 p.m. Economics student Tim Oliver is near a golf course on the outskirts of Beaufort, Victoria, Australia, when he sees a red “star” over a hill about a mile away. On closer inspection, it proves to be a hovering UFO. He quickly goes home, and by the time he returns with his mother in the family car, the UFO has been joined by another identical object. They are moving about 20 mph to the southeast, 50 feet in the air, 200 feet apart, and nearly parallel to some high-powered electrical lines. As they drive to right outside the golf course, both UFOs apparently respond to their presence by turning toward them but soon resumed their parallel course when Oliver turns the car engine off. Oliver walks to within 50 feet of the leading object. Each is about 30 feet in diameter, saucer-shaped, with an upper flat-topped cupola and about 24 square windows through which comes the bright red light. They are completely silent. Both he and his mother (who has watched from the golf course fence) see the UFOs disappear to the southeast, still flying parallel to the power lines. (Bill Chalker, “[1969: The Great](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://theozfiles.blogspot.com/2020/09/1969-great-ufo-daze-of-oz.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015399629&usg=AOvVaw1cvXTO_zMvf8je___bDvxg) [UFO Daze of Oz,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://theozfiles.blogspot.com/2020/09/1969-great-ufo-daze-of-oz.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015399874&usg=AOvVaw3kszwpALb3Fm3YB8zi0cJ2)” The Oz Files, September 19, 2020)

July 12 — Contactee [Paul Solem](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88132621/paul-renshaw-solem&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015400218&usg=AOvVaw1NfjGJbhZ-epPuso5fjfIt)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88132621/paul-renshaw-solem&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015400429&usg=AOvVaw1pOvMTaPHsab2OT6KTCLWU) who has been speaking to Shoshone-Bannock Indians at Fort Hall Indian Reservation in Idaho about a migration of Indian peoples and the coming of a True White Brother, publicly calls for the appearance of the flying saucer beings. Many people, including Idaho State Reporter Barbara Boren, see two “star-like moving lights” high in the air. (Barbara Boren, “[Blast Rocking North America to Start Indian](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/96384818/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015400752&usg=AOvVaw0TN4nWSMEUmX-o68bqJvX6) [Migration,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/96384818/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015400954&usg=AOvVaw1HrUTceBvUSBeE8xVgnmBB) [Says Self-Styled Seer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/96384864/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015401154&usg=AOvVaw2AhWmXQAc5kQyGNXLszCId)” Pocatello Idaho State Journal, July 16, 1969, pp. 1, 8; Clark III 1094)

July 12 — 11:00 p.m. Patti Barr and Kathy Mahr, two teenage cousins, hear a loud roaring noise at Van Horne, Iowa, while upstairs in their house. They look out the window to see a reddish-orange ball of light rotating and spinning counterclockwise above the adjacent soybean field. The next morning, they tell Pat’s father, farmer Warren Barr, who then discovers a 24-foot-diameter, nearly bare oval in the soybean field. The plants’ leaves are severely dehydrated, dry, and brittle. This case was investigated by several groups at the time; localized intense heat or

* * *

radiation is listed as most likely cause. (“[Sight UFO over Benton County Farm,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/96385504/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015403870&usg=AOvVaw38aS_TgaldSBvxgPjT03_a)” Cedar Rapids (Iowa) Gazette, August 6, 1969, p. 4C; NICAP, “[The 1969 UFO Chronology](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/chronos/1969fullrep.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015404217&usg=AOvVaw0WrN2QUaCyi2VnPV2eIl8D)” and \[[photos](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/images/690713vanhorn.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015404453&usg=AOvVaw3zb4_qHsrbxjYCraslehJL)\]; “[UFO over Iowa Bean Field,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201969%252007%252000%2520-%2520July_August.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015404729&usg=AOvVaw0VHVf14DGQmShoaR_1Kx5c)” APRO Bulletin, July/Aug. 1969, pp. 1, 4; J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 149–150](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/148/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015405108&usg=AOvVaw22QhJqGgv4TVJ5q6cJy2-P); Kevin D. Randle, “[The Iowa UFO Landings,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://etcetrasetcetras.blogspot.com/2008/06/iowa-ufo-landings.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015405385&usg=AOvVaw12OmQzndJ7fazU5JWkUF8G)” Official UFO, July 1976)

July 13 — Early morning. Edgar Paquette and Mrs. Leo Edwards are driving near Petawawa, Ontario, when they see a bright star that lights up the Ottawa River next to them. Convinced the light is following them, Paquette turns off the headlights, which makes the object appear to hesitate. But he gets out of the car, causing the interior light to go on, and the object descends to within 60 feet of the ground. When he starts signaling it with a flashlight, it comes even closer, and Paquette sees that it is 8 feet in diameter with two legs beneath it. Both of them panic and drive home, dragging their teenage children out of bed to look at the light. Ontario police officers Jack McKay and Grant Chaplin follow the light for 38 minutes as it travels at a high altitude. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 83–84)

Mid-July — Bernard O’Brien is cutting grass in a field with his tractor near Manotick, Ontario, when a small cloud of smoke rises from the ground as he passes over a particular spot. He notifies the field’s owner, John Fox, who comes out for a look. Fox finds three near-perfect circles in the field, two together and the third nearly 150 feet away. Each of them are rings of affected grass 15–20 feet in diameter and about a foot wide. Grass is flattened inside the circle, but the rings themselves are dark and contain a crystalline substance. [Peter Millman](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Millman&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015405930&usg=AOvVaw321eX23G8A9ElvGF7cZdhT) of the National Research Council claims that the circles are caused by the fairy ring mushroom (Marasmius oreades) because an analysis of the crystalline substance shows no evidence of mineral content or radioactivity. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 187–190)

July 16 — 3:30 p.m. Sylvia Annola, 10, sees a large gray object with blinding lights descending above a well on her family’s farm near Abee, Alberta. She looks directly at the object, which is only about 10 feet away, and experiences a temporary loss of vision. (Yurko Bondarchuk, UFO Sightings, Landings, and Abductions, Methuen, 1979, pp. 50–53)

July 21 — The Apollo 11 Lunar Module lands the first astronauts on the moon, Neil Armstrong and [Buzz Aldrin](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buzz_Aldrin&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015406563&usg=AOvVaw27r4ZUqfYozpxrXafnapqz). (Wikipedia, “[Apollo 11](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_11&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015406790&usg=AOvVaw2R2YrWe2uz0zo4alsHJWAi)”)

August — 1:45 p.m. James D. Appleman is driving on the Pennsylvania Turnpike when he notices a dome-shaped, metallic object hovering in the clouds ahead. He stops the car and gets his camera out of the trunk, but by that time the object is gone. (“[Did a Twin Photograph a Twin UFO?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1981_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V2.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015407144&usg=AOvVaw1Nw6B_mOvjykySm11DADkr)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 3, no. 1 (January 1981): 1)

August 22 — The National Amateur Astronomers Association hosts an open forum in Denver, Colorado, “Science and the UFO,” with presentations by [James A. Harder](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Harder&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015407485&usg=AOvVaw3BtmawX2GyWQvm6B8Mdjf0)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Harder&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015407664&usg=AOvVaw3GtEdunH0_CZTgBjkkdPhM) [R. Leo Sprinkle](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2021/11/leo-sprinkle-has-died.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015407890&usg=AOvVaw1NOoK29wlgiVkSQ0ON9mrB)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kevinrandle.blogspot.com/2021/11/leo-sprinkle-has-died.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015408085&usg=AOvVaw0xc0Gc3QSLPUjxB9BKGjCo) [J. Allen Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015408298&usg=AOvVaw3-YKNwKrk-YITD6QvG_or6)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015408474&usg=AOvVaw20zZkYhkGbc92jFK3K8U6X) [David Saunders](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://psycnet.apa.org/record/1993-27194-001&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015408675&usg=AOvVaw3uQmjKt23X_VoyOZZbdeCL), [James](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015408878&usg=AOvVaw14AhU7gBBUz74Wf8dat5Us) [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015409080&usg=AOvVaw0OcfZNmaby2j_sYx2jp2so)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015409258&usg=AOvVaw0Y2KYODaMF4iGtKr7DN0S0) and [Frank Salisbury](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_B._Salisbury&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015409463&usg=AOvVaw0TQF9dgAGRjseU7v98Lrat)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_B._Salisbury&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015409637&usg=AOvVaw2eSymkIbyoREXr0R9Y9pup) When asked how many of the 500 people assembled have had a UFO sighting, about 75 hands go up. (“Scientists Urge New UFO Studies,” Fate 23, no. 4 (April 1970): 38–48; George W. Earley, “Astronomers Raise Their Hands,” IUR 24, no. 4 (Winter 1999): 29–30)

August 29 — 6:20 a.m. Norman Vedaa and a passenger are driving along Interstate 80S \[now Interstate 76\] about 70 miles east of Denver \[putting them roughly near Fort Morgan, Colorado\]. They notice a brilliant, yellow-gold object hovering high in the air. They manage to take two photographs before it speeds away. Ground Saucer Watch concludes from its density profile in the photos that it is a solid object. (William H. Spaulding, “[Observational Data of an Anomalistic Aerial Phenomenon,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201976%2520V%252022%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015410089&usg=AOvVaw1MwQ2kDz2PGSjstjcIUsmo)” Flying Saucer Review 22, no. 1 (May 1976): 12–17)

August 30 — Afternoon. Future ufologist [Bill Chalker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Chalker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015410433&usg=AOvVaw0bUDTWJOIKcUlIEaPxXpvc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Chalker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015410610&usg=AOvVaw1fMDpg9zq4dKdNgYeMX2td) 17, is relaxing on a surfboard in the middle of the Clarence River in Grafton, New South Wales. He notices streams of fine filament coming down out of the sky over the river. He collects some samples, seeing no spiders, but the material dissipates into nothing. He later learns that other people, including his parents, watched an elongated white UFO moving at right angles to the filament fall. (Keith Basterfield, “Angel Hair: An Australian Perspective,” IUR 27, no. 1 (Spring 2002): 7; Clark III 124–126; Bill Chalker, “[1969: The Great UFO Daze of Oz,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://theozfiles.blogspot.com/2020/09/1969-great-ufo-daze-of-oz.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015410933&usg=AOvVaw0r6gjYqYxmY2wxJGkc6OTZ)” The Oz Files, September 19, 2020)

August 30 — 7:30 p.m. Ion Hobana is at the North Railway Station in Bucharest, Romania, when he sees a triangular object rise from behind the station building. It is a dull orange color and moves with one of its sides facing forward. Three smaller globes trail it in a straight line. The object travels to the right and disappears after a few seconds. (Hobana and Weverbergh 179–180)

August 31 — Day. An RAAF Canberra bomber chases but fails to catch a UFO over northern New South Wales. The plane is dispatched from RAAF Base Amberley near Ipswich, Queensland, after hundreds of people in Kygole and along the Darling Downs report the object, which is shaped like an aluminum Zeppelin. Some witnesses observe the object for 3 hours as it hovers above towns and farms. The UFO speeds away when the Canberra tries to close in on it. (“[RAAF Chase UFO over Darling Downs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Australia/UFOIC%2520Newsletter/UFOIC%2520Newsletter%2520-%2520No%252026%2520December%25201969.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015411404&usg=AOvVaw3AxcrNsDZ9ctWpbSXvwpja)” UFOIC Newsletter, no. 26 (December 1969): 4)

* * *

September 4 — A farmer, [Bert O’Neil](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/187660764/bertram-george-o_neil&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015411856&usg=AOvVaw3VX1HQQKw3RtQDU1h7ObNw), discovers a circular patch of dead and silvery-white manuka plants (Leptospermum scoparium, tea tree) in the midst of otherwise green and lush growth on a remote section of his farm near Ngatea, New Zealand. Near the center of the circle, he finds three ground indentations, positioned so as to form the inside points of a triangle. Off to one side is the taller stand of tea tree, also bleached and dead. He remembers seeing this from afar three weeks earlier, arousing his curiosity. The dead scrubweed within the circle is still standing and undisturbed. It looks as if some large object has come down from the sky and landed on three long stilts. At first, O’Neil only discusses his find within the family, but the news quickly leaks to the local radio and press. (Harold H. Fulton, “[The Ngatea Mystery Circle, 1,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015412218&usg=AOvVaw0wpBWAibMzH6b4c5ch9Ii2)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1970): 27–28; Harold H. Fulton, “[The Ngatea Mystery Circle, 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015412540&usg=AOvVaw3A5yC54_rydw7-N4dt4A33)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 3 (May/June 1970): 32– 33; Harold H. Fulton, “The Ngatea Mystery Circle: Terrestrial or Extraterrestrial?” UFOcus NZ, 2010)

October — NICAP obtains a copy of a chapter of a textbook in use at the US Air Force Academy, Introductory Space Science, for the academy’s Physics 370 course. The last chapter is on “Unidentified Flying Objects” and concludes that the “UFO phenomenon appears to have been global in nature for almost 50,000 years” and considers the “unpleasant possibility of alien visitors to our planet, or at least of alien controlled UFO’s.” It recommends keeping an “open and skeptical mind.” (“[AF Academy Teaches Students UFOs Real,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/UFO%2520Research%2520Newsletter%2520(Lore)/UFO%2520Research%2520Newsletter%2520-%25201971%252004%2520-%2520Vol%252001%2520No%252001.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015413147&usg=AOvVaw2M3DumE-XxQunofCCKPerg)” UFO Research Newsletter 1, no. 1 (April 1971): 1; ClearIntent, [pp. 13–14](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/clearintentgover00fawc/page/12/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015413469&usg=AOvVaw3wqpmMb8-gJXkCi-vGQrtG); Good Need, [p. 230](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/230/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015413692&usg=AOvVaw2lg2A_QuYgHEUbvyUqEwNI))

October 3 — After 8:00 p.m. RCMP Constable S. B. Barrie and his wife Vivian are driving 5 miles west of Rennie, Manitoba, on a poor highway in bad weather. He stops to clean mud off the headlights and noticees a light to the east hanging just off Highway 44 and over the trees. He continues driving and he sees the light as a light-pink inverted saucer moving with a jerky motion. Now only 500 feet away, it seems to be 20 feet in diameter with an odd white tail that snakes toward the ground. Suddenly the car’s windshield wipers stop working, the headlights go out, and the engine stalls. Barrie gets out of the car and the object zooms silently to the southwest and is lost to sight. He senses the air has a strange, heavy odor, but he is able to get the car started again. (Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 81–82)

October 8 — A large area of St. Louis, Missouri, is blanketed by a pure-white, sticky substance ranging from dime-size to 10-foot-long streamers. The majority of it sublimates on ground contact. The Smithsonian concludes it is caused by ballooning spiders, even though only one spider specimen is found. When a sample is tested by Wayne E. Black of the St. Louis County Health Department, he finds the samples test negative for protein, the basic composition of spider web. (Washington Post, March 28, 1970; “[A Classic Case of ‘Angel-Hair,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Pursuit%2520-%2520SITU%2520(Sanderson)/Pursuit%2520-%2520No%252012%2520-%2520Vol%252003%2520No%25204%2520-%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015414317&usg=AOvVaw3y60mquhejqdjNMwCPh4Eg)” Pursuit 3, no. 4 (October 1970): 72–73)

October 20 —Brig. Gen. [Carroll H. Bolender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49125065/carroll-h-bolender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015414738&usg=AOvVaw1CNeQ6YTdNYZoaLVxNmuaw)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49125065/carroll-h-bolender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015414953&usg=AOvVaw26j2d0w3Udgm-5f3qXin5s) USAF Deputy Director of Development, writes a draft document saying that the “continuation of Project Blue Book cannot be justified either on the ground of national security or in the interest of science.” Bolender adds that “reports of unidentified flying objects which could affect national security are made in accordance with JANAP 146 or Air Force Manual 55-1 and are not part of the Blue Book system.” This is a clear indication that Blue Book is only a front for a classified UFO project. (Brig. Gen. C. H. Bolender, “[Unidentified Flying Objects (UFO),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/docs/Bolender_draft.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015415213&usg=AOvVaw2dUF2Fp20WYO2gDp6gdBvH)” October 20, 1969; Swords 336)

October 24 — 12:43 a.m. A Chilean Navy destroyer is moving north at 20 knots in the South Pacific Ocean about 350 miles south of Valparaiso, Chile. The radar officer reports a target rapidly approaching the ship, apparently moving 213 miles in one minute, which would indicate a speed of 12,780 mph. At 12:47 a.m., the target is only 12 miles away, and it suddenly breaks into six targets. The officer in charge and five other personnel can now see one massive and five smaller lighted objects approaching the ship. The large UFO looks like a big box with semicircles on the side, and it is bigger than the ship, which is 360 feet long. The five smaller objects are egg- shaped, bluish, and no more than 8 feet long and 5–6 feet wide. At about 6,000 feet from the ship, the smaller objects move away from the larger one, three to portside and two to starboard, and begin flying in ellipses between the ship and the large object. At 900 feet away, the officers can hear the object make a humming noise. The ship’s power and instruments go dead as the large object passes overhead. Bright red lights under the UFO seem to be moving back and forth inside the craft, visible through a half-circle on the bottom. “Corn cobs” with green or turquoise pulsating lights are on the side. When the UFO is 600 feet away, the power comes back on.

The smaller objects, never coming closer than 1,500–3,000 feet, fly around the ship and join up with the large object on the other side. All 6 objects vanish about 2 miles away. At least 8 minutes have passed, with three radar technicians tracking the UFOs. The ship’s commander orders everyone to keep silent about what they have seen. The sighting is deleted from the ship’s log. The six witnesses are debriefed for two days in Valparaiso by two Chilean Navy officers and four Americans who are allegedly naval attachés with the US Embassy. (NICAP, “[Six](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/691024chile_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015415677&usg=AOvVaw146wNxAIJ055gIUdwBxSRw) [Objects Observed and Tracked by Destroyer](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/691024chile_dir.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015415899&usg=AOvVaw3Wbu44pBKBoxYVDBo4p0ZP)”; Bill Chalker, “[EM UFO Incident off Chile in 1969,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201986%252001%252000%2520-%2520Vol%252033%2520No%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015416183&usg=AOvVaw0-VHDoGzIH0adqD30pAUn1)” APRO

* * *

Bulletin 33, no. 3 (January 1986): 7–8; Bill Chalker, “An Extraordinary Incident off Chile,” IUR 10, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1985): 4–6; Bill Chalker, “[EM UFO Incident off Chile in 1969 (Conclusion),](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201987%252004%252000%2520-%2520Vol%252033%2520No%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015416712&usg=AOvVaw3Q0u4Dq3iuYeL56M6VTr7q)” APRO Bulletin 33, no. 5 (April 1987): 5–6)

October 24–27 — The Turkish Air Force is inundated with reports of UFOs over Ankara, Turkey. Jet fighters are scrambled from Mürted Air Base \[now closed\] northwest of the city and close to within 7.5 miles, but the objects always pull away and climb higher. Even the base commander, Ercüment Gökaydin, flies with the interceptors to 35,000 feet, but the UFO is at a height of 50,000 feet. It is a silvery, oval disc. The jets take gun-camera film, which has never been released. One pilot says the object has three round portholes. (Good Need, [p. 299](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/298/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015417100&usg=AOvVaw3jki_MNpUK6kikD_A0qge8))

October 27 — NICAP Assistant Director [Gordon I. R. Lore Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.coasttocoastam.com/guest/lore-gordon/95941&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015417394&usg=AOvVaw05zEsAjxhhcbxie5AzYRdi) writes board member [Joseph B.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/68816370/joseph-beckwith-hartranft&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015417693&usg=AOvVaw0Mec-SpftCwhO04JitSt9P) [Hartranft Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://realtvufos.blogspot.com/2018/10/ufo-audio-file-press-conference-march.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015417953&usg=AOvVaw3vj00kOFzlN1uSezPLPyLl) an 11-page letter outlining the organization’s difficulties. He alerts the board of directors to the growing financial crisis brought on by [Donald E. Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015418211&usg=AOvVaw1VKsyrUolgFSk2HZ_aBCgF)’s failure to keep adequate books and records. He urges the hiring of a business director. In the summer he had gotten permission from Keyhoe to fire five of NICAP’s eight employees as a cost- saving measure. (Clark III 794)

October 30 — 10:00 a.m. Mr. and Mrs. Chapin are driving at their mine site near Redding, California, when they see a rattlesnake in the road. As they get out to go to the mine and kill the snake, they find the area oddly hot. They notice a disturbance in the brush some 60 feet away in a flattened area of mine tailings. An egg-shaped object rises noiselessly a few feet off the ground and takes off down the canyon, swaying but not striking small trees. Soon it zooms upward at a sharp angle and is out of sight in seconds. They find a shallow, oval, depressed spot less than 2 inches deep and 10 feet across in the mine tailings. A conical pile of unusual-looking sand is also discovered, and two days later they find a metallic glob about the size of a fist nearby. They have the material analyzed in 1977. Scattered about in the unusual sand pile are irregular bits of pale-green glass-like material made of nearly pure silicon. The metal glob is completely black on the outside and 77% copper in the interior, combined with tin and traces of silver, chromium, and other metals. Both are considered foreign to the geology of the mine site. (“The Redding, California CE II Case,” IUR 3, no. 3 (March 1978): insert)

November 8 — Australian physicist O. H. “Harry” Turner has been working with other scientists to set up a “rapid intervention team” for the RAAF to investigate UFO physical evidence. In a memo to the director of the Joint Intelligence Bureau, he indicates he is working with John Morton of Australian National University, John Symonds from the Australian Atomic Energy Commission, and [Michael Duggin](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://theozfiles.blogspot.com/2017/01/the-australian-scientist-who-was-potent.html&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015418796&usg=AOvVaw3236tinb1LzHu85qS4GXwT) of the National Standards Laboratory. The plan is soon dropped by the JIB. (Bill Chalker, “The Australian Government and UFOs,” IUR 22, no. 3 (Fall 1997): 21; Swords 396–397)

November 9 — The D-21 drone makes its first reconnaissance mission over China, launched from a B-52. It flies over the Lop Nur Nuclear Test Base in Xinjiang but strays off course into Siberia and crashes. (Wikipedia, “[Lockheed D-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_D-21&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015419175&usg=AOvVaw1TlEs0NAvLlAUCnBSSNuDD) [21](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_D-21&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015419398&usg=AOvVaw2eqcRC3eHPAl6_0n6bpkFI)”; Jacobsen, Area 51, [p. 223](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/area51uncensored0000jaco/page/224/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015419649&usg=AOvVaw21n3lQhRc8CsdzPTNlm_qm))

December 3 — The NICAP board of governors demands [Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Keyhoe&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015419950&usg=AOvVaw2fsCqqkhawov1Ptt92Azcv)’s resignation. He retires, under protest, at age 72.

Leading the effort is board chairman Col. [Joseph Bryan III](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015420277&usg=AOvVaw2PsKzAZ-ocp0-kWENlSqZc)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015420486&usg=AOvVaw0mn5-9tQ7SSljzS67eejq2) who takes over as acting president. (“[Major Keyhoe](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/050%2520MAY%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015420733&usg=AOvVaw2vum-S2c_MZ9QFSQw2J7kD) [Retires,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/050%2520MAY%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015421033&usg=AOvVaw2rs6ObncX_yjvfIY496AEO)” UFO Investigator, May 1970, pp. 1, 3; “[NICAP Redeploys,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/050%2520MAY%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015421364&usg=AOvVaw16ybqDrTyfZQ4V2Sc6QUY6)” UFO Investigator, May 1970, p. 1)

December 5 — [Bryan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.encyclopediavirginia.org/Bryan_Joseph_III_1904-1993&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015421729&usg=AOvVaw0I4NG0cQ1UBxBkCuOpA3Er) dismisses NICAP Assistant Director [Gordon I. R. Lore Jr.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.coasttocoastam.com/guest/lore-gordon/95941&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015421993&usg=AOvVaw2OLlFhit_Fb5lkFcWU0Cbn), replacing him with G. Stuart Nixon as secretary-treasurer. (“[Major Keyhoe Retires,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/050%2520MAY%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015422279&usg=AOvVaw1iF8dW7KcQD_M8IC2YzIoM)” UFO Investigator, May 1970, pp. 1, 3; Clark III 794)

December 17 — Air Force Secretary [Robert Seamans](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Seamans&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015422626&usg=AOvVaw0MSWjxct1TKF2cd_lmwwEK) announces the termination of Project Blue Book, based on the Condon report, the NAS endorsement, and “past UFO studies.” He repeats the [Bolender](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49125065/carroll-h-bolender&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015422896&usg=AOvVaw0_sL-WY26m6GbTIVRhmzqR) wording that Blue Book “cannot be justified either on the ground of national security or in the interest of science.” Technically, Blue Book does not terminate until January 30, 1970. Blue Book records are moved to Maxwell AFB in Montgomery, Alabama, in a building that requires security clearance to enter. Eventually, the files, minus the witness names, are consigned to the Modern Military Branch, Military Archives Division, National Archives, Washington, D.C. (Office of Assistant Secretary of Defense, “[Air Force to Terminate Project ‘Blue Book,’](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/waves/1969BB_Termination.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015423179&usg=AOvVaw22OZVjc3-lwEIYe7SfL95C)” December 17, 1969; “[Air Forces Closes Study of U.F.O.s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1969/12/18/78549297.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015423431&usg=AOvVaw2FpOUkcFBEzPwsvhUoevHW)” New York Times, December 18, 1969, pp. 1, 41; “[The Book Is Closed,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/050%2520MAY%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015423726&usg=AOvVaw0uX41C7nj1Fcbp4_ojS9_x)” UFO Investigator, May 1970, p. 3; [Sparks](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.nicap.org/bb/BB_Unknowns.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015423982&usg=AOvVaw0SzEXe3QyrbzJ_awdPt5iY), p. 3)

December 18 — [Condon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Condon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015424247&usg=AOvVaw0fOkSY8v6hUb-kRNNe0htT) is quoted in the New York Times that his investigation “was a bunch of damn nonsense,” and he is sorry he “got involved in such foolishness.” (“[Air Forces Closes Study of U.F.O.s,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1969/12/18/78549297.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015424574&usg=AOvVaw2NwDByCjj1hRveCvzvCqZ3)” New York Times, December 18, 1969, pp. 1, 41)

December 26–27 — The American Academy for the Advancement of Science holds a special two-day segment on “Unidentified Flying Objects” at its annual meeting in Boston, Massachusetts, at the Sheraton Hotel. The program is arranged by [Thornton Page](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thornton_Leigh_Page&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015424915&usg=AOvVaw2Bz78Kohx9hVbC67gmtUt3) (NASA Manned Spacecraft Center), [Philip Morrison](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Morrison&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015425155&usg=AOvVaw0-joOdHxwQgO3wD5SBIoLX) (MIT), [Walter Orr Roberts](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Orr_Roberts&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015425393&usg=AOvVaw13T5ST9zf6GBHuKJWUIoq0) (University Corporation for Atmospheric Research), and [Carl Sagan](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Sagan&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015425654&usg=AOvVaw3iIA0spU5Cv8Qrj-3HJ_nq) (Cornell). Rising to the occasion, [James E.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015425900&usg=AOvVaw3D4RI5TfVpDMt3nu4zvMWA)

* * *

[McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015426188&usg=AOvVaw2-tzNOu6bGUaFK4dTIDK3A) presents an excellent critique of the Air Force and Colorado project investigations as well as an in- depth examination of the RB-47 and Lakenheath-Bentwaters cases. [Donald Menzel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Howard_Menzel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015426507&usg=AOvVaw2cobqQdmWYeeOzfVcvaS1e) attempts to show that all UFO sightings can be explained, even though some of his “explanations” are complex. Morrison discusses the nature of hard evidence and concludes that reliable UFO reports would stand up both in a court of law and in the rigors of science. Cornell University Press publishes the proceedings, UFOs—A Scientific Debate, in 1972. (James E. McDonald, “[Science in Default: Twenty-Two Years of Inadequate UFO Investigations,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://kirkmcd.princeton.edu/JEMcDonald/mcdonald_aaas_69.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015426858&usg=AOvVaw1lm3YDt6pbEp9SLACq8PkZ)” December 27, 1969; Walter N. Webb, “Allen Hynek As I Knew Him,” IUR 18, no. 1 (Jan./Feb. 1993): 9–10; Clark III 100–101)

December 28 — A man named Patric is driving from Midland to Windsor, Ontario, on heavily snowed roads after an accident has blocked the main highway. Suddenly, his car engine, headlights, and radio fails, and he crawls to a halt in front of a star-like glow with a prismatic, multi-colored aura 100 feet ahead. Inside the glow is a domed object. A loud humming noise commences and the object shoots into the sky. The car comes back to life, but Patric inexplicably reaches Windsor one hour late. (Jenny Randles, “The Twelve UFOs of Christmas,” Fortean Times 374 (Christmas 2018): 29)

1970

1970 — [Ivan T. Sanderson](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ivan_T._Sanderson&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015427612&usg=AOvVaw3R0NicMvBDwPzm14sEY2wT) publishes his last UFO book, Invisible Residents, which compiles reports of unusual objects seen in or around bodies of water. He speculates that such cases need not involve the presence of extraterrestrials, but possibly an indigenous intelligence that evolved independently in the oceans. (Ivan T. Sanderson, [Invisible](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015428020&usg=AOvVaw33yuBQAB4zc2j2eEyF3gVj) [Residents](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015428292&usg=AOvVaw1jRrD9aLUC0WVaOc_Ubvst)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.scribd.com/document/429706119/Invisible-Residents-The-Reality-of-Underwater-UFOs&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015428513&usg=AOvVaw0wJk4X8ScauCZTW0NjTQpn) World, 1970; Clark III 1028)

1970 — [John A. Keel](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Keel&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015428803&usg=AOvVaw0hyw8s8YkDMY4h5uBbFUgA) publishes UFOs: Operation Trojan Horse, in which he presents a theory that UFOs are produced by ultraterrestrials—beings who are able to manipulate matter and our senses and who in the past manifested themselves as fairies or demons. (John A. Keel, [UFOs: Operation Trojan Horse](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/whyufosoperation00keel/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015429122&usg=AOvVaw03i6uj-kswcK0wzvdmq-sY)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/whyufosoperation00keel/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015429313&usg=AOvVaw0bQ2mdvAP2oq-vT8rL4ozo) Manor Books ed., 1976; Wikipedia, “[Operation Trojan Horse](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Trojan_Horse_(book)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015429547&usg=AOvVaw0zA9yLzZVl1JRDrReBIbwV) [(book)](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Trojan_Horse_(book)&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015429740&usg=AOvVaw2nspNOVXrDZCZi6xPhCsJe)”)

1970 — The CIA is testing a small drone aircraft in the shape of a bird at Groom Lake, Nevada. Called Project Aquiline, the agency wants to fly a reconnaissance UAV over key intelligence targets, such as ICBM sites and nuclear test grounds in the Soviet Union and China, without detection. At least one of the prototypes is flown from Area 51 more than 20 times. The project is cancelled in 1971 before deployment and has never been declassified. (Wikipedia, “[Project AQUILINE](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_AQUILINE&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015430067&usg=AOvVaw0wUFVAOkCrZqSJkS-cUfNv)”; David Hambling, “[Area 51’s Robotic Spy Bird,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.wired.com/2007/11/its-a-bird-it/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015430303&usg=AOvVaw28rpdpi7rLZGEy4aLHRud0)” Wired, November 6, 2007)

1970 — UFO-Sverige is formed as the first nationwide UFO organization in Sweden; it is essentially an association of 20 UFO groups in different parts of the country. The secretary’s office is located in Skånninge. It publishes the magazine UFO-Information from 1969 to 1980, then UFO-Aktuellt beginning in 1980. (Wikipedia, “[UFO-](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO-Sverige&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015430751&usg=AOvVaw1sYDqXSh0i4lg4r_s6a9x2) [Sverige](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://sv.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO-Sverige&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015430958&usg=AOvVaw28cblW9gbZd5PbVdc4TtEQ)”; [UFO-Information](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/UFO_Information/1969/1969-1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015431195&usg=AOvVaw3hf0IMrs-vQmVxQVkZgk6i)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Sweden/UFO_Information/1969/1969-1.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015431410&usg=AOvVaw1hmLXzlrhkx9bo_-ZfI_PO) no. 1 (October 26, 1969); C. Göran Norlén and Johan Gustavsson, “[Tidskriften](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/om-ufo-sverige/tidskrifter/tidskriften-ufo-aktuellt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015431710&usg=AOvVaw2bsWVjW8HPBncZb4Zw6tOa) [UFO-Aktuellt](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/om-ufo-sverige/tidskrifter/tidskriften-ufo-aktuellt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015431946&usg=AOvVaw30neZoRG3kSnSlWQWSpuac)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ufo.se/index.php/om-ufo-sverige/tidskrifter/tidskriften-ufo-aktuellt&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015432153&usg=AOvVaw3-45CZ8TycH5gFTtNuSS0f)” Riksorganisationen UFO-Sverige)

1970 — The crew of a US Air Force C-5A Galaxy transport, flying at 500 mph at 37,000 feet, encounters a UFO over Moula Idris, Saudi Arabia \[=Moulay Idriss Zerhoun, Morocco?\]. An RAF officer on detachment is flying the aircraft, and he describes the object as like two saucers joined together, surrounded by red, green, and yellow and flying at 75,000 feet. (Good Need, [pp. 298–299](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/needtoknow00good/page/298/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015432494&usg=AOvVaw23oa6fXxX2mCZ7_81BXSAE))

Early 1970 — 10:00 p.m. A peasant in the Taijiang(?) District of Fujian province, China, sees a metallic, pan-shaped object land behind a hill. It radiates a brilliant green light, and a strange musical tone emanates from it. After he reports it, the local army commander mobilizes hundreds of soldiers who attempt to surround the object. After about one hour, the object emits a bright white light and takes off vertically. (Wendelle Stevens and Paul Dong, UFOs over Modern China, UFO Photo Archive, 1983, p. 56)

Early 1970s — 2:30–3:00 a.m. Two young men in Furnace Creek, California, are followed by a red ball of light the size of a beach ball. They get scared and run ahead to their house, slamming and locking the door behind them. The ball stops at the edge of their yard, hovering and oscillating in size. After 4–5 minutes, the ball moves away and creates a vortex, causing stones to rise and circle in the air. They can hear the sound of the stones hitting together. Then the light blinks out, and the rocks crash down onto the road. (Michael D. Swords, “Timmermania: A Step Too Far into the Timmerman Files?” IUR 27, no. 4 (Winter 2002–2003): 9)

January 1 — 5:00 a.m. Registered nurse Doreen Kendall is looking out a window at the Cowichan District Hospital in Duncan, British Columbia, and sees a bright, Saturn-shaped object about 50 feet in diameter hovering one story above her, about 60 feet off the ground and 40 feet away. It has a row of lights around its middle. She can see two humanoid figures in dark, tight-fitting clothing and wearing headgear in the upper portion. One stands at an instrument panel, with the other behind it. The second being looks directly at Kendall, then touches the first being,

* * *

who moves a lever, apparently causing the craft to tilt down and provide a view of its interior. Kendall calls for other witnesses, who arrive in time to see the UFO leave. (“[Human-Like Pair](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/96422142/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015433435&usg=AOvVaw1JJwbb3TkQsz8WaKUb5lv2) [in Saucer,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/96422267/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015433697&usg=AOvVaw1D0JVMdrhXGoC2ZiwrBJUD)” Victoria (B.C.) Daily Times, January 5, 1970, pp. 1–2; “[UFO Occupants Seen near Hospital,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/Canada/Canadian%2520UFO%2520Report%2520(Magor)/Canadian%2520UFO%2520Report%2520-%2520vol%25201%2520no%25207%2520-%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015434056&usg=AOvVaw21YoxKee3MteM10YknZPkA)” Canadian UFO Report 1, no. 7 (Summer 1970): 3–12; UFOEv II 459–460; Chris Rutkowski, Canada’s UFOs: Declassified, August Night, 2022, pp. 139–

146)

January 7 — 4:45 p.m. Two skiers, lumberjack Aarno Heinonen and farmer Esko Viljo, at Imjärvi, Finland, watch a disc- shaped, buzzing UFO approach them and hover. It is so close to Heinonen that he could touch it with his ski pole. From an opening in the center of the object’s bottom, a bright light beam is emitted, creating an illuminated area of 3 feet in diameter on the snow beneath it, edged with black. A red gray mist descends again; when it clears, both men can see, only 10 feet away, a 3-foot tall humanoid creature standing in the illuminated area, carrying in its hands a black box with a pulsating yellow light. Its arms and legs are very thin, its face pale like wax, and its nose hooked; it wears a light green coverall with darker green knee boots, white gauntlets, and a conical metallic helmet. Then the mist again descends, and long red, green, and purple sparks float out from the lighted area. A sort of flame rises from this spot and enters the UFO; then the mist and the UFO vanish. After this experience, Heinonen finds his right leg numb, and he vomits and passes black urine; Viljo also suffers severe physiological effects. Heinonen claims, two years later, a series of contacts with a female spacewoman. (Sven-Olof Fredrickson, “[Finnish Encounter in the Snow,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015434629&usg=AOvVaw0KyyTlYlK9zmmSW1DhCWql)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 31–32; “[Finns Observe UFO](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201970%252007%252000%2520-%2520July-August.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015434997&usg=AOvVaw2C2vOfSro6Adm4_YjR-3u1) [Occupant,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/APRO%2520Bulletin/APRO%2520Bulletin%2520-%25201970%252007%252000%2520-%2520July-August.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015435289&usg=AOvVaw1GQojKeiWAaxLbSzJIkz_q)” APRO Bulletin, July/Aug. 1970, pp. 6–7; Sven-Olof Fredrickson, “[A Humanoid Was Seen at](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015435597&usg=AOvVaw3_I_Iy_TqNnVGZ3uc2kWip) [Imjärvi,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015435835&usg=AOvVaw2d-YmmuomDjKhHRaWQBhZh)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 5 (Sept./Oct. 1970): 14–18; Sven-Olof Fredrickson, “[More on the Imjärvi](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015436134&usg=AOvVaw26o4ZgMlE-t61OEKizCT0i) [Case,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015436371&usg=AOvVaw2ZWAYmekVTv6nz4sF8GDIf)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1970): 22; Anders Liljegren, “[The Continuing Story of the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201980%2520V%252026%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015436668&usg=AOvVaw2pwPqpx4nmaTX3NiMhTYkT) [Imjärvi Skiers, Part 1,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201980%2520V%252026%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015436944&usg=AOvVaw2FNUzJhtIhCpe--8sb10oi)” Flying Saucer Review 26, no. 3 (September 1980): 15–17; Anders Liljegren, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201981%2520V%252026%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015437267&usg=AOvVaw0zuxiqwHs4OcMWXoLlkXpO) [Continuing Story of the Imjärvi Skiers, Part 2,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201981%2520V%252026%2520N%25205.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015437508&usg=AOvVaw3nrBsHDNbswWx7KEUxC84a)” Flying Saucer Review 26, no. 5 (January 1981): 18–20; January 21 — The UFO Subcommittee of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics sponsors a panel that meets in New York City to discuss differing viewpoints on UFOs. Among the panel members are [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015437916&usg=AOvVaw1w4v8oEc61zH1rnUyy3RUE)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015438124&usg=AOvVaw1_gS92unWZtf-m93E6PU39) [McDonald](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015438417&usg=AOvVaw2u64IYn17lX4r_kCeRVWOV)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_E._McDonald&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015438666&usg=AOvVaw0MVTdN2O8D6maW9XtFAiPI) [Thornton Page](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thornton_Leigh_Page&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015438973&usg=AOvVaw2p1-EFn_I_bGu2TOS6Xr4f)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thornton_Leigh_Page&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015439253&usg=AOvVaw1JPqxebuwM2jl7BDRjMaKz) [Gordon D. Thayer](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/t/ThayerGordonD/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015439580&usg=AOvVaw2fzBYLearP74e0Yk17p390)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://rr0.org/people/t/ThayerGordonD/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015439834&usg=AOvVaw2R13wOvOj9KukB5TJjU9mx) and [Philip Klass](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_J._Klass&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015440159&usg=AOvVaw1FLH_mdU9oIAqAbkuVCb1A)[.](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_J._Klass&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015440437&usg=AOvVaw3ryVSo9_Ui5CUrn7_hztyY) The subcommittee, led by [Joachim P. Kuettner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joachim_Kuettner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015440760&usg=AOvVaw27rjLEkmpk2WSSgqAeABCf), consists of scientists with no previous position on UFOs and reaches several middle-of-the-road conclusions. It criticizes the NAS position that the ETH is the least likely explanation and rejects McDonald’s position that it is the “least unsatisfactory.” It criticizes the Condon report, in which the conclusions do not match the data, and recommends a moderate-level, ongoing study of UFOs. (“[UFOs, an Appraisal of the Problem: A Statement by the](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ufoevidence.org/documents/doc594.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015441156&usg=AOvVaw1kZCGFfNrvos6uL3zlpRbm) [UFO Subcommittee of the AIAA,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ufoevidence.org/documents/doc594.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015441563&usg=AOvVaw2Oqea3SLxC9IwLoqhkJipa)” Aeronautics and Astronautics 8, no. 11 (November 1970): 49–51; Clark III 101–102)

January 29 — A Uruguayan professor of socioeconomics takes a photo of a cigar-shaped object in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Analysis shows that it was probably a streetlamp. (“[A Street Lamp, or Sign, Or,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1983-84_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015442202&usg=AOvVaw1PCFLC81VhvvCYSBVccmu9)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 4, no. 3 (June/July 1983): 1; “[Rio de Janeiro 1970 Photograph Termed Streetlamp,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://cufos.org/CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter/1983-84_CUFOS_Associate_Newsletter_V4.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015442738&usg=AOvVaw0dQMh70Qn_t0hcdeFEn7sO)” CUFOS Associate Newsletter 4, no. 6 (Dec. 1983/Jan. 1984): 3, 7)

January 30 — 3:30 p.m. Project Blue Book’s doors close as its office is staffed for the last time. The files have been packed in boxes and are on their way to the Air Force Archives at Maxwell AFB in Montgomery, Alabama. (“[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/050%2520MAY%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015443388&usg=AOvVaw2Qwkg9c6pNxXpmqXZ4Lbwg) [Book Is Closed,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.cufos.org/UFOI_and_Selected_Documents/UFOI/050%2520MAY%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015443708&usg=AOvVaw0cfgyOXCWbOMfK-N4L8KE_)” UFO Investigator, May 1970, p. 3)

March 28 — 11:00 p.m. About 30 UFO spotters gathered on Cradle Hill, just outside Warminster, Wiltshire, England, see a flashing purple light. One of their sensors buzzes, indicating a strong magnetic field, and one observer (Norman Foxwell) takes photos that appear in the July/August 1970 Flying Saucer Review. But the UFO is actually a light beam from a high-intensity purple spot-lamp operated by a group of UFO debunkers, among them physicist David

I. Simpson. Foxwell himself is part of the skeptical group (having pre-exposed a spurious UFO image), as is the individual who operated the bogus magnetic-field sensor. The hoax is revealed six years later. (John C. Ben, “[Photographs from Cradle Hill,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015444309&usg=AOvVaw0U7h5izoJgXUeVWLk9kc8C)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 4–5; Percy Hennell, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015444691&usg=AOvVaw0zpzx3AVINixbO2kQ2KQys) [Warminster Photographs Examined,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015444968&usg=AOvVaw3A-pHtHssevjpXCoMgYcuu)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 6–7; Charles Bowen, “[What the Eye Sees,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25204.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015445286&usg=AOvVaw1t9dO_HHz_CcWZeoQGsnmk)” Flying Saucer Review 16, no. 4 (July/Aug. 1970): 7; Pierre Guérin, “[Warminster](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015445666&usg=AOvVaw07ljKo66o0C7vOR7CfCvwZ) [Photographs: A Tentative Interpretation,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201970%2520V%252016%2520N%25206.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015445993&usg=AOvVaw1NAzFWyg3wGBauTPzUJXGz)” Flying Saucer Review 15, no. 6 (Nov./Dec. 1970): 7–8; Charles Bowen, “[Progress at Cradle Hill,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015446500&usg=AOvVaw2tvoy0EKGa-BYxAekvyqpW)” Flying Saucer Review 17, no. 2 (March/April 1971): 11–12; S. E. Scammell, “[A](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015447019&usg=AOvVaw3trGw7Gh2h9bFNFUcilyPP) [Surveyor’s Criticism,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015447406&usg=AOvVaw2a-tU_gXmJBYpr6o6MFLgN)” Flying Saucer Review 17, no. 2 (March/April 1971): 13; John E. Ben, “[Continued](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015447844&usg=AOvVaw2GaV4DQtyNFhNPDT19dIkM) [Investigations at Warminster,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015448210&usg=AOvVaw3c7yXHo1WkmBTpE43GRpQC)” Flying Saucer Review 17, no. 2 (March/April 1971): 14–16; Terence Collins, “[A](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015448685&usg=AOvVaw1Nup6aM-Pcqgb2U42B_jjO) [Further Examination of the Warminster Photographs,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015449040&usg=AOvVaw2M5r3IKaz9pOYp4wewc_SO)” Flying Saucer Review 17, no. 2 (March/April 1971): 16– 18; Michael Samuels, “[Unexpected Photographic Effects at Warminster,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25202.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015449540&usg=AOvVaw1bCsO1TT_NPJ1SbNmC8PIb)” Flying Saucer Review 17, no. 2 (March/April 1971): 18–21; David I. Simpson, “[Experimental UFO Hoaxing,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/MUFOB%2520(New%2520Series)/MUFOB%2520-%2520New%2520series%2520-%2520No%252002.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015450113&usg=AOvVaw0wqazy7hZ0gnGUpkdeHFkj)” MUFOB, new series 2 (March

* * *

1976): 3–6, 11–12; David I. Simpson, “[Controlled UFO Hoax: Some Lessons,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://skepticalinquirer.org/1980/04/controlled-ufo-hoax-some-lessons/&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015450815&usg=AOvVaw3L4KHsAYv5os50VbfZxvsM)” Skeptical Inquirer 4, no 3 (Spring 1980): 32–39; David Clarke, “The Warminster Syndrome,” Fortean Times 331 (October 2015): 40–47; David Clarke, How UFOs Conquered the World, Aurum, 2015; Steve Dewey and Kevin Goodman, History of a Mystery: Fifty Years of the Warminster Thing, Swallowtail, 2015; Clark III 602–603)

April 29–30 — Around midnight. Several independent groups of witnesses to the west of Lake Anten, Västra Götaland, Sweden, watch a red, glowing sphere fly around the lake and neighboring areas. It occasionally sends out a beam of light to the ground. Some of the observers get the impression that the beams originate on the ground rather than from the object. The next morning a few of the observers get into boats and sail to the spot where the sphere was seen hovering. In one corner of the garden of an isolated farmhouse named Enebacken, they find three round marks, one foot in diameter and 1.5 inches deep, burned into the ground in the shape of an equilateral triangle. A UFO group in Gothenburg, Sweden, takes soil samples to a laboratory for gamma-ray testing and finds significant non-background radiation at a peak that seems to derive from cesium-137, a radioactive isotope. (Sven-Olof Fredrickson, “[A Landing near Lake Anten?](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25201.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015451876&usg=AOvVaw14lPECb4JHJbC6mW0A5Y5P)” Flying Saucer Review 17, no 1 (Jan./Feb. 1971): 13–17)

May 5 — Although the Air Force is no longer involved with UFOs, the Foreign Technology Division at Wright-Patterson AFB in Ohio continues to contract [Hynek](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Allen_Hynek&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015452501&usg=AOvVaw18uW0VPUSDeh4beJXP-UHX)’s services as a “special consultant” on atmospheric phenomena. He reports to Col. [George R. Weinbrenner](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72741517/george-ryan-weinbrenner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015452868&usg=AOvVaw2RDV9lhr6wzWhqo5vX4KSd)[,](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/72741517/george-ryan-weinbrenner&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015453196&usg=AOvVaw1wkjowR75P2DeQg5dPvNE_) whom he visits every once in a while in Dayton. He continues with the contract through 1974. (Jennie Zeidman, “I Remember Blue Book,” IUR 16, no. 2 (Mar./Apr. 1991): 12, 23; Thomas J. Carey and Donald R. Schmitt, Inside the Real Area 51, Tantor Media, 2013, pp. 203–213)

May 14 — 9:45 p.m. A graduate engineering student in Bangor, Maine, notices two nocturnal lights in the Ursa Major constellation moving in a counterclockwise circle around a common center at a constant velocity. They abruptly stop moving, leaving them in a north-south position. After a short time, they move away from each other, then the light moving south suddenly halts. The other light is moving slower than a meteor but faster than a jet aircraft. (J. Allen Hynek, The UFO Experience, Ballantine ed., 1974, [pp. 48–49](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://archive.org/details/ufoexperience00jall/page/48/mode/2up&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015453907&usg=AOvVaw31oBr_fXU5oJawCioRIRbl))

May 29 — John L. Acuff, an experienced manager but not a UFO researcher, becomes the new president of NICAP. He is the former executive director of the Washington, D.C.-based Society of Photographic Scientists and Engineers \[now the Society for Imaging Science and Technology\], which has cooperated with NICAP on photoanalysis but also has military and CIA connections. Acuff and G. Stuart Nixon dismantle the NICAP system of affiliates and state subcommittee system that have promoted the organization for years. Regional members are told to operate independently from one another; cooperation is discouraged. Criticism of the government’s UFO policy is no longer permitted and NICAP turns into a mere “sighting collection center.” Nixon is appointed executive director. (“[NI-CIA-AP or NICAP?](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520States/Just%2520Cause%2520(CAUS)/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520Old%2520Series/Just%2520Cause%2520-%2520Vol%25201%2520Issue%252007%2520-%2520Old%2520Series.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015454659&usg=AOvVaw2Hs5wzJb5XBt7GAV-lJucF)” Just CAUSE 1, no. 7 (January 1979): 5–13; Richard H. Hall, “[The Quest for the Truth](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/hall-IUR1994.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015455084&usg=AOvVaw2rI4xa5aL0Ad1bj8ITFYNI) [about UFOs: A Personal Perspective on the Role of NICAP,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.nicap.org/papers/hall-IUR1994.htm&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015455325&usg=AOvVaw137jOx4MwPN58u12q4TUia)” in 1994 MUFON UFO Symposium Proceedings, MUFON, 1994, pp. 185–201; Clark III 794)

June — Contact (UK) begins publishing The UFO Register, a journal edited by [J. B. Delair](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.innertraditions.com/author/j-b-delair&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015455760&usg=AOvVaw2KYosKo56W9QHzdRxZBHf7) that focuses on sightings and data. It continues sporadically until 1995. ([The UFO Register](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://files.afu.se/Downloads/Magazines/United%2520Kingdom/UFO%2520Register%2520(UK%2520Contact)/UFO%2520Register%2520-%2520Vol%252001%2520part%25201%25201970.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015456105&usg=AOvVaw0_CH6IhELzzJT1ZUVvbHvq) 1, part 1 (June 1970))

June — 12:45 a.m. A truck driver is approaching Emerald Beach, New South Wales, when he sees a bright light on he ocean side of the highway. A circular object rises from behind some woods 1,600 feet from the road. It hovers for 30 seconds at an altitude of 66 feet. Relative to the trees, the object appears to be about 33 feet in diameter, and flames seem to shoot from its base. It slowly returns to the ground, where it is partially obscured by trees, but it continues to emit beams of light from its top and sides. Fearful, the driver leaves the area. Ufologist [Bill Chalker](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Chalker&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015456530&usg=AOvVaw30YNe1UBJvOL32HMqp7bmK) accompanies the witness to the landing site, where they discover six circles of dead grass of varying sizes and burned trees. (Bill Chalker, “Physical Traces,” UFOs 1947–1987, Fortean Tomes, 1987, p. 190)

June 13 — MUFON holds its first annual conference in Peoria, Illinois. Shortly afterwards, [Walt Andrus](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/152550777/walter-harrison-andrus&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015457044&usg=AOvVaw0xm1hfElVs6ve_1D7kAfIl) succeeds Utke as MUFON director. (John F. Schuessler, “A Brief History of MUFON,” November 28, 2018)

June 27 — 11:40 a.m. Aristeu Machado, his wife and children, and João Aguiar of the Brazilian Federal police, see a metallic, domed disc resting on the surface of the Atlantic Ocean about a half-mile off the coast of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Two humanoid figures are standing on the rim. After a while the object skims the surface of the water and takes off, lights flashing from the underside. Once airborne, the wife can clearly see the two occupants sitting inside. (UFOEv II 460; Brazil 128–130)

July — Afternoon. [John](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/147088221/john-w-pilichis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015457653&usg=AOvVaw36MeMh58LEaUhtTtOXX_9N) and [Mary Pilichis](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/147088222/mary-pilichis&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015457958&usg=AOvVaw1XEgu0xkeYCNYCAGL_KoA-) see a huge cigar-shaped object over their home at Rome, Ohio. At the same time, their daughter Bonnie and a friend are at a swimming pool about one-half mile away when they see 3 silvery discs flying end-to-end in the direction of their home. The parents then see the discs as well. The cigar and the

* * *

discs form a line and move into a large, peculiar cloud. After 3–4 minutes, the cloud begins to break apart, with no UFOs showing. (Ohio UFO Reporter, Sept./Nov. 1971; Herbert S. Taylor, “Cloud Cigars: A Further Look,” IUR 30, no. 3 (May 2006): 12)

July 4 — 3:00 a.m. A 33-year-old Port Monmouth, New Jersey, housewife wakes up and sees a “big round ball” with an “eerie white glow” hovering over the meadows across the street. She watches it bouncing back and forth for 15 minutes as a series of red lights flash in sequence across it. The size is about 25–30 feet wide. The streetlight has gone out and comes back on when the object leaves. Her son and brother-in-law later find three imprints 30–40 feet apart in the shape of a triangle in the meadow. They also find circles impressed in the grass, the largest 15–20 feet in diameter. Then they find tracks “going to the creek like they had dragged some small round thing into the ditch” as well as “two sets of a dozen imprints which were about two feet apart. They were curved like raindrops. It was very visible, the grass was all crushed down, there was mud on the banks of the creek, and there were signs of the tracks in the mud.” One week later, the light returns and crosses the field across the street. The family television, the car ignition, and the telephone behave strangely for days afterward. (Berthold E. Schwarz, “[The](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015458923&usg=AOvVaw1sDSRPWucgbNlaHQCnQawl) [Port Monmouth Landing,](https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.ignaciodarnaude.com/ufologia/FSR%25201971%2520V%252017%2520N%25203.pdf&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015459319&usg=AOvVaw0q1c8KG-RtioUPpo33e2qL)” Flying Saucer Review 17, no. 3 (May/June 1971): 21–27; Clark III 251–252)

July 23 — President [Nixon](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Nixon&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1674890015459840&usg=AOvVaw0abpc4io8Zm42Q0FLGP_Gm) makes it clear that he wants a major effort against domestic dissidents. At an Oval Office meeting in June with the Inter Agency Committee on Intelligence ([H. R.
